WATCH: The video that got News2Share suspended from YouTube - now with extra "countervailing views!"

Mar 11, 2021

Editor's note: Hey everyone! I'm out of YouTube jail!. . Last week, I was given a formal strike on my YouTube account for footage shot outside the Inauguration of President Biden. YouTube classified the video as "election disinformation.". . In the wake of January 6, very few activists gathered in Washington for the Inauguration. One group that showed up was the "Official Street Preachers.". . The group expressed views most would see as hateful particularly about sexual orientation, and even called a female YouTuber present there a sexist expletive.. . What I found interesting was that two men stood up for her by taking their shirts off. One was a well-known DC-based Antifa activist. The other was ostensibly a Trump supporter, and that's where I got in trouble.. . In order to avoid any further punitive action by the platform, I'd like to remind viewers that President Biden is the president of the United States, and for information about election integrity, you can visit CISA.gov/RumorControl.. . "I still believe that the election was stolen, but you sir, all of you, have been promoting the wrong form of Christianity," one person in the crowd yelled.. . This brief mention was the only reference to the election anyone made in the video. YouTube denied an appeal as well as public pressure campaign, and while my suspension is now over, the video now lives as a permanent warning on my account.. . In my view, the incident reveals a flaw on this platform of "punish first, ask questions later.". . My work is raw, and generally devoid of commentary. I don't think my viewers care what I personally think of the things I cover, and I'm happy not to tell them. YouTube's new standard that even documentary footage must include "countervailing views" on content that shows people who believe - for example - that the election was stolen, effectively makes it impossible to do primary source journalism.. . With that being said, you'll now see the original video, in its entirety, that I was suspended for the next week for. I'll be uploading several other videos that I shot in the past week but was unable to post shortly. Thank you for watching.". . Original video description: . . Members of the hard-right "Official Street Preachers" - who publicly ridicule people in the style of the Westboro Baptist Church - protested near the Capitol this afternoon during President Biden's Inauguration.. . When members called a scantily clad Black female Youtuber a "wh*re," they were confronted by two men who took their shirts off in protest. One was Paul 'Luke' Kuhn, a prominent antifa activist. The other identified himself as a Trump supporter who believes the election was stolen.. . "That woman you called a 'whre' is a woman," said the Trump supporter. "A human fcking being.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Ardel David, Dustin Gagne, and Emily Molli. . See more at http://News2share.com

Peaceful protests in Minneapolis as George Floyd death trial begins on March 8, 2021

Mar 11, 2021

Editor's note: This video was produced and published on all other platforms on March 8, 2021. At the time, News2Share's YouTube was erroneously suspended. . . Original Description:. . As jury selection began Monday for the trial of Derrick Chauvin, the officer who stands accused of murder in the death of George Floyd, peaceful protests took place in Minneapolis.. . Hundreds of activist demanded that Chauvin (and the other three officers involved who await a separate trial) be convicted, and that additional reforms be imposed in the direction of community policing.. . Jury selection was postponed after one hour when the prosecution argued for reinstating a third degree murder charge that had previously been dropped.. . Chauvin faces 40 years in prison on 2nd degree murder and manslaughter charges.. . Filmed by N2S Contributor Chris Juhn.. . Congressman Paul Gosar Election Results Opposition Speech in Phoenix, AZ on December 19, 2020

Feb 26, 2021

Note to YouTube: As described at the beginning of this video, this is documentary footage documenting an element of history for research, news, and historical purposes. It does not promote the views expressed therein, and includes a "countervailing view" from https://www.cisa.gov/rumorcontrol to more than adequately comply with community guidelines.. . On December 19th, I hired a freelance videographer to film for me at a so-called "Stop the Steal" rally in Phoenix, Arizona. Among the speakers was Congressman Paul Gosar, one of the most active voices in the period between the presidential election in 2020 and the inauguration in 2021.. . I posted the full speech to News2Share, which I believe is valuable to understanding the events that led up to January 6. YouTube removed the video, saying that because it is just raw footage of the congressman speaking, it lacks "countervailing views". . "Imagine this, that you get to go back home, once we conquer the hill. Donald Trump is returned to being the president," said Arizona Congressman Paul Gosar on the afternoon of December 19, 2020 in Phoenix at a rally for Trump.. . "Amazing things will happen in four more years.". . "Four more years!" the crowd chanted. . Livestream footage of January 6 morning at Capitol - Includes Warning

Feb 26, 2021

Note to YouTube: As described at the beginning of this video, this is documentary footage documenting an element of history for research, news, and historical purposes. It does not promote the views expressed therein, and includes a "countervailing view" from https://www.cisa.gov/rumorcontrol to more than adequately comply with community guidelines.. . The video has no violations of the community guidelines and has been cited by the New York Times: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2021/02/09/us/trump-voter-fraud-election.html. . This livestream footage shows the crowd assembling at the United States Capitol beginning at 9:17am on January 6. It ended at 10:51am after I migrated to the National Mall, where my connection failed.. . It was removed and a permanent warning-strike put onto News2Share's YouTube account for failing to include "countervailing views.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Interview: III% Militia Member turned "Boogaloo Boy"

Feb 24, 2021

On Saturday, News2Share covered an armed "Booglaoo" rally against ICE in Atlanta.. . The "Boogaloo" movement tends to consider itself outside of the political left or right, instead unifying under libertarian and anti-government beliefs, especially gun rights.. . One "Boogaloo" in attendance was familiar to News2Share. In 2019, we covered the more explicitly right-wing "III% Security Force" militia as they held a training exercise assembling various state chapters in the woods of West Virginia.. . We spoke to the III%er turned Boogaloo Boy about their similarities, differences, and his path from one movement to the other.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . One member of the public who recently moved to Texas confronted the group for their choice to carry firearms, which turned the event into an informal gun debate.. . Documentary Video: Alex Jones' participation in 11/14, 12/12, and 1/6/21 pro-Trump protests in DC

Feb 12, 2021

Note to YouTube: As described at the beginning of this video, this is documentary footage documenting an element of history for research, news, and historical purposes. It does not promote the views expressed therein, and includes a "countervailing view" from https://www.cisa.gov/rumorcontrol to more than adequately comply with community guidelines.. . Conspiracy theorist and radio host Alex Jones participated in all three "Million MAGA Marches" in the period between the 2020 presidential election and the Inauguration of President Biden.. . On November 14th, Jones was seen marching from Freedom Plaza to the Capitol with the protection of Proud Boys.. . On December 12th, Jones spoke at the "Jericho March" on the National Mall, an informal speech in front of the Supreme Court, and finally at the steps of the JW Marriott Hotel following the events.. . Jones promised Biden would be removed "one way or another" in his former speech, while clarifying that he did not mean violence while speaking later at night.. . On January 6, Jones could be seen marching from then-President Trump's speech at the Ellipse toward the Capitol where the insurrection later took place. Jones called for "non-violent civil disobedience" to occur.. . Filmed by Ford Fscher. . Protesters celebrate McConnell following fake press release saying he will vote to convict Trump

Feb 8, 2021

Three activists with the self-described "antifascist collective" Shut Down DC celebrated Senator Mitch McConnell outside his house Monday afternoon following a fake press release claiming he intended to vote to convict President Trump.. . McConnell has not said he would vote to convict and previously "yes" on a failed vote proposed by Senator Rand Paul to dismiss the impeachment charge.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Crowd reacts to Trump January 6 speech ahead of Capitol insurgency - Includes New Warning

Feb 6, 2021

A previous version of this video was controversially banned from the YouTube platform. Below is a statement to YouTube as well as the original text of the description.. . Statement to YouTube: "Hi, I'm Ford Fischer, Editor-in-Chief of News2Share. If you watch this channel frequently but aren't familiar with me, there's a good reason for that. I believe in using raw footage and livestream when possible to show what happens at the events I cover, while keeping commentary from myself absent. I prefer to let viewers watch and decide for themselves, while I make no claims as to whether the people I'm filming are right or wrong.. . This model has brought a politically diverse audience to my work, which I hope to continue building.. . On January 6, I filming the video you're about to watch. Ahead of the Capitol Insurrection, President Trump spoke for nearly 70 minutes, claiming that his election loss was the result of voter fraud. I filmed from within the massive audience, panning around to show their reactions. My footage showed the audience watching his speech beginning to end, and took no positions at all about Trump's claims.. . President Trump has now been impeached and faces trial Monday for alleged "Incitement of Insurrection." Both the Democratic Memorandum and former President Trump's lawyers' memo reference moments captured in my footage, although they interpret it differently. This is exactly why my video is raw, to let the viewers decide for themselves.. . The night before the House delivered the articles of impeachment to the Senate, YouTube took the video down, citing the then-president's claims heard in the video as election misinformation. I have had a weeks-long struggle with the platform to get the video back up, which escalated to them demonetizing my entire account, and remonetizing it after a sympathetic article by Fox News.. . In a new email, they tell me that while they're glad to reinstate my monetization, my footage of the then-president speaking can only be up if it "contains countervailing views, and/or additional news/reporting context must be present in the images or audio of the video itself." . . For that reason, I will cite the language YouTube has been putting on videos for the past couple months.. . As YouTube used to include under election-related videos, Joe Biden is the President of the United States: States certify results after ensuring ballots are properly counted and correcting irregularities and errors.. . As YouTube now includes under some videos: Robust safeguards ensure the integrity of election results. They link to https://www.cisa.gov/rumorcontrol to learn more, and I will include that link in the description.. . I hope that this warning suffices for YouTube to allow the video to remain online. Thank you for watching.". . Original video description text:. . "Uncut video shows how the crowd on the National Mall reacted to President Trump's January 6 speech ahead of the Capitol Hill insurgency.. . When Trump compared American elections to "third world countries" and called it a "disgrace," the crowd chanted "fight for Trump!". . "We fight like hell. We fight like hell because if we don't, we're not going to have a country anymore," President Trump said toward the end of his speech.. . "In spite of all that's happened, the best is yet to come," he said before calling for the march on the Capitol.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Ardel David, Dustin Gagne, and Emily Molli. . See more at http://News2share.com"

Conservatives Hold “Civil Disobedience” Rally Against Protest Restrictions At Washington Capitol

Feb 6, 2021

Conservatives led by activist Glen Morgan hold a civil disobedience protest against event restrictions at the state capitol building in Olympia, Washington. Filmed by Ford Fischer

Conservatives hold "civil disobedience" rally against protest restrictions at WA Capitol, Olympia

Feb 6, 2021

Conservatives led by activist Glen Morgan held a civil disobedience protest against recently imposed event restrictions at the state capitol building in Olympia, Washington on Saturday. Police had previously threatened pro-life and religious activists with arrests for holding demonstrations in the same area.. . On Friday, police confirmed to the group that in order to prevent the situation from possibly escalating, they would suspend the restrictions indefinitely. No violence or arrests occurred.. . The event was dubbed "Commit an Act of Free Speech.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Conservatives mistake each-other for "false flags" following rally in Olympia, WA

Feb 6, 2021

Following Saturday afternoon's "Commit an act of free speech" rally in Olympia, Washington, a few participants came to an unusual disagreement, accusing the others of being "fake Republican.". . Rally organizers had called for nobody to come in "militia" garb, and one activist came armed and wearing a mask.. . Ted Cooke, a two-time Republican nominee for Washington House of Representatives, told the armed man (who was accompanied by a friend also open carrying) he was "riding on the coat-tails of the Republican Party." . . "You're not a Republican" the armed man told him, before engaging in dialogue.. . Ultimately, the two men shook hands. "I thought you guys were false flag, you guys thought I was false flag, it was a misunderstanding. I apologize," said Cooke.. . "Ok, alright, thank you.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Feb 3, 2021

NOTE TO YOUTUBE MODERATORS: THIS VIDEO DOES NOT VIOLATE THE COMMUNITY STANDARDS IN ANY WAY. IT IS RAW FOOTAGE MEANT FOR HISTORICAL AND DOCUMENTARY PURPOSES ONLY. A DISCLAIMER IS INCLUDED REFERRING THE VIEWER TO "COUNTERVAILING VIEWS.". . The above and in-video disclaimers are necessary following Youtube saying News2Share footage of January 6 was removed "bc it didn’t include countervailing views or sufficient context of the claims made in the footage. As videos can be embedded across the web, we only allow this content to remain on the platform if there’s appropriate context within the video itself.". . https://twitter.com/TeamYouTube/status/1356760557454389249. . On January 6, 2021, as police had finished clearing the Capitol of pro-Trump demonstrators, but the Capitol grounds themselves were still occupied, protesters instead turned their attention and anger toward the media.. . On the east side of the Capitol, protesters approached a media encampment, forcing videographers to flee.. . Yelling "we are the media!" and "traitors get the F***ing rope", the Trump supporters demolished the broadcast and lighting equipment left behind.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . GameStop/Robinhood protest turns into 1st Amendment Audit at SEC HQ in DC

Jan 28, 2021

Investors on Reddit called for a protest at the SEC headquarters in Washington DC Thursday afternoon after stock broker application Robinhood halted buy orders for hotly traded stocks like AMC and Gamestop.. . Three protesters showed up and spoke to News2Share, while two Special Police officers assigned to the SEC tried to prevent N2S from filming toward the building itself. The ensuing conversation became a makeshift "1st Amendment Audit.". . "We all work for the corrupt" one of the officers said at 2:42 into this video.. . Even after going back inside, the officers returned back outside as News2Share continued to speak to Michael, an activist who arrived with a sign that read "Hold the line" along with the Reddit logo.. . Two additional activists also arrived, one in black bloc and the other an avowed communist.. . He says the recent market incident showed how hedge funds and the "ruling class" have class consciousness, and he says the working class need that too. He suggests unions, tenant organizations and debt/rent strikes as a solution.. . "It is a right moment for educating them," he said when asked about the unusual situation of a communist being aligned with a Reddit stock-trading community. "They're already starting to see that curtain get pulled away... we're just here helping them tear that entire curtain down.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Jan 18, 2021

A variety of pro-gun groups including Boogaloo activists, Black Panthers, Black Lives Matter 757, NoVa Proud Boys, the Ron Paul Militia, the Roanoke County Militia, and an armed transgender rights activist rallied in Richmond, Virginia on Monday, openly violating laws banning guns at protests and 20+ round magazines.. . There was occasional strife between groups, but the day remained mostly peaceful and police made no arrests.. . The event coincided with the pro-gun Virginia Citizen Defense League (VCDL's) annual "lobby day" for gun rights in Richmond. The VCDL previously encouraged armed turnout at their events, but stood down following the passage of new local ordinances banning guns at protests.. . Instead, they encouraged their followers to "caravan" around the city.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Jan 17, 2021

The activists oppose both President Trump and President-elect Biden, but spoke to both Biden and Trump supporters throughout the event.. . Jan 13, 2021

News2Share has obtained previously unreleased footage of a July 7, 2020 incident in which ATF Agent James Burk attempted to make contact with a member of the Columbus, Ohio community, who then called 911.. . When Columbus PD officers Joseph Fihe and Kevin Winchell arrived, Agent Burk did not comply with their commands, even at gunpoint. The officers tased Agent Burk in the process of subduing him.. . Agent Burk - who in 2015 was charged with shoplifting wine from a Kroger grocery story - is now suing the officers for excessive force.. . Pro-Wikileaks activists oppose Assange extradition at British embassy in DC

Jan 3, 2021

Supporters of Wikileaks gathered Sunday afternoon outside the British embassy in Washington DC to oppose the extradition of Julian Assange.. . "Free, free, Julian Assange!" they chanted. "There's only one decision, no extradition!". . "What do we want? Free Assange! When do we want it? Now!". . Comedian and activist Lee Camp led chants outside the British embassy before telling the crowd Julian Assange "set an amazing example of courage" and is dangerous to those in power.. . "There is absolutely no way he can be extradited here and get anything even pretending to be a fair trial," said Max Blumenthal of The Grayzone News.. . He claimed past attempts to spy on Assange's conversations with a lawyer and an alleged assassination plan mean fair trial impossible.. . Socialist activist Morgan Artyukhina asked "where does US overreach stop?" given that the United States is trying to have Assange - who is not American - extradited for allegedly violating United States law while not in the United States.. . "As a leftist, we need to be more loud about Julian Assange," activist Fiorella Isabel said. "The fact that more Republicans and Libertarians in our congress are fighting for free speech and standing up against censorship is a shame.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Following the "March for Trump" on Saturday night in Washington DC, an argument brewed between Proud Boys and their allies who were angry at the police against Trump-supporting women who backed the officers.. . As Proud Boys were mad at police for separating them from antifa activists, a Trump supporting woman said "police officers are good people.". . "This is why emotional woman should not be in the movement," they replied. "Misogyny is based. Get on board or leave.". . The Trump-supporting women were quizzed by male Trump supporters and Proud Boys on whether they support legal immigration. When they ssaid they do, they were retorted that legal immigrants will "subject you to being a minority.". . One Proud Boy told a woman they can talk "when you can speak to me without saying 'like' a thousand times.". . The argument turned back to police, who Proud Boys contend would enforce gun control but don't sufficiently police leftists.. . "It is women like you that have ruined this country" one male Trump supporter said before police escorted the women away.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . DC Gov't holds cleanup sweep at homeless encampment - NoMa 12/8/2020

Dec 8, 2020

The Department of Public Works held a cleanup sweep of a local homeless encampment in the NoMa area of Washington DC Tuesday morning. Activists monitored as MPD officers stood by, but DPW agreed to remove only trash and tents deemed unwanted by the homeless community.. . Residents had expressed concern that in previous sweeps, tents and resources that they had relied on were confiscated.. . Homeless community member Randy spoke to News2Share, explaining that his tent had been razed four times in the past three years.. . “They act like our lives don’t matter," he said of the government's actions during previous sweeps.. . He adds if it weren’t for media and volunteers “I think me and my wife would be sitting on concrete right now.”. . His pregnant wife was inside his tent with only candle for warmth. . . Editor's note: "I wouldn’t normally give info to send money to a subject I’m covering, but this is obviously a pretty distinct circumstance. Randy and his wife’s Cashapp is $lovely3387. I also have their Venmo, but because it’s simply a phone number, I’ll inform viewers upon request, but not post publicly.". . Filmed by Ford Fisher. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Trump supporters hold election results opposition Vigil / Prayer Rally for Trump in Atlanta, GA

Dec 6, 2020

NOTE TO YOUTUBE: THIS RECORDING SHOWS RAW FOOTAGE OF A SITUATION IMPORTANT TO NEWS AND DOCUMENTARY UNDERSTANDING AND CRITICISM ONLY. NEWS2SHARE DOES NOT ENDORSE ANY VIEWS CONTAINED HEREIN. THE VIDEO DOES NOT VIOLATE ANY COMMUNITY STANDARDS IN ANY WAY. NEWS2SHARE REMINDS VIEWERS TO SEE https://www.cisa.gov/rumorcontrol FOR ADDITIONAL COUNTERVAILING VIEWS.. . A coalition of pro-Trump activists, conservatives, and militia members gathered Sunday afternoon for a "Stop the Steal" vigil and prayer to advocate President Trump retain the presidency for a second term.. . The group - led by pro-Trump operative Ali Alexander - lit candles and prayed, often comparing President Trump to the biblical King David.. . About half a dozen militia activists, most carrying long guns, acted as security for the event. Occasional drivers passing the event yelled at the crowd, but no significant counter-protest occurred. Georgia State Troopers stood by but held a hands-off approach other than directing traffic and encouraging the crowd to remain out of the roadway.. . "Just like I've rejected Saul as king, I've rejected Biden as king, for I'm about to reappoint and re-anoint my David, President Donald J. Trump, to a second term," said one of the first speakers.. . "The Democrats have systematically tried to steal this election," said "Stop the Steal" co-founder Michael Coudrey. "They want to infringe on our constitutional right to free speech.". . "You know what we'll do? We will be louder than ever before. Can I get an 'amen?'". . 2019 GOP San Francisco Mayoral candidate Ellen Lee Zhou said that "1776 we had 56 people vote the constitution to protect you and me, to protect our life, our family, our country.". . "2020 we will not let them go. We will stop the steal," she said, beginning chants of "Stop the steal!". . "Stop the Steal" co-founder Ali Alexander added that he thinks "the run-off election is important. I do think that these two corporate hacks [Perdue and Loeffler] are the only firewall between us and socialism.". . "The Republicans gotta be on notice. This is the last compromise we make, right?". . Pro-Trump activist Scott Presler invoked scripture "And the Lord said, 'who shall I send?' And I said, 'Here I am Lord, send me.". . He performed a call-and-response. "Will you continue to call your state senators?" he asked.. . "I will!" responded the crowd.. . "Will you vote?" Presler asked.. . "I will!". . "Walk Away" movement founder Brandon Straka took an unsympathetic tone to conservatives suggesting sitting out the run-off election in GA. "This is not the time for us to stand on ceremony and decide that we're going to do a protest that we're not going to vote," he chimed in.. . Conservative author Shemeka Michelle said "people are mocking" President Trump now, which she compared to those mocking Jesus during the crucification. "People laughed at Jesus, now they're laughing at Trump, and now they're laughing at anyone trying to support him," she said.. . "The Lord told me in 2016 'Two terms for this president,'" said the final speaker.. . "It is not over. It is over when a Lion of Judah arrises from his throne, and all his enemies scatter in Jesus' name.". . She began a prayer for Trump and against "the giant of socialism.". . The "Stop the Steal" rally/vigil in Atlanta, GA ended with the lighting of candles and a prayer for God to provide "two terms Lord, two terms.". . "In Jesus' name. Lord God, we are excited to see what you are going to do," she concluded her prayer.. . "Amen.". . Full rally livestream: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GqgzxfTIDYE. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Ardel David, Dustin Gagne, and Emily Molli. . See more at http://News2share.com

Scenes and Interviews from Trump rally in Valdosta, GA - Documentary Video

Dec 6, 2020

NOTE TO YOUTUBE: THIS RECORDING SHOWS RAW FOOTAGE OF A SITUATION IMPORTANT TO NEWS AND DOCUMENTARY UNDERSTANDING AND CRITICISM ONLY. NEWS2SHARE DOES NOT ENDORSE ANY VIEWS CONTAINED HEREIN. THE VIDEO DOES NOT VIOLATE ANY COMMUNITY STANDARDS IN ANY WAY. NEWS2SHARE REMINDS VIEWERS TO SEE https://www.cisa.gov/rumorcontrol FOR ADDITIONAL COUNTERVAILING VIEWS.. . News2Share traveled to Valdosta, GA to film at President Trump's rally for GOP Senators Perdue and Loeffler. While we were allowed inside by Secret Service, security forced us to exit due to the size of our camera lens.. . Nonetheless, we captured the scene and interviews with Trump supporters, who expressed a desire not only to keep the GOP senate, but to prevent Trump from leaving office in January.. . "We didn't lose," President Trump told attendees during his speech. The speech was branded as a rally for senators Perdue and Loeffler, who both appeared, but was largely spent discussing what the president sees as anomalies in his election results. Attendees also focused on the president.. . One Trump supporter told the crowd they need to protest in front of their state capitols in support of "Trump 2020!". . "If they steal it, support President Trump 2024! Why? We've got to stop abortion," he said. "We've got to stop the American Holocaust.". . "We've got to stop the Democrats from stealing our elections!". . A woman with him told the media "Y'all look dumb as hell with these masks on. Dumb. I'm also a nurse. We don't have to wear them at the hospital. You're wearing them outside though.". . "If you do not want to live in a socialism/communism world, you better wake up America. Wake up," she added.. . One first-time Trump voter told News2Share that she sees 2020 as "God's chosen time" for Trump.. . She compared the president to the biblical David fighting Goliath.. . "We've got giants to slay right now," she explained. "The Democratic Party winning, we would expect things to be taken away from us.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer . . Nov 21, 2020

Militia activists held an armed march throughout Richmond, Virginia Saturday morning to defy new local laws that ban firearms at protests and magazines holding 20 rounds or more.. . Police stood by but did not intervene or make arrests. NOTE TO YOUTUBE: THIS RECORDING SHOWS RAW FOOTAGE OF A SITUATION IMPORTANT TO NEWS AND DOCUMENTARY UNDERSTANDING AND CRITICISM ONLY. NEWS2SHARE DOES NOT ENDORSE ANY VIEWS CONTAINED HEREIN. While major networks have called the election for Biden, Giuliani claims that across several swing states, he believes he can document enough fraud to bring Trump a "viable path" to victory.. . Sidney Powell also spoke at this press conference, accusing the election technology itself of being vulnerable to vote-switching.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Trump supporters tear down "Black Lives Matter" signage from business, art on White House fence

Nov 14, 2020

NOTE TO YOUTUBE: THIS RECORDING SHOWS RAW FOOTAGE OF A SITUATION IMPORTANT TO NEWS AND DOCUMENTARY UNDERSTANDING AND CRITICISM ONLY. NEWS2SHARE DOES NOT ENDORSE ANY VIEWS CONTAINED HEREIN. Following the "Million MAGA March" in Washington DC Saturday night, some Trump supporters continued marching toward the White House. The group tore wooden "Black Lives Matter" signs off of a private corporate building. Police in riot gear intervened but did not make arrests.. . "Clean the streets!" the MAGA activists chanted before moving on to tear down artwork posted on the fence at DC's "Black Lives Matter Plaza." Police protected most of it, and the activists tore down the words "invest in community" from one piece of art left exposed.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . DOCUMENTARY VIDEO: Antifa protests "Million MAGA March" at Supreme Court

Nov 14, 2020

NOTE TO YOUTUBE: THIS RECORDING SHOWS RAW FOOTAGE OF A SITUATION IMPORTANT TO NEWS AND DOCUMENTARY UNDERSTANDING AND CRITICISM ONLY. NEWS2SHARE DOES NOT ENDORSE ANY VIEWS CONTAINED HEREIN. THE VIDEO DOES NOT VIOLATE ANY COMMUNITY STANDARDS IN ANY WAY. NEWS2SHARE REMINDS VIEWERS TO SEE https://www.cisa.gov/rumorcontrol FOR ADDITIONAL COUNTERVAILING VIEWS.. . As thousands of Trump supporters descended on the Supreme Court Saturday afternoon to demand the president not concede the election, antifascist activists counter-protested them, holding a sign reading "Punch MAGA in the face.". . Police wielded riot shields and faced toward antifa, mostly managing to keep the two sides apart.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Violence as "Refuse Fascism" pushed out of "Million MAGA March"

Nov 14, 2020

NOTE TO YOUTUBE: THIS RECORDING SHOWS RAW FOOTAGE OF A SITUATION IMPORTANT TO NEWS AND DOCUMENTARY UNDERSTANDING AND CRITICISM ONLY. NEWS2SHARE DOES NOT ENDORSE ANY VIEWS CONTAINED HEREIN, AND COUNTERVAILING VIEWS EXIST IN THE VIDEO. THE VIDEO DOES NOT VIOLATE ANY COMMUNITY STANDARDS IN ANY WAY.. . As today's "Million MAGA March" began in Washington DC to support President Trump, activists with Refuse Fascism attempted to counter-protest before being physically forced out by Trump supporters. Some punches were thrown.. . Self-proclaimed "Boogaloo Boy" Mike Dunn wore a sweatshirt reading "Trump/Biden=Tyranny." While he says he "can't stand commies," he sided with Refuse Fascism in their conflict with the Trump supporters.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Counter-protesters oppose Trump supporters gathering in DC on eve of "Million MAGA March"

Nov 13, 2020

NOTE TO YOUTUBE: THIS RECORDING SHOWS RAW FOOTAGE OF A SITUATION IMPORTANT TO NEWS AND DOCUMENTARY UNDERSTANDING AND CRITICISM ONLY. NEWS2SHARE DOES NOT ENDORSE ANY VIEWS CONTAINED HEREIN, AND COUNTERVAILING VIEWS EXIST IN THE VIDEO. THE VIDEO DOES NOT VIOLATE ANY COMMUNITY STANDARDS IN ANY WAY.. . "We want Trump! We want Trump!" Supporters of President Trump are already gathering in Washington DC outside the White House for tomorrow's "Million MAGA March," an event meant to encourage Trump not to concede the election.. . Trump has said he may "stop by" at the event, which is already drawing counter-protesters as well.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Armed rally as MAGA caravan stops in Richmond, VA on way to DC for "Million MAGA March"

Nov 13, 2020

NOTE TO YOUTUBE: THIS RECORDING SHOWS RAW FOOTAGE OF A SITUATION IMPORTANT TO NEWS AND DOCUMENTARY UNDERSTANDING AND CRITICISM ONLY. NEWS2SHARE DOES NOT ENDORSE ANY VIEWS CONTAINED HEREIN, AND COUNTERVAILING VIEWS EXIST IN THE VIDEO. THE VIDEO DOES NOT VIOLATE ANY COMMUNITY STANDARDS IN ANY WAY.. . A caravan of Trump supporters led by Owen Shroyer in an armored truck stopped for a rally in Richmond, Virginia Thursday night. The pitstop attracted armed militia activists as well as BLM counter-protesters.. . The caravan is on its way to Washington DC, where a "Million MAGA March" is expected to take place. Participants will demand President Trump not concede the election.. . Filmed by N2S Contributor Sean CW Korsgaard. . A handful of Trump supporters held a protest outside Fox News' Washington DC Headquarters Wednesday afternoon to say that "Fox Lies" and should not have joined other networks in calling the election for Joe Biden.. . The protest was led by former Missouri Republican Party Chair Ed Martin and promoted online by Roger Stone.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Protesters defend ACA outside SCOTUS as case begins

Nov 10, 2020

Protesters gathered Tuesday morning outside the Supreme Court to support the Affordable Care Act aka "Obamacare" as the law's constitutionality is called into question in a Trump administration-backed lawsuit.. . Plaintiffs say that if one provision - such as the individual mandate - is found unconstitutional, then the entire law must be struck down with it. . . While the protesters oppose striking down the ACA, many also advocate moving forward into a "Medicare for all" model for the future.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Protesters Defend ACA As Lawsuit Challenging Constitutionality Enters Supreme Court

Nov 10, 2020

As a lawsuit challenging the constitutionality of the Affordable Care Act (“Obamacare”) enters the Supreme Court, protesters assemble outside. Filmed by Ford Fischer

"Count Every Vote" protesters kettled, arrested on Minneapolis highway November 4, 2020

Nov 8, 2020

Activists have begun demanding that charges be dropped against all protesters arrested in Minneapolis in the wake of the presidential election. . . On Wednesday, the night following the election, 646 people were arrested in the city, many of whom had been "kettled" by police on a highway after attempting to block traffic.. . Filmed by N2S Contributor Chris Juhn. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Champagne, fireworks outside White House during Biden victory speech

Nov 7, 2020

As Joe Biden gave a victory speech Saturday evening, activists continued to party in front of the White House. They shot fireworks into the air, opened champagne, and listened to the speech on loudspeakers.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Antifascist collective protests Biden celebration party at White House

Nov 7, 2020

The "They/Them Collective" - an anti-fascist, anarchist group based in Washington DC - marched into the Biden celebration party outside the White House. The group used umbrellas and black-bloc outfits to shield the identities of most participants as they condemned Joe Biden, who they say will not stop police violence against Black people.. . "For all of you white liberals, who have been celebrating, getting drunk off your asses about Biden winning this election, you are all a bunch of f***ing fools," they said.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Thousands celebrate at White House as networks call race for Biden

Nov 7, 2020

Thousands of Biden supporters are gathered Saturday afternoon in front of the White House opening champagne and cheering for Joe Biden as networks begin to call the presidential race.. . "Trump, you're fired," activists chanted while while waiving Biden flags. One participant carried an effigy portraying President Trump's head on a pike.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Nov 7, 2020

As networks begin calling the presidential race for Joe Biden, activists outside the White House celebrate. Filmed by Ford Fischer

Socialist-leaning coalition holds "Count Every Vote" march in Boston

Nov 6, 2020

A coalition of activists including Socialist Alternative, The Party for Socialism and Liberation, and Extinction Rebellion held a "Court Every Vote" march against President Trump in Boston, Massachusetts Thursday night.. . While opposing president Trump, speakers condemned the system of capitalism itself, which they say breeds racism. They warned that even if President Trump is defeated, their goals will not have been fully realized.. . "Racism does not exist without capitalism," one speaker said. "It is capitalism we seek to destroy.". . Filmed by Jack Stringer for N2S. . Police face off with anti-Trump protesters on Election Night in Los Angeles

Nov 6, 2020

Mild fighting broke out at an anti-Trump watch party at the Staples Center in Los Angeles Tuesday night during the 2020 presidential election. Riot police responded wielding riot gear including less-lethal shotguns, but none were fired.. . More than 50 people were reportedly arrested and charged with failure to disperse after the event was declared an unlawful assembly.. . Filmed by N2S Contributor Neil Radimaker. . Nov 6, 2020

On election night 2020 in Richmond, Virginia, Black Lives Matter activists and supporters took to the streets to protest against President Trump. Some were armed, and no violence occurred. . . Portland protesters hold "unity march for racial justice" on Election Night

Nov 5, 2020

ELECTION NIGHT FOOTAGE: About 300 black-bloc clad protesters marched through Portland on election night. One solitary and isolated fire was started on the street. Police say no violence or arrests occurred during what was billed as a "unity march for racial justice" and against President Trump.. . Filmed by N2S Contributor Jake D Bobay. . “Million Mask March” Begins In Washington Dc

Nov 5, 2020

The anarchist-leaning “Million Mask March” begins in Washington DC. Filmed by Ford Fischer

Florida Trump supporters celebrate Trump state victory on Election Night

Nov 4, 2020

MIAMI, FLORIDA. Supporters of President Donald Trump, predominantly Cuban American, gathered outside the famous Cafe Versailles in Miami's Little Havana neighborhood.. . About two to three hundred people came together to wave flags, signs, bang on pots and pans, and dance to Latin American music, including a song by local group Los Havana Tres, which was used in a Trump campaign ad.. . The supporters were there celebrating Trump's victory in the state of Florida. Part of Trump's victory in the state was attributed to a sharp change in Miami Dade county compared to 2016, with about 200,000 more votes going to Donald Trump. . . Filmed by Jimmy Evans. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Ardel David, Dustin Gagne, and Emily Molli. . See more at http://News2share.com

Arrest at White House on Election Night 2020

Nov 4, 2020

News2Share captured partial footage of one arrest and its aftermath amidst protesters gathering on Election Night in front of the White House.. . Police surrounded one man as the arrest was made. An apparently pro-police onlooker made a remark in support of officers making the arrest, leading the arrestee to say, "Literally I'm getting arrested for no reason so F*** you.". . Officers formed a line to hold back the crowd as they loaded the man into a police van. An MPD Lieutenant declined to clarify the man's charges to News2Share.. . One protester's umbrella was destroyed when an officer swiped it as it was opened in front of the police line. Following the arrest, officers retreated, and activists followed them, chanting "move back!". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Ardel David, Dustin Gagne, and Emily Molli. . See more at http://News2share.com

Protesters take to streets of DC to demand "count every vote" following 2020 presidential election

Nov 4, 2020

A coalition of activists including Democratic Socialists of America, Shut Down DC, and Extinction Rebellion Washington DC held a "count every vote" march through Washington DC this afternoon.. . "He hasn't won! Count all the votes!" the group chanted as they blocked an intersection outside the RNC. They also protested outside the Fox News headquarters, which they say produces "consistently the least informed viewers of all major news outlets.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Antifascist "Black Bloc"-clad activists march in DC on election night

Nov 4, 2020

Tonight antifascist activists marched through Washington DC in black-bloc to protest both presidential candidates. "Fuck Biden! Fuck Trump! No more presidents! No more fascists!" they chanted.. . They were led by DC's They/Them Collective, an anarchist collective.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Nov 4, 2020

Tuesday night's antifascist march ended at DC's 4th Precinct police station, where one man hopped barricades and threw a bag at the building.. . He was arrested and pulled inside after trying to jump back over to his comrades.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Live Look At White House As Election Results Come In

Nov 3, 2020

Live: Activists gather at the White House as 2020 presidential election results come in. Filmed by Ford Fischer

Left and right-leaning militia groups gather in Louisville, KY on Election Day

Nov 3, 2020

Some members of the right-leaning "National Patriotic Defense Team" militia and the left-leaning "United Pharaoh's Guard" militia both gathered on the streets of Louisville, Kentucky Tuesday morning as the 2020 presidential election began.. . "We stand together," said UPG member Jacoby Glenn, who wore a semi-automatic rifle and a side arm. "Honestly, we do what the police should be doing, and that's to protect protesters instead of fighting against them.". . "LMPD is kicking back and eating some fried dough," one member remarked, referencing the lack of police officers in the area.. . "We just want to make sure everything remains safe, everybody gets their votes in, no matter who they're voting for," said NPDT leader Tara Brandau, who only wore a sidearm.. . "We both are here for pretty much the same purpose," added Brandau.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . "Trump 2020 Capital Beltway Caravan" circles Washington DC

Nov 1, 2020

Hundreds of Trump supporters held a "Trump 2020 Capital Beltway Caravan" decorating their vehicles with Trump gear and driving the full circle of the beltway - approximately 64 miles - in a loop around Washington DC.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Police kettle, arrest protesters following egging of precinct in DC

Oct 31, 2020

Riot police in Washington DC arrested several protesters Saturday night outside the District 4 police precinct after some threw eggs at the windows and kicked a ballot dropbox. Officers surrounded the group in a "kettle" formation as Lieutenant Bagshaw pointed out individual participants for arrest. . . Protesters were speaking out against the death of Karon Hylton, who was hit by a car after police chased him allegedly for not wearing a helmet on a moped early last week.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Full Interview: Trump supporter Randal J. Thom, aka "Front Row Joe"

Oct 21, 2020

Passionate Trump supporter Randal J. Thom was known as "Front Row Joe" because he would organize groups to travel to Trump rallies days early to camp out and see President Trump from the first row. He passed away Monday following a highway crash in Minnesota on his way back from an event in Florida.. . News2Share's Ford Fischer spoke to Mr. Thom in 2019 as he attended Trump's "Salute to America" event in Washington DC.. . Militia and "Hawaiian Shirt Enthusiasts" hold "Unity Rally" at Michigan Capitol

Oct 18, 2020

Pro-gun and libertarian-leaning "Hawaiian Shirt Enthusiast" activists held an armed "Unity Rally" at the Michigan State Capitol Saturday afternoon.. . The group hoped to showcase and clarify their ideology as several men from another Michigan group stand accused of a plot to kidnap Governor Gretchen Whitmer.. . "Heed this warning politicians, magistrates, and officers of the law" one said. "You may get away with your tyranny for a time longer, but the day of reckoning rapidly approaches.". . One speaker early on asked the group to take a knee "for all the people who are languishing in American jails for victimless crimes, for all the people who have been killed in our streets by state agents [cops], by people suffering every day because of the power of governments worldwide.". . The activists had invited members of other groups such as Antifa, BLM, NFAC, Proud Boys and others to show up and dialogue, but ultimately the crowd mostly consisted of militia-adjacent activists.. . Two Black Lives Matter activists who were invited to the rally to participate did show up, but felt like the rally's views "weren't in alignment with ours," but they were hoping to change minds.. . "I just don't like the violence behind it or the militia part of it," one said.. . "His name was George Floyd," said one armed speaker at the rally.. . "Her name was Breonna Taylor. His name was Duncan Lemp. His name was Daniel Shaver. And his name was Eric Garner," he said. "Disproportionate use of force by state entities ended the lives of these and many other people.". . Pro-gun activist Maj Toure of "Black Guns Matter" spoke out as well. He pushed back against the idea that the rally participants are "racist" or "white supremacist.". . "We want freedom, we want peace, we want freedom of opportunity," Toure said. . . Filmed by Lee Wingo for N2S. . Women's March faces off with pro-life protesters at Supreme Court - October 17, 2020

Oct 17, 2020

When the Women's March arrived at the Supreme Court this afternoon, a pro-life, pro-Amy Coney Barrett rally was taking place.. . In one particularly tense moment, a protester pulled a pro-ACB sign out of the hands of Ashley C. MacLeay (Washington D.C.'s only GOP elected official), ripped it up, and threw the pieces on her.. . Police confronted but did not arrest the protester.. . "ACB! She's with me," chanted MacLeay to protesters who were chanting "RBG! RBG!" . . "F*** you b****! F*** you b****!" activists on the Women's March side chanted back at her.. . "I just want to say to our counter-protesters over here, they're protesting 'pro-life' but a lot of them don't wanna wear their masks in this crowd," said a Women's March side speaker. "You can't call yourself 'pro-life' and not wear a mask in this crowd!". . One of the pro-life women continued not to wear a mask. Protesters cited . D.C. MayorBowser's masking executive order that technically sets a $1000 fine or 90 days in jail for not wearing a mask in public.. . "90 days in jail! 90 days in jail!" protesters chanted at the woman. "Lock her up! Lock her up!". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Protesters defy local gun ordinance at VA police station

Oct 15, 2020

A few dozen pro-gun protesters openly carrying rifles, shotguns, and pistols rallied outside the Newport News Police station in Virginia to defy a new local ordinance banning open carry in public spaces.. . Police Chief Steve R. Drew greeted the activists and offered chocolate milk to Mike Dunn, who had been arrested and disarmed a week earlier under the same ordinance.. . Police stood by and did not make any arrests.. . Dunn - who is still charged with trespassing for open carrying at a Libertarian rally last Thursday - was returned his handgun earlier today, Chief Drew confirmed.. . In a speech to the activists, Chief Drew sent his condolences to the family of Duncan Lemp - a militiaman killed in a no-knock police raid - and said he wants to treat the rally "with the upmost respect" and asked the same from activists.. . Aubrey "Japharii" Jones Jr. of Black Lives Matter 757 spoke out, noting the difference in how police treat unarmed Black Lives Matter activists versus an armed rally like Thursday night's. He called the "this showing of force is absolutely beautiful.". . During his speech, Mike Dunn explained how he defied the local gun ordinance and got arrested last week, and added that "legally, we're not supposed to be open carrying here, but we're all open carrying.". . "We're here openly and blatantly defying unconstitutional city ordinances.". . "Pops" - a Black Lives Matter activist known to carry guns (today he wore six firearms) - described how police "tear gassed" his group when they were unarmed.. . "Armed protesters do not get assaulted by police, that's a fact," he explained. He says this led him into armed activism.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer . . Oct 9, 2020

Oct 8, 2020

Ahead of an event featuring Libertarian Vice Presidential candidate Spike Cohen, one attendee - Virginia militia leader Mike Dunn - was arrested for open carrying a handgun.. . Dunn was arrested under a new local ordinance banning open carry at public parks authorized by a bill recently signed by Virginia Governor Ralph Northam.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Trump supporters gather for president's departure from Walter Reed

Oct 5, 2020

As President Trump departed Walter Reed Hospital following his COVID-19 treatments, hundreds of his supporters gathered outside the facility to wish the President well.. . See Trump's departure in 4K resolution: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gZe3YPj5rmI. . The supporters cheered, waved, honked horns, and chanted “Four More Years!” as Marine One ascended into the air. The president's helicopter flew low and did a half-loop around the crowd before heading to the White House.. . Many of those lined up outside the hospital said they traveled long distances to be there in person. One man from Georgia - who said he had been released from a New York hospital on Sunday - sported a sign that read: “Send French Fries! Get Orange Man Good…Again.”. . Only a small handful of anti-Trump protesters appeared. Police separated an individual in a grim reaper costume from the well-wishers.. . The costumed person was holding up a picture of the President and asking those assembled if they could help find Trump, claiming, “he’s been a big help.”. . After circling over the hospital at low altitude, the helicopter carrying Trump landed at the White House. The president emerged shortly thereafter, took off his mask, and faced the assembled photographers. He then saluted and went inside without answering questions.. . Earlier in the day, Trump tweeted, "I will be leaving the great Walter Reed Medical Center today at 6:30 P.M. Feeling really good! Don’t be afraid of Covid. Don't let it dominate your life. ... I feel better than I did 20 years ago!”. . It has been confirmed by Trump’s medical team that he is on Remdesivir, the oral steroid Dexamethasone, and other experimental treatments.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Ardel David, Dustin Gagne, and Emily Molli. . See more at http://News2share.com

Clay Higgins on Facebook, and the police shooting of Lafayette man Trayford Pellerin.. . Two shots were accidentally fired by an activist who was not a part of the NFAC formation. One was arrested and charged with reckless discharge of a firearm at a parade or demonstration, and felon in possession of a firearm.. . Activists dressed in Handmaid’s Tale outfits protest against Amy Coney Barrett confirmation

Oct 1, 2020

Activists dressed in Handmaid’s Tale outfits protested against the confirmation of Amy Coney Barrett Thursday morning in front of the Supreme Court in Washington DC.. . "We believe Trump having another confirmed Supreme Court Justice is just his way at a last-ditch power-grab, because he knows that he's going to lose the election and he wants to bring it before the Supreme Court," one activist told News2Share. "He wants the Supreme Court Justices to be indebted to him.". . The “Handmaids” briefly stepped up onto the Supreme Court steps, but Capitol Police cited United States Code to make them step down, classifying the group as a demonstration.. . The group confirmed it is their intention to demonstrate daily against Barrett's confirmation.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Police arrest 30 antifa activists throughout Portland following Proud Boys rally

Sep 27, 2020

Police arrested 30 antifascist protesters Saturday night at a demonstration following a rally held by right-wing group the Proud Boys earlier during the day in Portland.. . Police initially charged at the activists for refusing to leave the road, arresting several, and then continued to fight the crowd which occasionally threw objects back at them. Police chased antifa protesters throughout an approximately 5-block radius for around three hours, ending just past midnight.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Proud Boys, pro-Trump activists, militia rally in Portland

Sep 27, 2020

A coalition of pro-Trump and right-wing activists including the Proud Boys rallied in Portland Saturday afternoon against Antifa.. . A state of emergency had been declared by Oregon Governor Kate Brown Friday afternoon, placing Oregon State Police, rather than local police, in charge.. . The rally specifically lionized Kyle Rittenhouse, the Kenosha shooter who killed two and injured a third, and memorialized Aaron 'Jay' Danielson, a right-winger shot dead in Portland by a self-proclaimed antifa activist.. . Antifa counter-demonstrators did not show up, but right wing activists and militia members confronted press they believed were left wing.. . Organizer Joe Biggs confronted the crowd. "Are we the left? We're supposed to have freedom of speech. Stop hassling the media," he said.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Black Riders Liberation Party leads armed defense for Portland counter-protest against Proud Boys

Sep 27, 2020

Black Lives Matter and Antifascist activists held a counter-demonstration Saturday afternoon in Portland against a Proud Boys demonstration being held in a nearby park. The two groups largely remained separate from each other.. . Members of the Black Riders Liberation Party, a group that continues to promote the views of the Black Panthers, acted as armed security for the event. . . "We're not out here to cause any kind of destruction. We're not out here to intimidate nobody, to antagonize nobody," said BRLP regional minister of defense Ogun Ture. "Today we are actually out here to show that we are a liberated front.". . Letha Winston, Patrick Kimmons' mother spoke out. Kimmons was killed by police in 2018.. . "Don't let nobody discourage you from getting justice," she said. "Don't let nobody discourage you from saying 'F*** the police.'". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Arrests after antifa sets fire at Portland Police Association

Sep 25, 2020

Antifascist activists set a small fire at the front of the Portland Police Association in Portland, Oregon at their march for "No cops! No prisons! Total abolition!" Thursday night. Police pressed in, arresting at least two.. . When police departed the scene, they threatened to mace press if they were followed.. . As the demonstration first began, police called out that "we are aware of your criminal activity occurring." By that point, spray paint was used but otherwise the crowd was holding speeches and blowing bubbles.. . "F*** Joe Biden" said one antifa activist to cheers from the crowd. . . "F*** you Joe Biden, you're a piece of s***," he added. "We hate you. We hate you Joe Biden. Biden, you can't fool us.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Protesters hold "Justice for Breonna Taylor" march in DC

Sep 23, 2020

"Wake up gentrifiers!" Protesters with the "F*** the Police Coalition" held a "Justice for Breonna Taylor" throughout Washington DC Tuesday night. A single trash can was set on fire, and acrivists rushed to put it out using water.. . The march ended when organizers said that someone within the group was feeding information to the police. Two participants were reportedly arrested later in the night after the march concluded.. . It was announced Wednesday that the officer who killed Breonna Taylor has been charged with three counts of "Wanton Endangerment" and faces 15 years in prison.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Activists Hold “Justice For Breonna Taylor” March In DC

Sep 22, 2020

Activists with the FTP Coalition hold “Justice for Breonna Taylor” march in DC. Filmed by Ford Fischer

Protesters "Wake up Lindsey Graham" at his D.C. home to demand no new SCOTUS appointment until 2021

Sep 21, 2020

Activists with "Shut Down DC" and the Sunrise Movement used strobe lights, instruments and chants to "wake up Lindsey Graham" outside the senator's house in Washington D.C. to demand he not confirm a replacement for Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg on the Supreme Court until after the 2021 Inauguration.. . Some of the activists tried to enter Senator Graham's front yard and knock on the door. Police formed a line preventing most from doing so, and forced one protester who got through off the yard. They did not make arrests.. . "He said, 'Use my words against me!'" chanted the activists, referencing Graham's allusion to a situation like this when he was defending not confirming Merrick Garland in 2016.. . "I want you to use my words against me," Graham said during a senate hearing in 2016. "If there's a Republican president in 2016 and a vacancy occurs in the last year of the first term, you can say Lindsey Graham said let's let the next president, whoever it might be, make that nomination.". . Activists held a banner reading "We Can't Sleep So Neither Should Lindsey" while loudly playing back a recording of his own words from 2016.. . “In the spirit of RBG, we will not allow a double standard in how our Congress deals with late-term Supreme Court appointments,” said Aura Angelica, an organizer with Sunrise DC. “Senator Graham told us he wouldn’t allow a Supreme Court nominee during an election year-- he told us to use his words against him if a seat opened up this late in the game-- we’re here today, doing just that.”. . "We're using your words against you," wrote an activist in sidewalk chalk in front of the senator's home.. . Inspector Robert Glover of the Metropolitan Police Department (MPD) Special Operation Division told an organizer that the protest outside Senator Graham's house was in violation of DC's "Residential Tranquility Act" and that they'd begin arresting if they didn't leave.. . He specifically added he'd arrest media at the event as well.. . MPD Lieutenant Jason Bagshaw used an amplifier in Inspector Glover's call to issue a first warning to the protesters threatening arrest.. . "We will not compromise with a simple-minded racist" an activist replied.. . After Lieutenant Bagshaw issued a second arrest warning and ordered protesters to leave southbound, they briefly marched north toward the police, but then turned around leaving the way police told them to.. . "You can't stop the revolution!" they chanted. "No justice, no peace!". . "We need a new court," an organizer said as the group marched to the Supreme Court. "We need a court that actually has term limits.". . "Expand the court! Expand the court!" the group chanted.. . Before wrapping, organizers read out the home address of Kansas Senator Pat Roberts in Alexandria, Virginia, and suggested that he or Colorado Senator Cory Gardner should be the next target of a wakeup event.. . They added that this could be done in their home states as well.. . Sunrise described themselves as "a youth movement to stop climate change and create millions of good jobs in the process.". . Shut Down DC describes themselves as "an alliance of people and organizations committed to an array of social justice issues, coming together to highlight the overlapping causes of the climate crisis in the United States.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Ardel David, Dustin Gagne, and Emily Molli. . See more at http://News2share.com

Hundreds mourn RBG's death at Supreme Court

Sep 18, 2020

Hundreds gathered at the Supreme Court Friday night to mourn the death of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, who had served on the court since 1993. Mourners brought flowers and candles. Very few brought signs or political messages, instead holding a reverent tone.. . "May her memory be a great and magnificent blessing to the world," President Trump said in a statement following Justice Ginsburg's death.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Activist dressed as cop wearing pig mask instructs real cops to wear masks

Sep 16, 2020

During a protest Tuesday in Philadelphia, one activist dressed as a police officer and wearing a pig mask walked up to all the actual police officers on duty, checking whether they were wearing masks. He called out and whistled at the officers who were not wearing one, instructing them to put one on. Some complied.. . He was later accompanied by woman wearing a bikini and Trump mask who rolled around on an American flag in a similarly bizarre demonstration.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Protesters march through Philadelphia following Trump town hall

Sep 15, 2020

As Donald Trump traveled to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, for a televised Townhall on ABC News with undecided voters, protesters took to the streets outside Independence Park to demand "Trump, Pence, out now!". . Around 8pm, the protesters marched through the streets of downtown Philadelphia.. . Marching leaders led chants of “Trump-Pence Out Now," “No Trump, no KKK, no FASCIST USA," and “No Justice, No Peace, No Racist Police.". . Marchers walked through city blocks and parks for over an hour.. . Activists attempted to block a highway with heavy traffic but police physically blocked most of the crowd from the on-ramp, and the remaining activists gave up on the idea.. . Protesters face off during Trump's Town Hall in Philadelphia

Sep 15, 2020

As Donald Trump traveled to Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, for a televised Townhall on ABC News with undecided voters, protesters took to the streets outside Independence Park to demand "Trump, Pence, out now!". . The group, led by the Refuse Fascism organization, was met by a smaller contingency of Trump supporters.. . While police initially allowed the competing protesters leeway to intermingle, eventually the sides were separated behind barricades. Other than a single "Keep America Great" hat being swiped off a Trump supporter's head, no violence occurred.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . "At Ready" Confederate statue removed in Charlottesville, VA

Sep 14, 2020

A Confederate statue depicting an unnamed soldier known as "At Ready" was removed this weekend from outside the Albemarle County Courthouse in Charlottesville, Virginia.. . A handful of activists danced and celebrated as the statue - which was erected in 1909 - was taken down.. . The statue is expected to be relocated to a site chosen in the nearby Shenendoah National Battlefield, the site of the Third Winchester Battlefield in Frederick County, Virginia.. . Sep 13, 2020

An antifa activist performed what he calls "pig-fishing" Saturday night in Washington D.C. Ahead of a "F*** the police" march, Jason Charter - who is currently facing 20 years in prison - held a donut on a fishing rod and offered it to police officers. None took the bait.. . "Awe, that's one of those crumb cake ones," one officer replied sarcastically. "That is delicious.". . "I'm on a diet so..." rejected another.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NFAC's Grandmaster Jay speaks to the press

Sep 6, 2020

In a rare opportunity for media, the all-Black "NFAC" ("Not F***ing Around Coalition") militia leader John Fitzgerald "Grandmaster Jay" Johnson spoke to press following a march in Louisville, Kentucky.. . "The United States has a history of hunting down and killing black organizations," he said. "So therefore, as much as some people want to be in the spotlight, everyone who has stepped where I am standing has been shot and killed. Everyone.". . "So this time I'm protecting the members by not letting you see who they are," he added.. . "If you kill me, there is someone already in my place.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . NFAC militia marches at Kentucky Derby, Louisville

Sep 5, 2020

The all-Black "Not Fucking Around Coalition" aka "NFAC" militia gathered at Wyandotte Park on Saturday afternoon, just a few blocks away from Churchill Downs, the site of the Kentucky Derby.. . The group espouses Black nationalist ideology, but specifically rallies in Louisville to demand that the police officers who killed Breonna Taylor be arrested.. . Breonna Taylor was a 26-year-old black woman shot and killed by police officers in a no-knock raid on her home by the Louisville Police Department in March. The shooting sparked nationwide protests. One officer has been fired, but none have been charged.. . The NFAC injured three members last month in an accidental discharge when they also gathered in Louisville.. . "Under no circumstances will you chamber a round," said John Fitzgerald Johnson, who leads the NFAC under the pseudonym "Grandmaster Jay.". . "Our rules of engagement are very simple," he told his group before the march. "Under no circumstances will you point your weapon at anyone, unless they point at you first. If they do, don't shoot them. Kill them.". . As the group - each member bearing at least one rifle or shotgun - marched toward Churchill Downs, chants of "say her name, Breonna Taylor!" broke out in the formation.. . Johnson instructed the group to pause and kneel.. . "NFAC does not chant," he said. "We don't do none of that shit, so if you're NFAC, I don't want to hear that bullshit.". . When the NFAC arrived at Churchill Downs itself, a fence had already been erected to keep activists on the opposite side of the street. As the Kentucky Derby began, riot police stood across the street closer to the horse race itself.. . Johnson approached the gate to speak directly to police.. . "If you could kill me right now, you know your ass would," Grandmaster Jay told officers. "Take your shot.". . "You said I'm your worst nightmare," he told them. "Black male, could energize the Black nationalist movement. Listen to this.". . He then led the group in a "Black power" chant.. . Until Freedom, another group demanding that Breonna Taylor's killers be arrested, also arrived at Churchill Downs to protest.. . Struggling to keep the two groups separate, the NFAC instead marched away early.. . Following the event, Grandmaster Jay told reporters why only he speaks to the media and the rest of his members remain anonymous.. . "The United States has a history of hunting down and killing black organizations," he said. "So therefore, as much as some people want to be in the spotlight, everyone who has stepped where I am standing has been shot and killed. Everyone.". . "So this time I'm protecting the members by not letting you see who they are," he added.. . "If you kill me, there is someone already in my place.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Ardel David, Dustin Gagne, and Emily Molli. . See more at http://News2share.com

"Angry Viking” Militia faces off with counter-protesters in Louisville, Kentucky

Sep 5, 2020

As the annual Kentucky Derby took place Saturday in Louisville, Kentucky, a myriad of activists, many of them armed, took to the streets.. . A coalition of armed pro-Trump and militia activists marched to City Hall in the morning, where they were confronted by armed antifascist and antiracist counter-protesters.. . The group was led by Dylan Stevens, who styles himself and his followers as the "Angry Viking" militia.. . "Back the blue," his group chanted as they entered, in reference to the police.. . "Fuck the blue," replied counter-protesters.. . The situation briefly escalated into shouting and violence. During a few pushing matches, activists opposing the "Angry Viking" militia and their supporters unholstered handguns.. . No shots were fired.. . Following about an hour of confrontation, "Angry Viking" militia leader Dylan Stevens declared "we're leaving.". . citing the fact that activists counter-protesting them had been out in that area for over three months.. . "Apparently, this group has been out for 101 days," said Stevens. "Honestly, I had no clue about it.". . "No justice! No Derby! No justice! No Derby!" chanted the counter-protesters.. . Police entered the area in a riot formation once the "Militia Viking" group had already departed from the area.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . He says he spoke to the mother, sister, and brother of Kay, who he describes as “distraught, outraged.”. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Aug 31, 2020

Following a weekend of clashes in Washington DC that left many protesters arrested, activists gathered for "jail support" outside the courthouse Monday where many of their comrades were released without bail.. . Some - originally charged with felony riot, disorderly conduct, and reckless driving - were released with charges completely dropped.. . Jail support consisted of medical assistance, food, drinks, alcohol, cigarettes, access to phones, and transportation.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . LIVE from protests in DC

Aug 30, 2020

I’m live in Washington DC where police have deployed tear gas and rubber bullets against protesters.

Rev. Al Sharpton, MLK III, Lead ‘Get Your Knees off Our Necks’ March

Aug 28, 2020

Thousands of racial justice activists, allies, and supporters coalesced on the National Mall in Washington D.C. for the National Action Network’s “Get Your Knees off Our Necks” Commitment March on Friday. Led by the Reverend Al Sharpton, the event lands on the 57th anniversary of Martin Luther King’s Historic March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom. . . The speakers at the Lincoln Memorial ranged from grassroots activists, to academics, to theologians, to business & labor leaders and sitting members of congress.. . The tones of the speeches varied from apolitical to full-throated endorsements of politicians running against President Trump. Vice Presidential candidate Kamala Harris appeared in a video message at the event, urging activists to continue their efforts in the spirit of those who came before them, such as the late Rep. John Lewis. . . MLK Jr’s son, Martin Luther King III, and MLK Jr’s granddaughter Yolanda King were two of the event’s featured speakers.. . MLK III spoke broadly about a host of issues in America, and urged listeners to continue the efforts championed by MLK Jr. and civil rights leaders of the 1950s and 60s.. . “There's a knee upon the neck of democracy, and our nation can only live so long without the oxygen of freedom,” he said, adding that if activists continue to move with purpose and passion, they would be able to complete the work started by his father. . . The youngest King professed the hope that her generation would be the one to end systemic racism. The 12-year-old stressed the goal of the movement was “genuine equality.”. . Reverend Al Sharpton headlined the speaking portion of the event, leading attendees in chants of “No Justice, No Peace!”. . He, like many prior speakers, drew parallels between the circumstances of 1963 and 2020, speaking out about the perception that the Trump administration may be attempting to “rob” voting rights from African-Americans, a sentiment shared by many activists.. . Sharpton spoke in support of the passage of the George Floyd Justice in Policing Act, which passed in the House of Representatives, but has not yet been passed in the senate. He also advocated for the John Lewis Voting Rights Act.. . “Demonstration without legislation will not lead to change,” said Sharpton. “We didn’t come to start trouble, we came to stop trouble.” . . The event is one of the largest sanctioned gatherings during the Coronavirus pandemic, and while many in attendance wore masks and attempted to keep distance, large crowds closely packed the steps of the Lincoln Memorial and the Reflecting Pool.. . Sharpton advised attendees to socially distance if possible, but noted the importance of the gathering. “Even though we are here in the midst of a pandemic...we want to show with our bodies that enough is enough.” . . Also speaking were Tamika Palmer, mother of Breonna Taylor, Letetra Widman and Jacob Blake Sr, sister and father of Jacob Blake, and Bridgett & Philonise Floyd, sister and brother of George Floyd, and many other family members of those killed by law enforcement or suspected white supremacists.. . So many family members assembled to speak, that not every person could be accommodated, as event organizers had to direct attendees for marching.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. Article by Joel Simon. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Ardel David, Dustin Gagne, and Emily Molli. . See more at http://News2share.com

NFAC militia rallies at "Get your knee off our necks" march in DC

Aug 28, 2020

As tens of thousands attended the "Get your knee off our necks" march in Washington DC, the "Not F***ing Around Coalition" (NFAC), an all-Black militia, rallied at the Martin Luther King Jr. memorial. While they usually carry pistols and rifles, today they wore bulletproof vests, knives, a machete, and empty pistol holsters.. . The group's leader, "Grandmaster Jay" revved up the crowd by saying that the NFAC are "the new Black Panthers" and concluded by leading marchers in a chant of "Black power!". . Protests try to “Drown Out Trump” in DC during nomination speech

Aug 27, 2020

As President Trump accepts the GOP nomination for president, protesters attempt to “drown out” his speech in DC. Filmed by Ford Fischer

Meet the "United Pharaoh's Guard" / "Louijihadeen" militia

Aug 27, 2020

As protesters gathered in Louisville, Kentucky Tuesday afternoon, a militia group patrolled the streets. We spoke to members of the newly-formed, Louisville-based militia called the "United Pharaoh's Guard," aka the "Louijihadeen.". . The group is multiracial and say they want to patrol their own communities. "When we show up like this, they don't start beating people up," one said of the police.. . As police attempted to clear the street during the protest, the militia stood their ground. Despite arresting more than 60 people for being in the road earlier that day, the police backed down.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Curfew, arrests, broken windows as Minneapolis protests begin again

Aug 27, 2020

"Let's go move, move, move!" As rioting re-emerged in Minneapolis last night, one officer could be seen pointing a rifle at protesters violating curfew, who then ran away.. . Several arrests were made throughout the night as rioting began after a Minneapolis man had been believed to have been killed by police. Police released a video showing he had actually committed suicide.. . Filmed by N2S Contributor Chris Juhn. . Aug 26, 2020

Protesters holding an emergency "F*** the police" march Monday night demanded that restaurant patrons raise their fists to affirm that "Black Lives Matter.". . Filmed by TJ Jones. .
