Man in wheelchair with knife slashes at "FTP" protest; MPD tases and arrests him

Aug 26, 2020

At the conclusion of Monday's "F*** The Police" march in Washington DC, protesters found themselves began to fight with a man in a wheelchair who had been with the protests a majority of the time.. . It was alleged that the man had groped a female protester.. . The man pulled out a knife and began chasing after and slashing at people in the area, before holding the knife to his own throat.. . Despite having fought with him, the protesters begged police, "Don't shoot him!". . MPD arrived and deployed a taser against the man, rendering him temporarily still or unconscious. Bicycle units then cleared the sidewalk, leading to minor confrontations with protesters.. . An ambulance arrived and the man was loaded in. The remaining protesters then dispersed.. . Filmed by T.J. Jones. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Raw video: Police versus protesters night 3 in Kenosha ahead of shooting

Aug 26, 2020

Before a shooting occurred in Kenosha, Wisconsin that left two dead and one injured, police faced off with protesters over the shooting of Jacob Blake. Officers used tear gas, rubber bullets, and pepper rounds to enforce an 8pm curfew in Kenosha County.. . Filmed by N2S Contributor Chris Juhn. . Police arrest 64 activists at "Good Trouble" protest in Louisville, KY

Aug 25, 2020

Police arrested 64 protesters Tuesday afternoon in Louisville, Kentucky after some refused to leave the roadway. Hundreds of activists - some of them armed - had been marching throughout the city to protest police violence and the killing of Breonna Taylor.. . The activists have been charged with obstructing a roadway and disorderly conduct.. . "Until Freedom" was co-founded by Linda Sarsour and Tamika Mallory, both of whom are former co-chairs of the Women's March.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Aug 25, 2020

Protesters faced off with police in Kenosha, Wisconsin Monday, one night after the police shooting of Jacob Blake which has reportedly left him paralyzed.. . Businesses were burned and cars were smashed as riot police responded with non-lethal weaponry.. . Filmed by N2S Contributor Chris Juhn. . Aug 24, 2020

"We will not be intimidated by the LMPD or any police department," said Until Freedom co-founder Linda Sarsour at a press conference Monday morning.. . On Tuesday, a massive protest beginning at 2pm is expected to draw thousands to the streets of Louisville, Kentucky. The local police force has been instructed that all officers will be required to be on duty.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Shaun King speaks out in Louisville on "dismantlement of this system"

Aug 24, 2020

"Louisville's system is not broken," said writer and Black Lives Matter activist Shaun King in a speech today in Louisville, Kentucky, one day ahead of major protests for Breonna Taylor. "This system was designed to oppress us.". . "What we're actually calling for is a complete dismantlement of this system.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Families of Breonna Taylor, George Floyd and more speak out at “Until Freedom” press conference

Aug 24, 2020

Families of Breonna Taylor, George Floyd and more speak out at “Until Freedom” press conference. Filmed by Ford Fischer

Militia group gathers in Louisville, KY, community responds

Aug 23, 2020

On Saturday, a newly branded militia group called the "National Patriotic Defense Team" - led by Tara "Hoggirl" Brandau - gathered in a Louisville Parking lot.. . They say they weren't protesting, but rather on standby to "back up" law enforcement. The group claimed to be aware of "credible threats" that Louisville could encounter, but did not clarify further.. . Community members including several livestreamers - some of them armed themselves - argued with the militia group about their purpose in being there. LMPD monitored the situation, which did not become violent.. . The "National Patriotic Defense Team" had originally tried to block off the parking lot to people outside the organization, but after complaints, the police asked them to open the area up again.. . The "Not F***ing Around Coalition" (NFAC) had declared in Louisville on July 25 that four weeks later, they would "burn the motherf***er down" if the police officers who killed Breonna Taylor had not been arrested by then. As of Saturday - precisely four weeks after July 25 - the officers had not been arrested, but the NFAC didn't return.. . However, the NFAC has announced plans to come to Louisville on September 5, the day of the Kentucky Derby. The Kentucky Derby will occur without a live audience.. . The "National Patriotic Defense Team" has said they would also be present at the Kentucky Derby.. . News2Share tentatively plans to cover whatever happens in Louisville on September 5.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Ardel David, Dustin Gagne, and Emily Molli. . See more at http://News2share.com

D.C. activists "reclaim" art tunnel after Chamber of Commerce removes it

Aug 19, 2020

During protests over the past several weeks, a tunnel outside the Chamber of Commerce - directly across from the White House - had become a free speech wall of art for Black Lives Matter and other activists.. . Last week, the Chamber of Commerce removed the art and replaced it with a photo mural, so this weekend, activists with "The Palm Collective" held a "Reclaim D.C." event to create new art and fill the wall with it once again.. . The Chamber of Commerce said that the artwork was being preserved for display in local institutions, including museums.. . Organizers say they were never consulted.. . “Reclaim DC came out of the widespread shock and horror of a healing space, the H Street art tunnel, being taken down without the community’s consent or support,” said Beth Yirga, an organizer with the Palm Collective, a collective of DC advocacy organizations which promoted the event.. . Yirga compared the event to the Harlem Renaissance, saying “very dark times bring beautiful pieces of healing and love and connection.”. . The event atmosphere was relaxed, with a DJ playing music while adults and children spray painted, wrote on, and applied glitter to posters, panels, and the street and sidewalk.. . DC Police initially kept their distance before forming a line to keep protesters out of the street.. . Filmed by N2S Contributor TJ Jones. . Virginia Militia activist Mike Dunn argues with VCU cop

Aug 18, 2020

On Tuesday afternoon, a group of about 100 armed activists marched to Richmond, Virginia's Siegel Center to hold a pro-gun demonstration as a Special Legislative Session was held inside.. . Militia leader Mike Dunn placed himself (and his 12-gauge semi-automatic shotgun) in the street, and police demanded he return to the sidewalk.. . To the right (from this camera angle) state delegates were talking to media. Dunn argued to cop he should be allowed there too as long as they were. Ultimately, the police backed down and allowed him to stay.. . Protest video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Yu_LhWn_X0Y. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Virginia Militia marches against gun control during Special Legislative Session in Richmond

Aug 18, 2020

"All the rights for all the people!" chanted a formation of about 100 armed activists marching throughout Richmond, Virginia on Tuesday.. . The demonstration consisted of the "Virginia Militia" led by "Boogaloo" activist Mike Dunn as well as Trump supporters and a handful of Black Lives Matter activists. The group protested against gun control as Virginia held a special legislative session.. . Gun control is not a planned subject at the special legislative session.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Armed 2A rally unites BLM, Libertarians, Black Panthers, and Boogaloo Boys in Richmond

Aug 17, 2020

A "Black Guns Matter" rally Saturday afternoon in Richmond, Viriginia drew armed members of Black Lives Matter, the "Boogaloo" movement, Huey P. Newton Gun Club, Black Panthers, and Libertarian Party Vice Presidential candidate Spike Cohen.. . While coming from vastly different political ideologies, the groups united among a common distaste for Biden and Trump, and a support for the Second Amendment.. . Filmed by Sean CW Korsgaard. . Libertarian VP candidate Spike Cohen speaks at armed BLM / "Boogaloo" rally

Aug 17, 2020

Libertarian Party Vice Presidential candidate Spike Cohen spoke out Saturday as a joint rally between "Boogaloo" activisits, a Richmond Black Lives Matter group, and Black Panthers.. . "We can't say that all lives matter until we show that Black lives matter," said Cohen. "We can't show that Black lives matter until we get rid of the gun control laws that make it so hard for y'all to defend your lives in the first place.". . Filmed by Sean CW Korsgaard. . Armed coalitions of left and right face off at Stone Mountain over Confederate Memorial

Aug 15, 2020

Militia groups and heavily armed right-wing activists gathered Saturday outside Stone Mountain, Georgia to hold a rally in support of the Confederate monument on the mountain's North Face. The event was countered by the F.L.O.W.E.R. Coalition (FrontLine Organization Working to End Racism), a group of protesters - some armed - who view the monument as a lasting relic to white supremacy.. . Violence broke out between the two sides, with brawls leaving several injuries. No shots were fired, and no arrests were made.. . Police stayed out of the conflict for the first five hours. In the early afternoon, police declared the event unlawful and forced both sides to disperse.. . The carving, which had been worked on until 1928, depicts Confederate leaders Jefferson Davis, Robert E. Lee, and Stonewall Jackson. It was originally funded in part with aid from the Ku Klux Klan. In 1960, the State of Georgia bought the property, rendering it a state park.. . The City of Stone Mountain announced Friday evening that the entire park would be closed due to the demonstrations.. . Chris Hill led the Georgia Chapter of the III% Security Force into the event.. . The activists supporting the monument organized under the monicker of "Heritage Not Hate.". . Atlanta Antifa, which is itself a part of the F.L.O.W.E.R. coalition, disagrees, calling Stone Mountain a "racist landmark." Ahead of the event, they released an article noting the promotion of the event by formerly avowed neo-Nazi Adam Wesley Sitton, 2017 Charlottesville Unite the Right rally participant Chester Doles, and avowed white nationalist Michael "Weaver" Carothers. None of the three ultimately participated Saturday.. . “III%” refers to the historical theory that only three percent of the population of the American colonies participated in the revolution against Britain. It is now used by right-of-center non-government militia groups in the United States.. . The all-Black "Not F***ing Around Coalition" (NFAC) militia had been rumored to attend the event, but confirmed Wednesday evening that they would not be coming. The NFAC held an armed march in early July at Stone Mountain also advocating the removal of the confederate monument.. . In February 2019, the F.L.O.W.E.R. Coalition held a march unopposed after right-wingers cancelled their plans to hold a rally in support of the monument. The group burned an effigy of a Klansman and chanted "Sandblast Stone Mountain!". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Ardel David, Dustin Gagne, and Emily Molli. . See more at http://News2share.com

Protesters rally outside DHS Secretary Chad Wolf's Alexandria, VA home

Aug 9, 2020

Protesters marched to DHS Secretary Chad Wolf's Alexandria, Virginia home Sunday morning to protest against ICE as well as the deployment of federal troops to cities against protesters.. . A handful of feds watched on his property as the activists demanded ICE "free them all!". . Protesters focused particularly on the use of tear gas by federal agents in Portland. They contend that tear gas may be an aborticide, and pregnant protesters could be at risk of losing their babies.. . "Let's get real about what the values are of this administration," said one activist, criticizing the use of what she calls "abortion gas" by the Trump administration, which frames itself as anti-abortion.. . Paul 'Luke' Kuhn, a frequent in the Washington DC protest space, added that a COVID spike could be occurring in Portland unlike other cities with demonstrations.. . He says that perhaps tear gas is exacerbating the spread of COVID among activists and those around them.. . Before leaving Secretary Chad Wolf's Alexandria home, the activists told the federal agent guarding the home that they should quit their jobs and "do something ethical for your country" like "work for the postal service.". . "We'll be back!" chanted protesters as they left, promising to return in two weeks.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Protesters rally outside DHS Secretary Chad Wolf’s Virginia Home

Protesters rally outside DHS Secretary Chad Wolf’s house in Alexandria, VA. They condemn DHS troops used against protesters in cities like Portland. Filmed by Ford Fischer

Protesters hold "F*** The Police" march in DC on tenth weekend of George Floyd protests

Aug 8, 2020

The They/Them Collective, a self-described "anarchist abolitionist" group held a "F*** The Police" march Saturday night in Washington DC.. . They spoke in front of people dining outside, and asked them to raise their fists to "declare your loyalty" to black lives. Most of the people did so.. . The event remained mostly peaceful other than a brief fight in the Dupont area between the group and an onlooker.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Protesters hold "Defund The Police" march throughout DC - 8/8/2020

Aug 8, 2020

In the tenth weekend of actions since the George Floyd protests began, Washington DC activists held a "Defund The Police" march Satuday afternoon.. . The situation briefly turned tense as a driver was blocked on the Key Bridge, which connects Virginia and Washington DC. The driver spat at protesters, who responded by throwing water bottles as she sped away.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . BLM Hold “Defund The Police” March In DC

Aug 8, 2020

DC Black Lives Matter activists hold a march to “Defund the Police.” Filmed by Ford Fischer

Jacob Wohl denies “kidnapping” former White House staffer Merritt Corrigan

Aug 6, 2020

Conservative political fraudsters Jacob Wohl and Jack Burkman held a press conference Thursday afternoon to deny allegations that Wohl "kidnapped" former White House staffer Merritt Corrigan, as her Twitter account was used to tweet homophobic messages that got her fired.. . Wohl says he had a romantic and sexual relationship with Corrigan at the time.. . Corrigan had served as deputy White House liaison for the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID.). . According to reporting by Will Sommer at Daily Best, Corrigan later claimed that the texts had been sent by Wohl on her behalf and without her consent.. . "I did NOT send these messages, and while I vehemently protested about them being sent in my name, my devices were not in my control," she told Daily Beast in a statement. "I see now that I was part of an abusive scheme and I was used to attack people that have nothing to do with me.". . Wohl then released a statement calling for the Thursday press conference and stating that he'd falsely been accused of "kidnapping" Corrigan.. . Burkman and Wohl spent the press conference denying the allegations, and blaming them on conservative journalist Raheem Kassam, a long-time friend of Corrigan who apparently came to her aid.. . Following the press conference, Wohl published a 90 second recording from a two hour conversation he reports having with Corrigan after the incident that he claims exonerates him of wrongdoing.. . The recording, however, shows Corrigan accusing Wohl of preventing her from having contact with her friends, and Wohl accusing Kassam of creating the situation.. . Corrigan doesn't appear to say anything corroborating Wohl's account of events.. . Reached for comment, Kassam told News2Share that, "my involvement in the matter extends to picking up my old friend when she called crying asking for help, and helping her explain to reporters that she didn't send the tweets of her own volition.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Antifascist activist Jason Charter speaks out, denies being "ringleader of Antifa"

Aug 5, 2020

Antifa activist Jason Charter held a press conference Wednesday afternoon alongside his lawyer where he denied the Trump administration's claim that he is the "ringleader of antifa.". . "My name is Jason Charter, and I am a proud antifascist," he began.. . "The 'ringleader of antifa' statement is as absurd as it is false," he said. "Antifa is an idea which simply means to be against fascism.". . "We organize horizontally and don't believe in a hierarchy, so can how could there be leaders?" he asked. "The only reason I was arrested was so Trump could put a face to the unrest around the country surrounding the longstanding racism in the United States.". . Charter currently faces three felony counts related to the statue of Andrew Jackson in front of the White House, which was vandalized on June 22, 2020 by a group of George Floyd protesters.. . The charges include Destruction of Government Property, Destruction of Veterans' Memorials, and Aiding and Abetting.. . Another charge of Destruction of Government Property pertaining to the statue of Albert Pike that had been torn down on June 22, 2020 was dropped by prosecutors.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Party for Socialism and Liberation leads DC march to defund police

Jul 26, 2020

Hundreds of protesters led by the Party for Socialism and Liberation - PSL held a "March Against Trump's Police State" in Washington D.C. Saturday afternoon, demanding "not only defunding the police" but abolishing the police and ICE altogether.. . "We have every intention of not just decreasing the amount of money that the police get," Socialist activist Sean Blackmon told News2Share. "We intend to take some of the money that they already have and put it back into the hands of DC's poor and working class black communities.". . Filmed by New News2Share contributor TJ Jones. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Jul 26, 2020

The all-Black "Not F***ing Around Coalition" aka NFAC held an armed march throughout Louisville, Kentucky on Saturday, concluding with a nearly hour-long speech by NFAC leader John Fitzgerald Johnson, aka “The Real Grandmaster Jay.". . “Grandmaster Jay" demanded answers in the death of Breonna Taylor, and pledged that the group would return and burn the city down in four weeks if that doesn't happen.. . He had newer members raise their fists for a pledge: "I, [say your name], will never allow the murder of another black man, woman, or child whether the killer is white or black. Jul 18, 2020

Note to Youtube: This video is documentary, recorded raw footage of a current event. It contains no violation of any community standards and is for historical and analytical purposes.. . A heavily armed coalition of right wingers including militia activists, members of the "Proud Boys" group, and Trump supporters faced off Saturday afternoon with Black Lives Matter and Antifa in Columbus, Ohio.. . The event began as a rally against an executive order that could impose jail time for failing to wear a mask in certain parts of Ohio. Members of the "boogaloo" movement had participated in the rally, but largely sided with BLM and antifa when police split the two sides.. . At least one member of the Ohio chapter of a new "Black Panther" organization also participated in the anti-mask rally.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . "Blue Lives Matter" protesters held a rally supporting police in Brooklyn, New York on Sunday night, where they clashed with Black Lives Matter activists into the night.. . Multiple arrests were made over hours of fighting between the two sides.. . "Racists go home!" chanted Black Lives Matter activists at the police supporters.. . Anti-police protesters set fire to American flags and a mock Klan hood as the sun set on New York City.. . "1000 Mile March for Change, Justice, and Equality" arrives in Minneapolis

Jul 13, 2020

Since June 2, Alabama man Terry Willis has been walking from Huntsville, AL toward Minneapolis - over 1000 miles away - to visit the death site of George Floyd.. . As he arrived, his "1000 Mile March for Change, Justice, and Equality" was joined by 600 community members who cheered "one man, two feet!" to celebrate his accomplishment. Some local activists performed armed security.. . Willis has raised over $40,000, which he says he will use to start a non-profit "focused solely on teaching individuals with a criminal history and juvenile delinquents a trade" to enter the workforce.. . Confederate "Soldiers and Sailors" statue removed in Richmond

Jul 8, 2020

The city of Richmond, Virginia took down their Confederate Soldiers and Sailors statue Wednesday morning. Richmond residents watched and picnicked as work crews removed the monument and placed it into a truck to take away.. . Richmond Mayor Levar Stoney cited emergency powers on July 1 to order the removal of all Confederate monuments owned by the city.. . American Civil War Museum Education Programs Manager Joseph Rogers was at the removal and said that "monuments to white supremacy" need to come down and other programs like education need to be better funded before new monuments go up.. . Activists submit petitions to make psychedelics "lowest law enforcement priority" in DC

Jul 6, 2020

Activists delivered 36,249 signatures to the DC Board of Elections today for an initiative that would make psychedelic plants and fungi such as "Magic Mushrooms" the "lowest law enforcement priority" in Washington D.C.. . The activists spoke out and had a dance party as the government began counting the 13,419 pages of signitures.. . Assuming at least 35,000 signatures survive any challenges, the proposal - Initiative 81 - will be on the general election ballot in D.C. in November.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Armed Pro-Gun and BLM activists join for rally against police and gov't overreach in Richmond

Jul 6, 2020

Note to Youtube: This documentary footage contains no scenes of violence or any other violations of community guidelines and is for historical and news documentation purposes.. . Activists from a right-leaning, pro-gun movement led by activist Mike Dunn aka "Virginia Knight" joined forces Saturday with Black Lives Matter for a rally in Richmond, Virginia against police violence and government overreach.. . Police had closed off a small, shaded area near the approved rally location, but armed activists from both movements literally linked arms to claim the area. Police made no arrests.. . The groups found common ground especially on the deaths of Breonna Taylor and Duncan Lemp, a black woman and white man respectively who were both killed in no-knock police raids this year.. . The autonomous zone in Seattle was dismantled earlier this week, but a handful of right-wingers went anyway, and were chased by antifascist activists.. . One antifa activist was maced and got arrested by police when he attempted to report it to police, along with a friend of his.. . Boogaloo and BLM activists confront "white supremacy" at Richmond rally

Jul 4, 2020

"White supremacy sucks!" chanted both boogaloo and Black Lives Matter protesters on Saturday in Richmond, Virginia.. . The activists from both camps had merged for an armed rally addressing issues of police brutality and gun control, but divisions occurred when members of the "Propertarian Institute" - a group that uses white nationalist talking points - arrived at the event.. . One boogaloo speaker had rhetorically asked whether anyone at the event considers themselves racist. Three "Propertarians" raised their hand.. . The sides largely split, but as a "Propertarian" gave a speech, both boogaloo and BLM activists marched back toward them chanting "White supremacy sucks!". . Some in the audience of the speech were in disagreement about whether the "Propertarians" are racist. This led to arguing and a very very brief physical confrontation.. . One participant accidentally dropped his magazine and had to put it back into his rifle. . "We don't do that Nazi shit," said Mike Dunn, a marine veteran and the organizer of the original event in a debrief with his group afterwards.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Richmond removes Confederate Matthew Maury Statue

Jul 2, 2020

Following yesterday's order by Richmond Mayor Levar Stoney to remove all Confederate Statues immediately, a second Confederate figure was removed. The statue of Matthew Maury, a Confederate Naval officer, was removed this morning along with statues of two cannons. The statue had been in place since 1929. On Wednesday, a statue of Stonewall Jackson had also been removed.. . "All of them got to go," said one armed Black Lives Matter activist at the scene, who says the statues are a tool of segregation.. . Filmed by Jon Farina. . Stonewall Jackson statue removed in Richmond

Jul 1, 2020

Activists cheered and watched as Richmond authorities cut down their statue of Confederate General Stonewall Jackson today following an executive order by Mayor Levar Stoney to have all Confederate statues immediately removed.. . One man came to the scene with a flag that read "Respect, protect, and save our Confederate monuments." A group of activists surrounded him. As police escorted him away, the flag was taken out of his hands by protesters, who later set it on fire.. . Filmed by Sean CW Korsgaard. . Police arrest activist early morning June 29 outside White House

Jun 29, 2020

The Metropolitan Police Department arrested activist Camilla Greer early Monday morning at the #BHAZ zone outside the White House. She had been handing out water bottles, including one to News2Share's own Ford Fischer less than a minute before the arrest.. . Seemingly without provocation, police hopped the barriers they erected around St. John's Church and handcuffed her, pulling her eastbound while police pushed back the rest of the crowd.. . Police wouldn't confirm what she was charged with or if she had a warrant.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Jun 28, 2020

“Super Happy Fun America” – the group behind the Boston “Straight Pride Parade” – hosted a pro-police rally in Boston Saturday afternoon. The event attracted neo-Nazi organization “Nationalist Social Club,” who organizers asked police to remove. Police refused.. . Antifascist and other left-wing groups showed up to oppose the pro-police rally, but were kept across the street. As the pro-police rally ended, the antifascist groups held a march of their own against police brutality.. . Following the rally, "AntiFashGordon" - an antifa activist who uses Twitter to detail right-wing activities - was critical of SHFA's attempt to kick out neo-Nazis. In particular, one neo-Nazi who had attended, Chris Hood, had reportedly participated in several of SFHA's events under its previous branding. . . https://twitter.com/AntiFashGordon/status/1277562269786943488. . Black Lives Matter Marches In DC

D.C. "FTP" protesters march to, rally outside City Councilperson Charles Allen's (D) house

Jun 26, 2020

Protesters demanding for police to be defunded marched through Washington DC Thursday night. Their final destination was outside the house of City Councilperson Charles Allen (D), who they say proposed only a 2% cut for the police out of a proposal by Mayor Muriel Bowser (D) that already increases police funding by 3.3%.. . The activists say they demand the police department be abolished, not grown at a slower rate.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . D.C. "FTP" protesters rally inside restaurant

Jun 25, 2020

Activists holding a "FTP: F*** the Police" march Thursday night entered a Peruvian restaurant called "Pisco y Nazca Ceviche Gastrobar" in Washington D.C. to protest in front of people dining inside.. . The march was led by the "They/Them Collective" which describes itself an anarchist abolitionist collective.". . "Black lives matter!" the group chanted, before describing a few specific cases of police violence they wanted to draw attention to.. . Nobody was hurt or arrested.. . Before leaving, the group asked the patrons that, "If you believe that black trans lives matter, we ask you to raise your hand up in the air in solidarity with all black and brown people murdered by the police.". . The patrons all raised their hands.. . "We demand you abolish the police," they said before leaving.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . BLM and Antifa Hold Juneteenth March in D.C. - 6/19/2020

Jun 21, 2020

Black Lives Matter and antifascist activists marched in Washington DC on Friday - the Juneteenth holiday - to demand criminal justice reform including the defunding of police.. . At the conclusion of the march, activists tore down and set fire to D.C.'s statue of Albert Pike, the only statue commemorating a figure who participated in the Confederate Army in the district: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6rLtqXiwtyo. . Filmed by Jon Farina. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Armed "Cowboy Militia" patrols Tulsa during Trump rally

Jun 21, 2020

During Saturday night's Trump rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma, some armed activists patrolled the streets. . . One protester confronted some labelled "Cowboys Militia.". . "Are you gonna shoot us?" he asked.. . "That's not our intent brother," one "Cowboy Militia" member replied.. . As they talked, the militiaman convinced the protester he's there to protect all sides at the event, and that he doesn't identify with the Republican or Democratic Party.. . The two ended up hugging, before News2Share got a chance to interview the militiaman.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer.. . Fighting, One Trump Supporter Arrested before Trump Tulsa Rally

Jun 20, 2020

Before President Trump held his rally in Tulsa, Oklahoma Saturday night, protesters marched around the rally's perimeter.. . On the east side, police shut down an entrance briefly and used force to push activists back to reopen.. . Next, at the south entrance, National Guardsman attempted to hold back the crowd and separate them from Trump supporters. One Trump supporter charged at the activists, throwing at least one punch before being arrested.. . Finally, protesters went to the west entrance, where police mostly did not intervene. Protesters chanted "Karen! Karen!" at a lone Trump supporter before pouring a bottle of water on her. Other activists de-escalated the situation, and the group left otherwise peacefully.. . See protest continue into the night, during/after the rally itself: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aZsKu7thVow. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Inside "CHAZ" - Seattle's "Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone" Raw Footage

Jun 18, 2020

For ten days, hundreds of activists have occupied a 6-block space in Seattle, Washington, declaring it the cop-free "Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone" in the wake of protests over the death of George Floyd.. . News2Share explores the "CHAZ" and speaks to its occupants about their tactics and what they hope to achieve.. . One occupant said that the “CHAZ” has been misrepresented by news organizations like Fox, who try to brand them as violent and even “terrorist.” He says CHAZ is a chance to protest against racism and express a need to reallocate funding from police and toward social programs.. . Cal Anderson Park, which falls entirely inside the “Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone,” has become a place where participants are given a stage to speak on the issues they advocate for: namely abolishing racism, capitalism, and policing.. . Filmed by Ben S.. . Filmed by Ben S.. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. George Floyd protests shut down highway on two week anniversary of Trump church photo op

Jun 15, 2020

Hundreds marched from the White House to highway 395 Monday night to protest against police violence. The group began outside St. John's Church, where two weeks ago protesters had been forced away by police and military forces ahead of President Trump posing there with a bible.. . The march was led by Sean Blackmon with the Party for Socialism and Liberation, and musician Kenny Sway.. . "It was not curfew yet," said Blackmon in front of St. John's. "The police and all the agencies came down this street. And they were firing flash bang grenades.". . "They were shooting tear gas, pepper spray, all sorts of things to disrupt the demonstration," he said. "And they broke us up.". . Activists blocked the highway during rush-hour traffic to commemorate the deaths of George Floyd and Breonna Taylor at the hands of police. The officers involved in Floyd's death have been arrested and charged; officers who shot Taylor have not been charged.. . Some drivers participated in the protest as their cars were blocked, but a few took issue. One woman exited her car to argue with protesters, while another tried to drive by and was blocked by a police cruiser.. . After several minutes, the group marched back to the White House and dispersed peacefully.. . "This is what I want to do next. I really want to cause a lot of ruckus in these neighborhoods," said Sway of future protests. "Even if we gotta go to each neighborhood for 30 minutes to wake their ass up. We gotta do it.". . There were no injuries or arrests.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . . . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . See more at http://News2share.com

Hundreds including original Black Panthers member rally in NYC for black and hispanic lives

Jun 15, 2020

Thousands of activists including an original member of the Black Panthers marched throughout New York City Sunday evening to promote solidarity for black and hispanic lives against police violence.. . "We don't beat white supremacy in isolation. We beat it together," one speaker said. "There's no reforming the police... It is our call and our duty to call for it to be abolished.". . "The police was an institution created to return escaped slaves to the plantation. We say 'Abolish the police!'" said Johanna Fernandez, a CUNY professor and historian.. . "We don't beat white supremacy in isolation. We beat it together," another speaker said. "There's no reforming the police.". . "It is our call and our duty to call for it to be abolished," she added, echoing recent calls to "#DefundThePolice.". . Filmed by N2S Contributor Jon Farina. . Protesters peacefully march for George Floyd ahead of curfew in D.C. - 6/2/2020

Jun 14, 2020

Before Washington D.C.’s 7 p.m. curfew went into effect on the afternoon of June 2, 2020, hundreds of protesters marched throughout the city peacefully demanding “Justice for George Floyd!” . . As the group reached the Lincoln Memorial, a heavily armed brigade of police and military were already on the steps.. . The group formed a plan to peacefully approach and rally without confronting the police physically. No violence occurred.. . As heavily armed government forces looked down on them from the steps above, the participants raised their fists in the air and prayed.. . They peacefully dispersed around 6:40 p.m., 20 minutes before curfew began.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Looting, Tear Gas, Rubber Bullets during D.C.'s third night of George Floyd Protests - 5/31/2020

Jun 14, 2020

Protesters faced off with police for the third night in a row on May 31, 2020 in Washington D.C. Several buildings were looted, and some - such as the AFL-CIO - were set on fire.. . . Police responded aggressively using rubber bullets, pepper rounds, and tear gas.. . For eight minutes, they held Zenger's Ford Fischer in a "kettle" with about 30 other protesters.. . . . "Kettling" is a tactic in which police surround a group to prevent them from leaving. In this case, they were allowed to leave slowly and ordered to disperse.. . . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Armed activists protest local gun control proposal in Alexandria, VA

Jun 13, 2020

About 300 pro-gun activists, many of them armed, gathered for a rally Saturday afternoon at the Alexandria City Hall in Virginia.. . A recently passed state law allows Virginia cities to ban firearms in specific locations such as government property. Alexandria is the first city to propose local restrictions like this.. . “No more gun control!” the activists chanted Saturday afternoon.. . Philip Van Cleave, the president of the Virginia Citizen’s Defense League (VCDL), led the rally. He began by saying that the Second Amendment is the “Right that defends all of the other rights.”. . “There’s no doubt that if we lose the Second Amendment, it’s over,” Van Cleave said.. . “We need to let them know that this is not the United States of the Democratic Party,” said Chuck Smith, a Republican candidate for Virginia Attorney General.. . “This is not the United States of the Black Lives Matter. This is the United States where all lives matter,” he told the crowd. “Police Lives Matter.”. . Paul Moog, the founder of the VCDL, made the point that he wants to rebrand to “peaceable gun owners” because “law-abiding gun owners, not so much anymore. If they’re gonna pass stupid laws, forget that.”. . Shannon Watts, founder of the gun control group “Moms Demand Action” tweeted a criticism signs claiming that “Gun control is systemic racism.”. . “400,000,000 guns in the hands of civilians and too few gun laws haven’t changed 400 years of systemic racism or stopped police brutality,” Watts wrote. “In fact, Black men and boys are 15 times more likely to be shot and injured than their white peers.”. . . . . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . . . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Armed Pro-Gun Activists Rally in New Hampshire

Mar 14, 2020

Hundreds of pro-gun activists - many of them open carrying firearms - held a rally in Concord, NH Saturday afternoon to demand legislatures "Hold the Line" against gun control.. . The group gathered in spite of the current national state of emergency declared by President Trump and NH state of emergency declared by Gov. Chris Sununu. There were no counter-protesters, arrests, or violence.. . The rally was organized by the Women's Defense League of New Hampshire (WDLNH), which describes itself as "a group of women in New Hampshire who wanted to focus on training and educating women in the state as well as standing on the forefront of 2nd Amendment legislative issues at the State House.". . "We will not stand down," said Kimberly Morin, president of WDLNH. "We will continue to fight for our rights.". . "Beto O'Rourke said he's gonna take your guns,"' Former NH GOP Vice Chair Matt Mayberry told the crowd to boos. "Joe Biden says he's gonna come and take your guns!" . . "Are you ready to fight?" he asked to cheers. . . "I am a Republican woman, and my party is often assaulted by the other side saying we don't believe women's rights," said Victoria Sullivan, a Former New Hampshire State Representative. "This is the number one right for women right here. The right to defend their own self, protect their person, protect their family, and to protect their home." . . "We don't deserve that any less than the men on the other side do," she added.. . Caleb Q. Dyer - who served in the New Hampshire Legislature as a Libertarian - came out to the rally with a Mosin–Nagant, which was built in 1938 and saw its way through WWII.. . He pointed out that it's literally a "weapon of war" but wouldn't be banned by proposed gun laws.. . "I think [the rally] showed there's plenty of regular people out there who own guns and want to keep owning them," Dyer told News2Share.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Chelsea Manning Released from Jail - 3/12/2020

Mar 12, 2020

One year after being jailed for refusing to testify in front of a grand jury, Chelsea Manning was released from the Alexandria Adult Detention Center Thursday night. She was picked up by her lawyer, Moira Meltzer-Cohen, who entered the facility in a car and picked her up there.. . Manning made no statement to the press directly, but her legal team offered the following statement:. . "Judge Anthony Trenga today ordered Chelsea Manning’s release from confinement, after the apparent conclusion of the grand jury to which she had been subpoenaed, and before which she refused to testify. He further ordered that she pay $256,000 in fines which accrued each day she refused to cooperate with the grand jury. . . Needless to say we are relieved and ask that you respect her privacy while she gets on her feet.". . Sheriff Dana Lawhorne made a brief statement to the press verifying that she had been released from custody around 7:45pm.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Elizabeth Banks Speaks Against Abortion Restrictions Outside Supreme Court - Full Speech

Mar 4, 2020

Actress Elizabeth Banks spoke out against abortion restrictions outside the Supreme Court Wednesday morning.. . "I had the privilege of always knowing I could access abortion care. Just knowing I would never be forced to carry a child I did not want - knowledge men carry 24/7 - left me free to dream, free to pursue, free to become the woman I am standing here today," she said.. . "But abortion care cannot be just a privilege preserved for those in the right state, the right economic class," she added. "It must be a right." . . Pro-Choice Activists Hold "My Right, My Decision" Rally at Supreme Court

Mar 4, 2020

Hundreds of pro-choice activists gathered Wednesday morning in front of the Supreme Court to demand that justices rule against Louisiana abortion restrictions in the first landmark abortion case since the appointment of Judges Kavanaugh and Gorsuch.. . Representatives Barbara Lee and Diana DeGette, Senator Richard Blumenthal, and actress Elizabeth Banks participated.. . The case of "June Medical Services v. Russo" will determine whether Louisiana can require that abortion providers have admitting privileges at local hospitals. Activists say the requirement is intended to shut down clinics and doesn't serve women's safety.. . A similar law passed in Texas was already struck down by the Supreme Court in 2016.. . "The only thing that has changed is the makeup of this court," said Rep. Lee.. . "I had the privilege of always knowing I could access abortion care. Just knowing I would never be forced to carry a child I did not want - knowledge men carry 24/7 - left me free to dream, free to pursue, free to become the woman I am standing here today," said Banks.. . "But abortion care cannot be just a privilege preserved for those in the right state, the right economic class," she added. "It must be a right.". . "Abortion in legal in this country, and it needs to be available to everybody" said Rep. Diana DeGette who led a chant of "Our voice is our power.". . "Here is a memo to Donald Trump and his appointees to this court. This is what America looks like, and America is for reproductive rights," said Senator Blumenthal. "America is for the principle: My right, my decision!". . "I became an abortion provider, because abortion is an essential part of healthcare," said Katie McHugh, an OB/GYN and abortion provider "And because patients need and deserve care that is based on medicine, science and fact.". . "The fact is that laws posing an undue burden without improving patient care are unconstitutional," she said.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . . . Trump Jr., Kevin McCarthy, and Sen. Josh Hawley on Social Media Censorship - CPAC

Feb 28, 2020

Donald Trump, Jr., Sen. Josh Hawley (MO) and Leader Kevin McCarthy (CA-23) sat on a panel moderated by Amber Athey (The Spectator) about how they'd like to deal with the social media landscape as conservatives.. . "What's the Right Path Forward on Big Tech" was the theme of the panel, which took place on the third day of the 2020 annual Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC). . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Jack Burkman / Jacob Wohl Presser on Roger Stone Documents

Feb 27, 2020

Right-wing activists Jacob Wohl and Jack Burkman held a press conference Thursday afternoon alleging "an open, systematic, and deliberate conspiracy between [Judge] Amy Berman Jackson and the prosecution to produce a jury pool that would convict Roger" Stone.. . The pair released a series of documents, which they claim are authentic questionnaires - including names - of those in the Roger Stone jury pool.. . Stone's attorneys have asked for a new trial on the basis of the jury foreman's political beliefs expressed on Twitter, but have not alleged that any other juror committed any misdeed.. . Feb 24, 2020

About a dozen activists were arrested Monday morning outside the Supreme Court protesting against the Atlantic Coast Pipeline, refusing to unblock the streets.. . "We will not let you build this pipeline!" they chanted while put into plastic handcuffs.. . The Supreme Court is hearing arguments today over whether to reissue a permit for the construction of the Atlantic Coast Pipeline, which had been blocked by a lower court.. . President Trump supports the pipeline's construction, which would pump gas through West Virginia, Virginia, and North Carolina.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . 4K Video: Roger Stone Sentenced to 40 Months in Prison

Feb 20, 2020

Longtime Trump ally Roger Stone was sentenced to 40 months in prison Thursday afternoon. . . News2Share was there and captured 4K video of him entering and exiting the courthouse, as well as his supporters and protesters.. . Late last year, Stone was convicted of one count of obstructing a proceeding, five counts of making false statements to Congress and one count of witness tampering in the Mueller probe.. . A few members of the right-wing group "The Proud Boys - of which Stone is an honorary member - showed up at court to support him.. . “Nobody should do years in jail supposedly for lying to a body that’s whole job is to lie to the American people," said Proud Boys President Enrique Tarrio, referring to charges of making false statements to Congress.. . He added that he wants Trump to pardon Stone today, as soon as Stone steps out of court.. . Claude Taylor, a prominent anti-Trump activist, inflated a giant rat in front of the courthouse. . . To him, Stone is "a rat who works for an even bigger rat," he told News2Share.. . As press awaited the recently sentenced Stone to exit the courthouse, right-wing journalist Own Shroyer began yelling at journalists.. . "This case should already have been thrown out with a mistrial" he told reporters. "This is politically motivated to get Trump.". . Stone exited the courthouse and departed in a black SUV with a grin but without making any statement.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Workers Picket DC Safeway for "Fair Contract" - Strike Vote March 5

Feb 19, 2020

"We work! We sweat! We want more in our checks!". . Today union workers picketed outside a Washington DC Safeway store to demand a contract with better wages and healthcare.. . They say that if their demands aren't met by March 5, they will vote on a strike.. . "The greatest crime-fighting tool is a good paying job with good benefits," said Aisha Braveboy, the State’s Attorney for Prince George's County, Maryland.. . Michelle Lee, a 32-year veteran of Safeway who works at store #1283 in Alexandria, VA, says "we help this company make billions of dollars.". . "All of us have made sacrifices for this company" she said to cheers. "This company better damn well give us a good contract!". . According to the UFCW Local 400 union, "25,000 grocery workers at hundreds of stores in the region could go out on strike" if their demands are not met by March 5.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Antifa Face off with "Patriot Front" White Nationalists Throughout DC

Feb 8, 2020

Police escorted about 150 masked white nationalists from the group "Patriot Front" throughout Washington DC Saturday afternoon, while antifa confronted them.. . "Patriot Front" is a rebranding of "Vanguard America" - an avowed fascist group - who participated in the "Unite the Right" rally in Charlottesville. The group uses patriotic imagery and terms to sell an explicitly anti-Semitic and white nationalist ideology.. . The group was led by its founder - Thomas Ryan Rousseau (born 1998) - who was the only participant not wearing a mask.. . James Alex Fields - now serving a sentence of life in prison for the murder of Heather Heyer - was associated with "Vanguard America.". . The group began Saturday afternoon at Arlington Memorial Cemetery and marched into Washington DC, starting with the Lincoln Memorial where they were confronted by antifascist activists.. . They then marched to the Capitol under police escort, and were given exclusive access to the Capitol lawn, which was cleared of all non-Patriot Front attendees and police officers.. . "Patriot Front" activists concluded by entering a Walmart parking lot from where they recovered about half a dozen trucks and drove away.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Police mostly managed to separate the two sides, but brief fighting occurred when a pro-Trump activist entered the anti-Trump side of the barricade.. . Protesters Gather to Condemn Trump Acquittal at Capitol

Feb 5, 2020

Following the senate's 48-52 and 47-53 votes to acquit President Donald Trump in his impeachment trial, protesters gathered outside the Capitol to express their frustration with Republican Senators.. . Congresswoman Ayanna Pressley spoke at the rally, expressing her frustration with the senate.. . She says Trump has "no empathy and no moral compass" but condemned Republican senators in particular who she says have "failed" the American people.. . Senator Jeff Merkley also spoke out, calling on people to elect a Democratic president and senate.. . "We have to channel the darkness we feel on this tragic day and put this nation back on track," Senator Merkley said. "That means not just a blue oval office. That means a blue senate as well.". . "They've opened the door to Pandora's box of dangerous corruption in an election year," added former CIA agent and conservative independent 2016 presidential candidate Evan McMullin.. . The group promised to continue protesting as soon as Thursday morning.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . "FTP3" Anti-Police Protest Faces off with NYPD - Raw Video

Jan 31, 2020

About 45 activists were arrested as the third "FTP" protest against the police marched throughout New York City Friday night.. . The protesters demand that public transportation be made free and that the NYPD itself be abolished.. . The protest began in Grand Central Terminal, where police threatened to arrest anyone wearing masks. As hundreds assembled, several dozen were wearing masks. Police periodically stepped in and pulled masked protesters out, arresting them ahead of the march kicking off.. . In at least one case, activists attempted to physically prevent an arrestee from being taken outside. The ensuring struggle resulted in further arrests.. . The group eventually left Grand Central Terminal, chanting "How do you spell racist? NYPD!". . In the first "FTP" protest, activists had hopped subway turnstiles in the hundreds. The civil disobedience was intended to promote the group's demand that the New York subway be made free to ride.. . Friday night, police attempted to prevent activists from entering the subway, sometimes pushing them away to erect barriers.. . "Back the fuck up!" yelled an officer at an activist trying to get into the subway.. . Dozens made it in through an uncovered entrance, either hopping the turnstiles or going through an emergency gate.. . The activists spanned as far as Brooklyn, where police deployed mace on at least one occasion.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Students Rally for Police-Free Zones in New York Schools

Jan 31, 2020

Ahead of Friday night's "FTP3 City-Wide Day of Transit Action" protest in New York City, activists led by the "Free CUNY" movement held a demonstration on the steps of New York City's Department of Education.. . The group called for the removal of all police from schools and subways in the city, which they say should both be fully funded and free to use.. . "We intend to transform our city," said one activist of the goal for Friday night's FTP3 event. "We can have a cop-free city. We can keep ourselves and each other safe!". . Beyond cops, the group wants military recruiters out of schools.. . "Recruiters target black and brown students because they know that CUNY is becoming unaffordable" they say. "NYPD cops work with Israel! F**k these cops! Fuck these recruiters! Free Palestine! Liberation for all!". . "This is a fascist system ran by a fascist, and the cops work for the fascist system!" said an organizer, who led a chant of "Black Lives Matter!". . "Education is a right, not just for the rich and white!" chanted the crowd.. . Full livestream recording of the entire event here: https://twitter.com/FordFischer/status/1223249625693315072. . Jan 21, 2020

Jenkins refuses to enforce gun control he views as unconstitutional, and he's promised to deputize thousands of gun owners if new restrictions are passed.. . "There is a line that we will not allow to be crossed as it related to the Second Amendment," Sheriff Jenkins told News2Share.. . N2S also spoke to State Senator Bryce Reeves, who Sheriff Jenkins deputized. Reeves said Northam's gun restrictions at the event Monday were "martial law.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Jan 21, 2020

A coalition of anarchist, socialist, libertarian and other activists gathered Monday afternoon in Las Vegas for a direct action protesting an anti-homeless law against "camping" in public. The group set up sleeping bags and tents in an intersection, causing police to forcefully arrest them.. . At least one activist was injured. . . "Our only worry was how they were gonna react and it was heavy-handed like always. They pounced on us," organizer Joey Lankowski told News2Share while in handcuffs. "They just came in full force, jumped on us, busted Kelly's head up.". . Filmed by Josh F Sigurdson. . Gun Rights Activists Rally in Richmond - Raw Footage

Jan 20, 2020

Approximately 22,000 demonstrators descended on the Capitol District in Richmond, Virginia Monday to voice concerns over proposed state gun control legislation and to show their support for the second amendment.. . A planned ‘Militia March on Richmond’ event coincided with Lobby Day, the Virginia Citizen’s Defense League’s (VCDL) annual petition to state government to maintain their second amendment rights without restriction.. . Governor Ralph Northam declared a state of emergency ahead of the event, citing his fear of a repeat of the deadly 2017 rally in Charlottesville. Despite anxiety over the event turning violent, no violence or arrests reportedly occurred during the event.. . “This is the safest place in the world right now,” Shane, a gun owner in attendance, said.. . Chain-link fencing and security checkpoints separated Lobby Day rally goers depending on if they entered capitol grounds or not. Those entering the capitol grounds were made to comply with a ban on various items and weapons including guns, torches and nun-chucks to enter the enclosed grounds.. . Starting before sunrise, hundreds stood in line to enter the grounds, unarmed, to voice their concerns over proposed legislation.. . Sheriff S. H. Jenkins said that sheriffs and commonwealth attorneys need to stand up to gun laws.. . "There is a line that we will not allow to be crossed when it comes to the Second Amendment," he said.. . For demonstrators not on capitol grounds, less restrictions applied. Hundreds openly carried long guns, the most common being variants of the AR-15, which proposed legislation would ban.. . Numerous militias, armed and often in full gear, made a presence in the overflowing streets surrounding the Statehouse.. . Lightfoot Militia, a civilian paramilitary organization present at the Charlottesville riots, was in attendance. The group marched through the streets with full color guard representing the militias multiple nationwide chapters, dispersing after presenting arms on north tenth street and singing ‘God Bless the U.S.A.,’ by Lee Greenwood.. . Chants of “USA USA USA,” “Don’t Tread on Me” and “Sic Semper Tyrannis,” could be heard billowing from demonstrators at any given moment.. . Along the many closed roads and street corners pop up shops sold clothing items popular with supporters of President Trump.. . “Don’t be a Democrat, get yourself a Trump hat,” yelled one vendor to passersby.. . “The man under the sheet wants to take your guns” was a common slogan on many signs, capitalizing on Gov. Northam’s blackface scandal. Official VCDL signs depicted a photo of two men, one is believed to be the Governor in either blackface or a Klu Klux Klan outfit. “We want black owned rifles not black faced governors,” chanted demonstrators.. . Hundreds of Richmond City Police and Virginia State Police officers were stationed across the capitol district, often manning barriers between sidewalks and off-limits roads.. . One woman was reportedly arrested after the rally for allegedly wearing and refusing to remove a bandana.. . Many attendees of the event covered their faces in balaclavas, bandanas and scarves. One unnamed police officer reportedly claimed they allowed masks due to the cold weather.. . Alex Jones, a popular conspiracy theorist, made an appearance in his customized MRAP troop transport. Jones was greeted eagerly and warmly by large crowds of people between rides in his armored vehicle.. . “You all keep thanking me, but I want to thank you!” Jones yelled after addressing a huddled group of journalists and supporters, “for being true American citizens!”. . Produced and filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Robert Caputo, and Lee Enochs. . See more at http://News2share.com

Arrested: Joaquin Phoenix, Martin Sheen, Activists at Climate Protest

Jan 10, 2020

Actors Joaquin Phoenix and Martin Sheen were among the 147 activists arrested this afternoon participating in actress Jane Fonda's "Fire Drill Fridays" civil disobedience rally against climate change at the Capitol Friday afternoon.. . Arrests were conducted without the use of handcuffs and the activists were processed and released on site.. . Fonda avoided being arrested because a fifth similar charge for her could incur serious jail time.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Senator Jeff Merkley Speaks at "No War With Iran" Rally

Jan 9, 2020

Senator Jeff Merkley spoke out Thursday night at a "No War With Iran" rally at the Capitol, ahead of the House's 224 to 194 vote to restrict President Trump's ability to take action military against Iran without the consent of congress.. . "How about we not make the mistake in Iran that we made in Iraq?" asked Senator Merkley, after thanking the House for their vote.. . The vote mostly fell on party lines, with three Republicans and Amash-I voting Yes and eight Democrats voting No. . . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Rep. Barbara Lee Speaks Against Trump on Iran Escalation

Jan 9, 2020

"Trump's dangerous and reckless actions have brought us to the brink of an all-out war with Iran," said Rep. Barbara Lee Thursday night, speaking at a "No War with Iran" rally outside the Capitol.. . The rally took place ahead of the House's 224 to 194 vote to restrict President Trump's ability to take action military against Iran without the consent of congress.. . The vote mostly fell on party lines, with three Republicans and Amash-I voting Yes and eight Democrats voting No. . . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Anti-War Activists Protest Following Trump Iran Address

Jan 8, 2020

Anti-war activists gathered in front of the White House Wednesday afternoon following President Trump's Iran address encouraging him to de-escalate the situation.. . They praised Iran for notifying the United States before bombing military bases in retaliation for the killing of Qasem Soleimani and cite it as evidence that a peaceful resolution is possible.. . Lincoln Chafee Announces 2020 Libertarian Presidential Run

Jan 8, 2020

Former Republican Senator and Democratic Governor of Rhode Island Lincoln Chafee announces his candidacy for president on the Libertarian Party ticket.. . Focusing primarily on foreign policy, Governor Chafee emphasized that he was the only Republican senator to vote against the Iraq war.. . He explained that in both 2008 and 2016, people voted for "change" and he believes they didn't get it.. . He says that the Libertarian Party was the better fit for him for being "anti-war, anti-cronyism, anti-debt, anti-torture, anti-death penalty, anti-war-on-drugs, anti-spying.". . . . Capitol Police Versus Protesters Demanding Trump Removal

Jan 6, 2020

As the senate convened for 2020, activists entered the Hart Senate Office Building to demand President Trump's removal from office. Capitol police faced off with the group over whether their gathering constituted a "protest.". . Protesting is illegal inside the senate office buildings.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . DC Activists Protest Trump Middle East Escalation

Jan 4, 2020

Hundreds of anti-war activists marched from the White House to Trump International Hotel Saturday afternoon to condemn the Trump administration's escalated military action in the Middle East. . . "Fight the rich! Not Iran! Fight the rich! Not Iran!" chanted activists with the DC chapter of the Democratic Socialists of America. Several other groups such as Black Lives Matter DC and US Labor Against War participated in the event, which was led by Codepink: Women for Peace and the ANSWER Coalition.. . Yasemin Zahra of US Labor Against War said that "it is always poor and working people who suffer the most" in war. She led a chant of "The bosses need us, we don't need them!". . The event focused on various activist intersectionality with foreign policy, such as labor and environmentalism.. . Brian Becker of ANSWER Coalition said that the conflict escalating in Iraq is "not only a violation of everything legal, of everything moral. It's a violation of what it means to be alive.". . He condemned the dehumanization of Iranians and others, where he characterizes war hawks as justifying violence against targets by saying they're "not our people.". . Kevin Zeese of Popular Resistance said President Trump is continuing a nuclear weapons race that Obama began with his trillion dollar nuclear weapons plan and that now the weapons race is even spreading into space.. . "The weapons race will be larger than we've ever seen in history," he said.. . Actress Jane Fonda also spoke out. She said that for young people, every war fought in their lifetime has been over oil and that she opposes the conflict for both humanitarian and environmental reasons.. . "The Pentagon is the biggest institutional user of fossil fuel in the world," she said. "We can't anymore lose lives and kill people and ruin environments because of oil.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . . . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . . . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Robert Caputo, and Lee Enochs. . . . See more at http://News2share.com

Jane Fonda Condemns Trump Middle East Escalation

Jan 4, 2020

Actress Jane Fonda spoke out today at an anti-war rally against President Trump's increased military action in the Middle East.. . She says that for young people, every war fought in their lifetime has been over oil. She opposes the conflict - she says - for both humanitarian and environmental reasons.. . "The Pentagon is the biggest institutional user of fossil fuel in the world," she said. "We can't anymore lose lives and kill people and ruin environments because of oil.". . Full speech: Evan McMullin supports Trump impeachment

Dec 18, 2019

Former CIA officer and independent conservative 2016 presidential candidate Evan McMullin spoke out against Trump, encouraging impeachment.. . "He cares more about getting the illegal support of foreign powers than he does about getting the support of Americans across the country," said McMullin at the "Impeach and Remove" rally outside the Capitol.. . The Indy Media Reality Show That Almost Happened - "Newsbreakers" Trailer

Dec 16, 2019

In 2018, News2Share's Ford Fischer along with six independent media friends were followed for two days by Langley Productions to generate a trailer for what would have been a reality show.. . The reality show's premise would have been that as we cover events side-by-side, camera crews would follow us to document the "behind the scenes" of our unique brands, our conflicts with the mainstream media establishment (for example - social media censorship) as well as our own philosophical disagreements with one another.. . Participants would have been Carey Wedler (then editor-at-large of The Anti-Media, Youtuber), Justin King (editor of The Fifth Column, best known for his video opinion column Beau of the Fifth Column), Derrick Broze (Founder, CEO of The Conscious Resistance Network), Nick Bernabe (editor-at-large of The Anti-Media), Robert Caputo (media entrepreneur), and Ford Fischer (editor-in-chief of News2Share.). . Langley Productions has generously released the rights to share the trailer with our audiences.. . THIS VIDEO IS PROPERTY OF LANGLEY PRODUCTIONS, AND PUBLISHED WITH THEIR PERMISSION. . . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . See more at http://News2share.com

Protesters Burn Flags, Face off with MAGA Supporters at Hershey Trump Rally

Dec 10, 2019

As President Trump spoke in Hershey, PA Tuesday night, protesters outside set MAGA flags on fire and faced off with Trump supporters.. . Right-wing media personality J Owen Shroyer entered the designated protest area and was removed by police following a confrontation.. . Police and security mostly kept the situation peaceful with barricades and officers on standby.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Activists Mourn, Protest Child Migrant Deaths at Customs and Border Protection HQ

Dec 9, 2019

Activists including clergy and Congressman Joaquin Castro held a demonstration and vigil Monday night outside Customs and Border Protection's (CBP) Washington DC headquarters to protest and mourn the deaths of migrant children in US government custody.. . "Just because you cross the border doesn't mean you're less human," said Congressman Castro. "Everybody deserves medical treatment, certain standards of care, dignity and basic respect and humanity.". . Castro explained that he's proposed legislation that would at least require CBP and ICE to report migrant deaths in their custody to congress.. . An emergency room pediatrician spoke out, explaining that she'd been able to review the autopsies of children dead in CBP's custody. Half, she says, died with the flu.. . Despite a CDC recommendation to give detainees the flu vaccine, she says CBP has not made that policy.. . "Never again means now, Jews say close the camps" said one poster with an image of a migrant child with her arm around Anne Frank.. . The group ended with a prayer facing CBP directly. They prayed that they will continue until "no children are detained but are rather welcomed into our communities, and welcomed as families to our tables. Amen.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Robert Caputo, and Lee Enochs. . See more at http://News2share.com

Congressman Joaquin Castro condemns migrant child deaths

Dec 9, 2019

"Just because you cross the border doesn't mean you're less human," said Congressman Joaquin Castro tonight outside Customs and Border Protection's HQ in DC. "Everybody deserves medical treatment, certain standards of care, dignity and basic respect and humanity.". . Castro was speaking out about the deaths of children in ICE and CBP custody, more than half of whom died of the flu.. . Full rally video: https://youtu.be/xuiLBnIX1-A. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Dec 7, 2019

Pro-Trump activists held a "Mega MAGA March" Saturday afternoon in Seattle, WA and were counter-demonstrated by antifa, who set a "Blue Lives Matter" flag on fire. Several black-bloc clad antifa activists were arrested.. . Filmed by N2S Contributor Cody Aaron Adams. . Armed "Don't Comply" activists give food, clothes to homeless in Dallas

Dec 7, 2019

Armed activists with the group "Don't Comply" held an unpermitted event Saturday in Dallas, TX where they gave food, winter clothes, and blankets to the homeless.. . The group carried guns as a deterrent to police interupting their event. . . "It is illegal to feed homeless people if you don't jump through all the hoops and licenses," said organizer Murdoch Pizgatti. "So we come down here well armed because we're not going to let anyone stop us.". . "That's what the second amendment is for. It's for feeding the homeless.". . Extinction Rebellion Gridlocks DC Traffic Protesting World Bank

Dec 6, 2019

Climate activists with Extinction Rebellion gridlocked portions of Washington DC Friday morning by splitting into groups and blocking traffic to protest the World Bank.. . The group says the World Bank continues to fund fossil fuels, which are a "death sentence" for the next generation.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . The group advocates divestment from fossil fuels and declaring a "climate emergency.". . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Gettysburg Holds Civil War Remembrance Day Parade - Confederate Flag Protested

Nov 23, 2019

Thousands of Civil War reenactors gathered Saturday in Gettysburg, where the bloodiest battle of the American civil war was fought over the course of three days. . . One protester was in attendance, who advocated that the Confederate Battle Flag and the Confederacy itself should be remembered as a symbol of slavery and racism.. . Reenactor Richard Byrd of West Virginia disagreed, saying that "both sides, men died here" and so history should be remembered from a historical rather than modern lens.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Violence, Arrests at "2nd FTP Emergency Action Against NYPD and MTA" Protest - Raw Video

Nov 22, 2019

Several activists were arrested Friday night in New York City when hundreds took to the streets in the "2nd FTP Emergency Action Against NYPD and MTA.". . Activists with "Decolonize This Place" and other groups have been protesting the New York Police Department over what they see as racist enforcement of fare evasion laws as well as arresting unlicensed vendors such as churro dispensers, as well as individuals arrested for simply eating on the train.. . In a previous demonstration, the activists had performed a mass fare evasion as an act of civil disobedience. This time, police had the subways blocked to mostly prevent a similar stunt from occurring.. . Several arrests occurred during the march, as police demanded that activists get onto the sidewalk. Some arrests occurred on the sidewalk, while others occurred on the streets, sometimes spawning momentary violence between police and protesters. . . Filmed by Ed Fabry. . Press Conference: Ex-CIA Officer Gets 19 Years for Selling Secrets to China

Nov 22, 2019

Former CIA officer Jerry Chun Shing Lee has been sentenced to 19 years in federal prison for selling American intelligence secrets to the Chinese government.. . Representatives from the FBI and the U.S. attorney's office discussed the case, the third of its kind this year.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . Enviro Activists Arrested in Nancy Pelosi's Office - Extinction Rebellion

Nov 21, 2019

Nine activists with Extinction Rebellion Washington DC were immediately arrested this afternoon after barging into a back section of Nancy Pelosi's office to demand a meeting to discuss climate change.. . "We entered into the back part of her office which was off limits," said Russell Gray, an Extinction Rebellion DC organizer. "We were there for about 30 seconds and we didn't see her, and we tried to walk out.". . "The police stopped us and arrested everybody that was in there.". . “We are hungry and angry. Pelosi’s refusal to meet with us just confirms that our leaders are ignoring the emergency. Scientists tell us that the collapse of society is inevitable unless we act now. So we will continue our hunger strike in jail if that’s what it takes to prevent this collapse,” said Giovanni Tamacas, 20, from San Francisco, California, before police arrested him.. . Mr Tamacas is the coordinator of the Global Hunger Strike. He quit his job on the hill last week so that he could hunger strike in Pelosi’s office. . . All nine are being charged with unlawful entry.. . Most activists are given three warnings in the capitol before arrests are made. In this case, the order to arrest was immediate upon police entry into the office.. . The group had been on a hunger strike, occupying her office since Monday. They say Pelosi stands in the way of the Democratic Party being unified in supporting the Green New Deal.. . The action is one of several international hunger strike actions taking place by various chapters of Extinction Rebellion with mixed success. Two political parties in the United Kingdom reportedly met with strikers earlier this week.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . NO REUSE WITHOUT PERMISSION Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . Support News2Share on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/FordFischer. . Special Thanks to Patreon Contributors Robert Caputo, and Lee Enochs. . See more at http://News2share.com

"Bei Bei" Giant Panda Departs from DC to China

Nov 19, 2019

Bye bye, Bei Bei! Bei Bei, a four year old giant panda born at the National Zoo, began his journey to China this morning.. . The bear was born under an agreement with China to send him home when he reached maturity. N2S's Ford Fischer captured raw footage of his final day in America and departure.. . His flight to China is 16 hours and includes 66 pounds of bamboo, two pounds of apples and pears, two bags of biscuits and two pounds of sweet potatoes.. . Climate Activists Begin Hunger Strike in Nancy Pelosi's Office

Nov 18, 2019

Climate activists with Extinction Rebellion Washington DC occupied Nancy Pelosi's office all day today demanding an hour-long meeting with the congresswoman.. . "Nancy Pelosi, you must meet with us and hold yourself responsible," said Sophia Kianni, a 17-year old skipping school to participate. "As a nation we must unite behind science before it's too late.". . "She's standing in the way of a green new deal," said organizer Nick Brana. "How much better is it to have one party that denies the science than another that gives it lip service and denies the consequences of it by not doing anything.". . "It sucks that we have to do this," added activist Giovanni Tamacas in tears. "This is for our loved ones.". . Livestream: https://www.facebook.com/N2Sreports/videos/409020930049994/. . During their hunger-strike, the activists held a "grief session" to mourn what they see as the consequences of climate change: https://www.pscp.tv/w/1dRKZLbzjEMJB. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . “Latinos for Trump” and Proud Boys Rally Versus Antifa, NYC November 16, 2019

Nov 16, 2019

"Trump and the Democrats defend fascists!" said antifa today in New York as they marched to Trump Tower to oppose The Proud Boys and other pro-Trump activists rallying there.. . The MAGA activists led by “Latinos for Trump” were protesting because two Proud Boys members were recently sentenced to four years in prison on gang assault charges against antifa. The alleged antifa victims did not participate in the prosecution.. . Filmed by N2S Contributor Ed Fabry. . Full: Inaugural "Animals in War & Peace" Medal of Bravery Ceremony

Nov 15, 2019

Medals of Bravery were issued in the halls of congress to a New York Fire Department Dog who has worked hundreds of fires and a marine dog that has worked dozens of missions in Iraq, Afghanistan, and Somalia without a single marine death.. . “Animals in War & Peace Medal of Bravery” were also awarded posthumously to animals who passed while serving in the armed forces of the United States.. . The medals were presented by members of Congress including pigeons that served in World War One and World War Two, a horse that served in the Korean War, and dogs that served in World War Two, the Vietnam War, and Afghanistan.. . "Dreamers" traveled from across the country to attend, some even marching from New York City to Washington DC.. . Activists told stories of how they grew up undocumented in America, only protected by DACA.. . "Every dreamer here has done the impossible," said one speaker.. . Actor Bambadjan Bamba (Black Panther, Suicide Squad, Good Place) spoke out, telling the story of how he's succeeded since being an undocumented childhood arrival since age 10, protected by DACA.. .
