Protesters March for Freddie Gray

Apr 24, 2015

Police in Baltimore are accused of killing a 25-year-old following an arrest earlier this week. The man, Freddie Gray, died shortly after being taken into custody from a severed spine. Kevin Davis, the deputy police commissioner, said Friday that Gray should have received medical attention at the spot of his arrest. Video shows Gray screaming for help as officers carried him to the van. Today protesters assembled in Baltimore to voice their opinions and call for the arrest of the officers involved. While there were less than 100 protesters in this gathering, they were able to disrupt and shut down several Baltimore highways. Thousands are expected to show up on Saturday. Follow us on twitter @news_2_share for the latest from the protests schedule for Saturday.. . Twitter: https://twitter.com/news_2_share. Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/News2Share/426269657480929?fref=ts. . Filmed by Ford Fischer and Trey Yingst. Edited by Ford Fischer. . For more, go to News2share.com

Virginia Open Carry - A Short Documentary

Apr 24, 2015

In Virginia, guns play a role larger than sport, self-defense, and hunting. For many Virginians, they are part of a culture and tradition. In Virginia, people may either carry their weapons openly, or concealed. Ed Levine is an open carry advocate, who does both. . . Levine is a leader in the open carry community. He leads the groups Virgnia Open Carry and DC Carry. He is also an executive member of the Virginia Citizens Defense League. In this documentary, News2share’s Ford Fischer joins him at an open carry barbecue, where like-minded Virginians open carry handguns and celebrate their freedom to carry at the local barbecue.. . Other appearances include:. Gregg Nelson, owner of Urban Barbeque in Ashburn. Eugene Delgaudio, an elected official in Loudon Country, Virginia. Judy Rudek, an NRA-certified instructor at KYS Training, LLC. Jared Angel, a gun owner who chooses not to open carry. . Produced by Ford Fischer

White House Press Secretary Discusses US/Israeli Relationship

Apr 8, 2015

As the United States works towards a nuclear deal with Iran, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has been outspoken about a potential agreement. News2Share's Trey Yingst asks White House Press Secretary Josh Earnest about President Obama's plans to maintain a positive relationship with the Israelis. Netanyahu is concerned that if the US reaches an agreement, Nuclear capabilities could be used against Israel in the future.

Suspicious Package Prompts White House Lockdown

Apr 7, 2015

Today a suspicious package was spotted near the White House. The package prompted a lockdown, forcing members of the press into the briefing room. News2share's Trey Yingst and contributor Jon-Christopher Bua were there.. . Produced by Trey Yingst. Edited by Trey Yingst and Ford Fischer

Two Protesters Arrested at AUMF Hearing

Mar 11, 2015

Today, Secretary of State John Kerry, Secretary of Defense Ashton Carter and Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman Gen. Martin Dempsey testified before the SFRC on the President’s request for Authorization for Use of Military Force (AUMF) against ISIL and ongoing U.S. military and diplomatic efforts. Several Senators including presidential candidate Marco Rubio were in attendance.. Several protesters initially stood up and held signs before the meeting began. Later, Arn Menconi with CODEPINK and Helen Schietinger of Witness Against Torture were arrested as they disrupted the meeting. The group hold that the continuing AUMF would lead to perpetual war, and would have an adverse effect on civilian populations.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer

Dupont Circle Snowball Fight Yields Hundreds

Mar 5, 2015

Thousands of snow enthusiasts gathered at Dupont Circle Thursday evening for a snowball fight, celebrating Winter and their schools' snow days. The snowball fight started at 5:30 p.m. at the fountain located at the center of the iconic traffic circle in Northwest DC. . Snow fighters chose to either "attack" or "defend" the fountain, engaging in battle tactics and brutal snowfare. The snowday tradition started five years ago, and has since become a tradition in the District. The Washington DC Snowball Fight Association (DCSFA) sponsored the snowball fight that started it all, and has sponsored all that have followed since. . DCSFA was founded on December 19, 2009 to celebrate the coming of the "Snowpocalypse" with it's first official snowball fight. Since then, thousands of people have joined their Facebook group and flocked to the fountain every snowday. Thursday's snow battle ended around 7 p.m. . Participants topped off the night at James Hoban's Irish Restaurant and Bar, where the best dressed snow fighters were each given $100 gift cards to the restaurant.. . Footage submitted by Sam Ufret. Edited by Ford Fischer

Protesters Storm Congressional Office, Follow AIPAC President

Mar 3, 2015

As Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu prepared to address congress, Code Pink activists voiced their concerns with Israel's policies. The group marched through the streets of DC and eventually into the Longworth office building where they attempted to enter Speaker John Boehner's office to deliver a petition. The president of the American Israel Public Affairs Committee (AIPAC), Robert Cohen, attempted to enter Boehner's office as well, but the door was locked. He then proceeded to Representative Stivers office and was follow by the Code Pink activists. . Today’s protest was the final in a series of three anti-Netanyahu rallies. Yesterday five Code Pink activists were arrested for civil disobedience while protesting AIPAC.. There has been widespread controversy surrounding Netanyahu’s address to Congress, due to Israel's upcoming elections. Many advocates, such as Code Pink, additionally believe that Israel’s actions during the war should be considered human rights violations. Opposing views believe that Israel is in danger from what they see as threatening groups, such as Hamas and Iranians.. News2share covered the Gaza conflict in 2014 and spoke with people on both sides.. . Produced by Trey Yingst (@Treyyingst). . See more at http://News2share.com

Report: Code Pink Demonstrates Outside AIPAC

Mar 1, 2015

Five protestors were arrested at a Pro-Palestine rally on Sunday afternoon in front of the Walter E. Washington Convention Center in Northwest DC. The protestors were arrested while blocking the entrance to the center where the American Israel Public Affairs Committee (AIPAC) is holding its annual policy conference.. . About 150 people attended the rally organized by CODEPINK–a women-led NGO that organizes anti-war protests across the country. Coined #ShutDownAIPAC, the rally's purpose was to draw attention to AIPAC’s role as a pro-Israel lobby in US policies, and Israeli Prime Minister, Benjamin Netanyahu's trip to the US as a guest speaker for both AIPAC, and a joint session at Congress taking place tomorrow.. . "Its important to challenge AIPAC's influence in Washington DC, and to show our strength in numbers today," says Alli McCracken, CODEPINK'S National Organizer. CODEPINK and other pro-Palestine organizations are urging the US government to advocate for diplomacy with Iran and condemn Israel's siege of the Gaza Strip.. . Madea Benjamin, CODEPINK''s Founder, believes that Diplomacy with Iran is key to keeping peace in the region.. . "If you look at where we stand as a nation right now, and with all the violence that’s happening in the middle east, it’s a very scary time" Benjamin says. "If these negotiations with Iran don't come to fruition, that could mean a war with Iran. Unfortunately, AIPAC is adding fuel to the fire.". . Some have criticized the Pro-Palestine movement as anti-Semetic. McCracken says this is not the case. "Criticizing the government policies of another country isn't the same as criticizing an ethnicity or a religion" McCracken satates. "You cannot conflate anti-Semitism and anti-Zionism." More demonstrations will take place throughout the week, including another rally during Netanyahu’s appearance at AIPAC on Monday, and a march to House Speaker, John Boehner's house on Tuesday.. . Produced, filmed and edited by Ford Fischer. . Additional video submitted by contributor Kristine Untalan. . Photos and Article submitted by contributor Sam Ufret

Protesters Arrested Outside AIPAC 2015

Mar 1, 2015

Today Code Pink protesters attempted to block the entrance at AIPAC (American Israel Public Affairs Committee) after unsuccessfully trying to enter. They sat and held arms in an act of civil disobedience, which complicated entrance into the building for over an hour and stopped people from entering altogether for several minutes preceding the arrest. In total, five were arrested. At this time, it is unclear what they have been charged with and when they'll be released.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

No arrests were made immediately, but six were arrested later while blocking the entrance to the building.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Anti-Nuke Activists to Obama: “Keep Your Promise”

Jan 31, 2015

Today in Washington, anti-nuclear protesters called on President Obama to cut spending on the US nuclear arsenal. The federal government is currently planning to spend approximately 1 trillion dollars on nuclear weapons over the next 20 years.. . As part of their demonstration, a 48-foot tall inflatable nuclear warhead was erected. Global Zero, the group who planned the protest, will be traveling to a number of other US cities in the following weeks to speak out against the US nuclear program. According to their website: "Global Zero leaders understand that the only way to eliminate the nuclear threat – including proliferation and nuclear terrorism – is to stop the spread of nuclear weapons, secure all nuclear materials and eliminate all nuclear weapons." . . News2share's Trey Yingst spoke to Matt Brown, the co-founder of Global Zero, who said that if given the chance, he tell president Obama "Don't spend 1 trillion dollars we don't have on a nuclear arsenal we don't need.". . Produced by Trey Yingst. Edited by Trey Yingst and Ford Fischer. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Protester Confronted by Police at Congressional Hearing

Jan 27, 2015

A protester is confronted by police after he interrupts a congressional hearing on the TPP, with Paul Ryan in attendance. Earlier in the day, a small number of protesters were escorted out of a Senate Finance Committee hearing for a similar protest. U.S. Trade Representative, Michael Froman was there as concerns were raised about the trade agenda.. . TPP is a free trade deal between the U.S., Canada, and 10 countries in the Asia-Pacific region that has been discussed for almost 10 years. If passed, the deal would govern 40% of US imports and exports.. . See more at http://News2share.com

Coffee Party and Others Gather to Protest Citizens United

Jan 21, 2015

Today protesters gathered in front of the Chamber of Commerce to protest against the role that corporate wealth plays in politics. Specifically, the protest marks the anniversary of Citizens United v. Federal Election Commission, which is still being called into question by activists today.. . The protest was assembled by an organization called Public Citizen, and gained the attention of many others, such as the Coffee Party. Coffee Party president Debilyn Molineaux spoke exclusively to News2share about her organization, and their fight against big money in politics. (See http://www.coffeepartyusa.com/). . Additionally, Democratic congressman Keith Ellison from Minnesota spoke to a crowd in front of the Chamber of Commerce. He discussed a piece of legislation called the “Protect Democracy from Corporate Criminals Act” which would prevent corporations convicted of crimes from making political campaign contributions. He also spoke exclusively to News2share about this new bill: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=16B4P5YIV48. . Overall, the event yielded about 200 activists despite a Wednesday mid-day schedule and heavy snowfall.. . Produced by Ford Fischer. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Jan 21, 2015

Today Congressman Keith Ellison (D-MN) from Minnesota spoke to a crowd in front of the Chamber of Commerce. He discussed a piece of legislation called the “Protect Democracy from Corporate Criminals Act” which would prevent corporations convicted of crimes from making political campaign contributions. He spoke exclusively to News2share about this new bill.. . Rep. Ellison is also Co-Chair of the Progressive Caucus.. . Produced by Ford Fischer. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

[Raw Footage] Peshmerga Fighters in Gunfight with ISIS

Jan 20, 2015

In this exclusive video taken on a cell phone and submitted by one Kurdish fighter earlier today, Peshmerga fighters can be seen on a brick building exchanging fire with ISIS. In order to maintain cover, the fighters make small holes in the wall to shoot. while keeping their heads ducked out of sight. As the Peshmerga fighters shoot with machine guns and and other light arms, ISIS can be heard shooting back from the distance.. . Note for Youtube: This video is entirely non-graphic and is being used for educational/historical purposes. It is entirely consistent with the Youtube community standards. Additionally, we have obtained consent for its commercial use, which we can present to Youtube upon request.. . See more at http://News2share.com

"We Need to Fix this Shit Now" Says Director for Trans Women of Color Collective

Jan 10, 2015

Lourdes Ashley Hunter, national director for creating spaces for Trans Women of Color, spoke today to a crowd about trans power and the need to value trans lives, particularly in the wake of Leelah Alcorn's death last month.. Filmed by Ford Fischer and Trey Yingst, Edited by Fischer

Transgender Community Speaks Out About Suicide

Jan 10, 2015

Leelah Alcorn, a transgender teen committed suicide, hoping that her death would mean something. . A rally for the transgender teen, who committed suicide on Dec 28th, was held in Washington D.C. on Saturday, Jan 10th.. The protest was orchestrated by a group of trans individuals and advocates who created the rally to raise awareness for health and policy concerns that transgender people face. . Protesters gathered at the “Justice for Leelah Alcorn Rally and March” to hear speakers and show support for the late Alcorn who took her own life, because she felt she received little support from her community. . The organizer of the rally, Jes Grobman, is organizer for DC Trans Power which focuses on empowering and supporting change within trans communities. . The protest marched from Mt. Vernon Square to the Department of Justice to read a list of demands. . Lourdes Ashley Hunter, the National Director for Trans Women of Color Collective, spoke of acceptance, justice and change.. “Oppression manifests in every aspect of our lives, but the way structural oppression is set up will have you to believe that we need to be fixed. And I’m here to tell you, we don’t need to be fixed there is nothing wrong with us. What is wrong is society’s depraved existence, willful ignorance, complicity, and inactive engagement which refuse trans people humanity and right to life.“. Leelah Alcorn was a transgender girl who walked in front of a truck at 2:30 A.M. on Dec 28th, 2014. She left a suicide note, blaming her parents for her upbringing and depression, and pleading to “fix society.” . “When I was 14, I learned what transgender meant and cried of happiness. After 10 years of confusion I finally understood who I was.” she said in the note, which was scheduled to post on her Tumblr blog after her death.. Alcorn said that she felt like she “was a girl trapped in a boys body,” and apparently had felt that way since she was four years old. . Leelah’s story resonated over social media, as well as in many LGBTQ communities. The hashtag #RestInPower and #LeehlahAlcorn are being used to posthumously support Alcorn.. Much of the protest focused on creating validity and recognition for the rights that trans people are currently fighting for.. . Produced by Ford Fischer and Trey Yingst. . Article by Wallis Neff

Protestors Debate Over Police at Boston First Night 2015

Dec 31, 2014

As thousands came to Boston for the First Night 2015 New Years Celebration, several protesters stood outside the Boston library. Topics ranged from politics to war, but race police brutality took the forefront. While many were part of the Black Lives Matter movement, some, such as Dennis Jackson, tried to advocate on behalf of the police and claimed that not following an officer's orders would be "suicide by cop.". Others felt that his position may have been well-intended but misplaced. One protester in particular felt that this sort of rhetoric blames the victim.. In total, only a few hundred participated in the protest, and soon dispersed into the Boston New Year's activities.. . Produced by Ford Fischer. Audio by Christian Conti

Body of Former Marine Wanted for Mass Murder, Found

Dec 17, 2014

Following a two-day man hunt, the body of former marine, Bradley Stone, was found in a wooded area of Pennsburg, Pennsylvania.. . Stone was wanted in the murders of his ex-wife and her family.. . Justin Smith, who lives feet from where Stone’s body was found, is concerned that his kids will be afraid to play outside after the discovery of the body.. . “Kids that play in the woods and now I’m sure are going to be terrified to go back in there again,” Smith said. . . The coroner has not yet performed an autopsy, but cited self-inflicted “cutting wounds,” as a cause of death.. . One victim, a 17-year-old nephew of Stone’s ex-wife, is in critical, but stable condition after he was attacked by Stone.. . The investigation into a motive for the killings is ongoing.. . Filmed by Trey Yingst. Edited by Ford Fischer. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

EXCLUSIVE: PA Killer's Body Loaded into Coroner's Van

Dec 16, 2014

Following a two-day long manhunt in and around Pennsburg, Pennsylvania, suspected killer Bradley William Stone's body was found near his home.. . News2share's Trey Yingst captured the moment that police take Stone's body and deliver it to the Montgomery County coroner's van. After killing six members of his family including his ex-wife, her mother, grandmother, sister and two other family members, it is being reported that the Iraq war veteran died of "self-inflicted cutting wounds.". . Protesters Assemble at Justice Department for Michael Brown

Dec 1, 2014

On Wednesday, several people gathered to protest the grand jury decision in Ferguson and remember Michael Brown. Marsha Coleman Adebayo, who organized the event, feels that it is now the federal government's responsibility to step in and make an arrest after the decision not to indict Officer Darren Wilson.. . "We are demanding that Attorney General Holder bring charges immediately against Darren Wilson for the death of Michael Brown," Adebayo said. "We also understand that unless we go to the street, nothing is going to happen.". . Also in attendance was Matthew F. Fogg, who criticized the handling of evidence in the case against Darren Wilson. As a former US Federal Marshal, he says that the thin blue line has created an atmosphere where officers believe they won't be held accountable for their actions.. . "It does need to change," he said.. . Several advocates from Code Pink, including Medea Benjamin, were also present. Benjamin proclaimed to the crowd "We will not stand for any more of our children being gunned down by the police. No justice, no peace.". . Filmed by Taylor Kinzler. Edited by Ford Fischer. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Ferguson: Indict or Fight

Nov 28, 2014

Following days of protests and violence in Ferguson, Missouri, the community is looking to rebuild. Fires burned as gun battles broke out between police and rioters on Monday night. News2share was on the front lines bringing you the latest news after the grand jury decision was announced. Check out a few of the highlights above.. . Filmed by Trey Yingst,. Edited by Ford Fischer. . Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/user/DCNews2Share. Twitter: https://twitter.com/news_2_share. Website: http://News2share.com/. Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/News2Share/426269657480929

DC Protesters Fill Walmart, Chinatown for Michael Brown

Nov 26, 2014

As protests rage on throughout the country over the decision not to indict Darren Wilson in the shooting death of Michael Brown, Washington DC attracted one of the largest crowds. They marched all day, growing as they moved. Contributors Chelsea Smart and Merdie Nzanga sent these clips of protesters as they enter a Walmart in protest, and cheer in the DC Chinatown.. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Report: National Guard Faces Ferguson Protesters

Nov 26, 2014

Following a destructive night after the announcement of the decision not to indict Darren Wilson in the shooting death of Michael Brown, 2200 National Guard troops were deployed to Missouri. While smaller and more suppressed, the protests still brought a number of arrests as well as the use of tear gas and rubber bullets. Trey Yingst has the story.. . Edited by Ford Fischer. Contributing Researchers:. Alejandro Alvarez,. Wallis Neff. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Directly following the announcement of the decision not to indict Darren Wilson in the killing of Michael Brown, Ferguson protesters took to the streets. Anonymous Sits Down with KKK Leader Frank Ancona

Nov 24, 2014

Alex Poucher, a heavily involved member of Anonymous, sat down with Frank Ancona, Imperial Wizard of the Traditional American Knights of the Ku Klux Klan this Sunday. The two groups- Anonymous and the KKK- have had a feud over the last month regarding how to respond to action in Ferguson. Following the release of a controversial flyer by the KKK, Anonymous members took over the KKK's national Twitter account. While Mr Poucher and Mr Ancona did not discuss the hacking situation, they sat down and spoke to better understand each-other and mitigate some of the tension between both groups. . . The conversation lasted about 20 minutes, but News2share is currently releasing these highlights as a representation of their exchange.. . Filmed by Trey Yingst. Edited by Ford Fischer. Special Thanks to Alejandro Alvarez and Laura Thompson for Outreach. . For more, go to http://News2share.com. . Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/News2Share/426269657480929. . Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/news_2_share

Police Tell Ferguson Store Owner to Shoot Looters

Nov 23, 2014

Following several robberies before and after the shooting of Michael Brown, St Louis Cordless owner Sonny Dayan tells News2share's Trey Yingst that police advised him to should shoot any future robbers. While Mr. Dayan was clearly capable of shooting one robber, he explains that despite the police's opinion, he feels that violence would only make the situation worse.. . Produced by Trey Yingst. Edited by Ford Fischer. . Special Thanks to. Alejandro Alvarez. Wallis Neff. Chelsea Smart

Arrests Made at Ferguson Police Station

Nov 20, 2014

Three were arrested at the Ferguson Police Department on Thursday night when police charged into a crowd of demonstrators on South Florissant Road. Trey Yingst captured footage of the scuffle, and of a police officer confronting a cameraman with Argus Streaming News.

Some Ferguson Gang Members Prepare for Violent Clash with KKK

Nov 20, 2014

WARNING: Graphic language. Following a threat issued by the Ku Klux Klan towards protesters and members of the Ferguson community, gang members in Ferguson spoke exclusively with News2Share about what they say are preparations for a violent clash with the KKK. . . Please contact Ford Fischer at fordfischer@news2share.com or call (573) 575-NEWS to license video. Photos and additional footage may be available upon request.. . See more at News2Share.com

Anonymous Threatens KKK and Ferguson Police

Nov 20, 2014

This video was received by News2share's Ford Fischer early this morning to release to the public. News2share should not be perceived as affiliated with Anonymous in any way.. . After an online dispute, members of Anonymous hacked the official KKK Twitter page. As of Thursday morning, it is still under Anonymous control (twitter.com/kukluxklanusa). Following that hacking, a Pastebin (http://pastebin.com/3PuA4eS5) was posted publicly online, purporting to be from Frank Ancona, Grand Wizard of the Traditionalist American Knights of the Klu Klux Klan. In the statement, he threatens Anonymous directly by claiming that "we will hunt you down and tear those masks from your face. You'll be strung up next to the chimps. On display for the whole world to see. The Klan is to be feared, not threatened.". . While the outcome of this feud is yet to be determined, Anonymous has claimed through this new video that "[The KKK's] violent ideology will not prevail in this fight.". . CNN has reported that a decision regarding the indictment of Officer Darren Wilson could occur Friday, with an announcement Sunday. At that point, it is quite possible that the feelings expressed via videos like these and social media will be expressed on the streets of Ferguson from all sides.. . For more, go to http://News2share.com. . Media: Contact fordfischer@news2share.com for questions or comments from News2share.

ISIL "Would Have No Compunction Using Nuclear Weapons"

Nov 19, 2014

News2share contributor and political commentator Jon-Christopher Bua reflects on the recent death of Peter Kassig, and discusses the White House's response to the most recent ISIL video and their position on Syria. While it is clear that the president does not consider Bashar al-Assad's presidency legitimate, it remains yet to be seen how the international community will deal with ISIL's foothold in Syria as well as Syria's current leaders. Jon-Christopher also discusses ISIL's advances and the enormous danger the world would face in the event that ISIL ever accessed a nuclear weapon.. . Produced by Ford Fischer

Prague Celebrates Velvet Revolution

Nov 19, 2014

This Monday, November 17th, marked 25 years since the Velvet Revolution in Prague, Czech Republic. To honor the occasion, groups took to Wenceslas Square dressed in masks and costumes before parading down Narodni. While the parade commemorated the end of communism in the Czech Republic, this year’s anniversary also bore tones of discontent with the current government, most notably its leader, president Milos Zeman.. The demonstrations varied from a pro-Ukraine group featuring a massive bear puppet with the face of Vladimir Putin to a group of solemn masked figures handing out post cards with anecdotes of political prisoners before the Revolution. The largest group was comprised of protesters passing out red cards and waving them in the air. These symbolized a “red card” for the President, a call for him to step down from power. This sentiment has grown recently in light of the President’s pro-Russian position on the Ukraine conflict and praise of Chinese policies. . The day concluded with a chain of candles lit along Narodni in memory of the Revolution’s first student protestors, some of whom were brutally beaten when the side streets of Narodni were blocked off, leaving no escape. Live music performances inside parked trams, a chalk board reminiscent of the Lennon wall and tents filled with anti-communist literature lined Narodni as the candles shone on through the misty Prague night.. . Filmed, Edited and Contributed by Alexandra Korba

White House: President Pressed for Time on Immigration Reform

Nov 7, 2014

News2share's Trey Yingst asks Press Secretary Josh Earnest about whether President Obama will have time to carry out an executive order on immigration reform. With only two years left in office, the president would have to act decidedly fast not only to sign an executive order, but for its implementation to follow through.

Protesters Mock Police at Monsanto DC Office in Million Mask March

Nov 6, 2014

Protesting the presence of GMOs in their food, the Million Mask March made a late stop in the Monsanto DC office, where an employee tried to kick them out. When an officer came, protesters mocked his attempts to repel them. Filmed by Trey Yingst

Man Arrested for Carrying Knives at Million Mask March

Nov 5, 2014

John Foltz, a participant in today's "Million Mask March" was stopped early on by police for openly carrying a large knife. When searched, they found a second knife. It is unclear exactly what he was charged with but he was arrested, attracting the attention of several protesters. When he inspired them to chant, he was immediately pulled away. Filmed by Trey Yingst and Ford Fischer

Million Mask March Protesters Block Tunnel Traffic

Nov 5, 2014

In an odd deviation from their original march plan, many of the protesters participating in the "Million Mask March" made a detour and walked through a tunnel filled with unexpected traffic. Filmed by Trey Yingst and Ford Fischer

Violent Clash at Capitol Building in Million Mask March

Nov 5, 2014

After traveling down Pennsylvania Avenue, participants in the Million Mask March today descended on the capitol building. Tensions were high from the start as the instruction to stay on sidewalks was not followed. Within minutes, an officer can be heard on camera commanding the officers to get out their pepper spray. Moments later, the barricade is pulled down and one protester is arrested for trespassing when he goes onto capitol grounds. Filmed by Trey Yingst, Alejandro Alvarez, and Ford Fischer

Officers Arrest Three Environmental Protesters Preceeding Million Mask March

Nov 5, 2014

Before the beginning of the 2014 Million Mask March, several protesters affiliated with the march as well as other environmental causes blockaded the entrance to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) so that employees could not get in. Protesters were given three warnings to disperse before arrests occurred, and one officer quite notably remarked that "anyone who backs up is going to jail for assault," implying that if the back of a protester were to touch an officer, it would constitute and assault charge.

Protesters Clash with FBI in Million Mask March 2014

Nov 5, 2014

During today's "Million Mask March," protesters took a detour at the FBI building, where they attempted to go through the revolving doors, which were held back only manually by officers on the other side. The agents came outside to block the doors, one of which threatened the crowd with pepper spray. Eventually the crowd dispersed after the officers rejected free masks. Filmed by Ford Fischer

Police Tase, Chase, Arrest Protester at Million Mask March 2014

Nov 5, 2014

Police clashed with rioters today participating in the "Million Mask March" in Washington DC. In one incident at the Reagen Building, a protester had a scuffle with a police officer, which ended up with him being tased onto the ground. A friend of his then tried to get away, and was also tased, but he managed to escape the taser and sprint across the street before officers on foot and from a vehicle were able to surround him. When other protesters surrounded the arresting officer, he threatened them with pepper spray while bringing the suspect into custody. Note: Video Filmed and edited by Ford Fischer, with a short clip of the initial scuffle submitted by Ben Cutler.

Biscuits and Bullets: Change Demanded for Police Killing Dogs

Oct 26, 2014

On March 18th, 2013, the Hartman family dog Lucy left their house and got lost. Thinking she was home, the dog began scratching at a neighbor’s door to get inside. When the neighbor called the police, officers arrived, killed her, and left her body on a hill near the road without notifying the family.. . Ford Fischer and Trey Yingst of News2share visited Glen Rock Pennsylvania, where they visited the gravesite as well as where Lucy was shot. Bryan Hartman, who was working at a firearms factory at the time of the shooting, expressed his frustrations not only with the details of the shooting, but the traumatic aftermath. His wife, Shelly Hartman, was also deeply impacted, and miscarried her pregnancy three weeks after the shooting.. . After visiting the gravesite, Fischer and Yingst traveled with the Hartmans to the Pennsylvania State House in Harrisburg, the site of one of 50 nationwide “Freeze: Don’t shoot” rallies to protest police violence against dogs. Bryan told the crowd his story of what police did to Lucy and the aftermath. Other protestors joined him in telling stories, mourning, and demanding change.. . While tragic, Lucy’s shooting is not unique. One dog, Ivy, was shot in the jaw by police only a month ago and is currently active but recovering. According to her owner, Mark Soltis, "the dog's never been aggressive to nobody... There was really no reason for the officer to shoot his weapon in the middle of the afternoon around children." . . Despite being called "aggressive" by the officer who shot her, Ivy played gently with children as the interview went on. . . Both Ivy and the late Lucy were part Pitbull. Khaldun Rasheed, a former worker at the Humane Society, noted that stereotypes and poor police training may be responsible for how frequently they are killed by police. "I think that the myth that all of them are evil is wrong," he said. "I would be against arbitrary violent acts, randomly shooting dogs.". . Donna Earley, the event’s organizer, encouraged the crowd to call their state representatives to pass laws mandating training for police officers to minimize fatalities of family pets in the future.. . "It's not always wise to go for the gun first," she said. "There's other means of deterrence other than putting a bullet in our dogs.". . See more at http://News2share.com

Syrians Express Peace and Hope at Art Exhibit

Oct 25, 2014

This past Thursday, hundreds of people came to the National Mall for the "Peace & Hope: A Gift From the Children of Syria to the World" art installation. The art exhibit is a non-political cultural diplomacy exhibit aimed at educating the American public about the plight of Syrian children & youth.. . Produced and Edited by Camila DeChalus. Filmed by Chelsea Smart. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Friend of Hannah Graham Calls Her "Talented, Adventurous"

Leila Nasser first met the late Hannah Graham at a French immersion summer program. Hannah Graham, a UVA student, is described by Nasser in the interview above. Nasser reacts to her death and reflects on her life, describing the type of person she remembers Hannah to be. Remains found in the investigation of her disappearance were confirmed today to be hers.. . Produced by Trey Yingst. Filmed and Edited by Ford Fischer. . See more at http://News2share.com

Jordanian Students Protest Police "Crackdown" in Jerusalem

Two Shot at Anacostia House Party

Oct 18, 2014

A house party in Anacostia turned violent last night when one person in attendance pulled out a handgun and fired between 8 and 10 shots. In total there were two people injured, between the two of them with injuries to the head, leg, and stomach. It is unclear what started the altercation but we're told that the shooter is still at large. Although there were four black males seen fleeing on foot, it is unclear if they are suspects at this time, according to Police Lieutenant Edward Aragona of the Seventh District. News2share spoke with Delante Phillips, a direct eyewitness to the shooting.. Filmed and Edited by Ford Fischer. Reported by Taylor Kinzler. Interview by Trey Yingst. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Ebola Response Yields "Czar" and Politics

Oct 18, 2014

Following the October 17th Press Briefing, News2share contributor and political commentator Jon-Christopher Bua discusses the response to the naming of Ron Klain as the "Ebola response coordinator." There was much discussion in the briefing over the accuracy of calling him a "czar" as well as whether or not he is qualified to handle a health issue. Jon-Christopher Bua discusses these issues as well as the political implications on the upcoming midterm elections.. . Produced by Ford Fischer

Protestor Speaks Out Against Flights from West Africa

Oct 17, 2014

Paige Victoria, 23, of Cleveland, Ohio, holds up a sign in front of the White House on October 17, 2014 in Washington, D.C. Victoria is protesting the entry of Ebola into the country through air travel while passing out slips of paper with heart stickers and a plea to Tom Frieden, Director of the CDC, to "Clarify how Ebola spreads. Everyone is confused." She takes a moment away from her protesting to speak to News2share contributor and political commentator Jon-Christopher Bua about her mission as well as reasoning for wanting to prevent flights to the US from Western African.. . Produced by Ford Fischer. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

"Stop the Flights" Demands Protestor in Hazmat Suit Outside White House

Oct 17, 2014

Jeff Hulbert of Annapolis, Md. is a protestor who has spent his time recently in front of the White House banishing a hazmat suit and demanding that the United States stop all flights from western African. He has received a fair amount of media attention, even appearing as the headline photo on the front page of today's New York Times. News2share contributor and political commentator got a chance to speak with Hulbert, who explained his reasoning and the action he'd like to see from the administration, as well has his concerns about the new "czar" aka Ebola Response coordinator Ron Klain.. . WH on Importance of Ebola Screening in "Gateway Cities"

As concerns over Ebola grow, White House Commentator Jon-Christopher Bua asks White House Press Secretary Josh Earnest if President Obama was considering a real coordinated effort with European Allies to ensure that travelers with Ebola do not board airplanes from infected areas of West Africa and reach the US indirectly through European "Gateway Cities." Earnest remarks on the international effort to stop Ebola before possibly infected people fly.. . News2share Footage of ANC Assault on Fox 5

Fox 5 reports on the video shot by News2share's Trey Yingst of ANC commissioner, Mary Cuthbert, assaulting a Ward 8 resident. MPD is classifying the incident as a misdemeanor simple assault. News2share does not own this video (excluding the part that was filmed by Yingst) The original link to the video can be found below.. . http://www.myfoxdc.com/clip/10665124/youtube-video-shows-altercation-involving-ward-8c-anc-member-mary-cuthbert. . ANC Commissioner Assaults Resident, Will Be Served Arrest Warrant

Oct 6, 2014

WASHINGTON DC- Ward 8C ANC commissioner and Chairperson, Mary Cuthbert, assaulted a resident of Ward 8 on Monday night during a public meeting. While discussing the “Wheeler Renaissance Development” project, Karlene Armstead, a commissioner in Ward 8E, left the meeting in an attempt to disrupt quorum, so that a vote could not take place. As she left, one of her supporters, Joseph Johnson, got into a verbal altercation with Cuthbert about whether or not quorum was affected. As the verbal altercation continued, Commissioner Cuthbert said “I’m going to knock your little a** back where you belong you little motherf*****...Who you gon’ f*** with?” and then pushed Johnson. . . DC Metro Police separated Cuthbert and Johnson. Following the scuffle, a DC Metro Police officer confirmed that Cuthbert will be receiving an arrest warrant for the assault that took place.. . In an interview after the altercation, Cuthbert said she was “ready to kill his little a**.”

"I Let Fear Control Me" Says Journalist/Director Jose Antonio Vargas

Oct 6, 2014

Journalist, filmmaker and immigration activist Jose Antonio Vargas speaks to The Eagle’s Cuneyt Dil about his experiences living in fear as an “undocumented” immigrant as well as his awe at the American world. Additionally, he discusses his experiences throughout the media world and the way politicians from both sides handle, or don’t handle, the issue of immigration reform. Vargas has been in the news for his 2011 article coming out as an undocumented immigrant, and most recently his film "Documented: A film by an undocumented American" which was released on CNN.. . Produced by Alejandro Alvarez for The Eagle. Featuring Jose Antonio Vargas. Interview by Cuneyt Dil

Police and protestors continue to clash after the deadline passed that required all protesters to empty the streets by Monday morning. As the protests enter the second week, many are concerned that the police may use heavier force to disperse the crowds.. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Of the people they spoke to, some were unaware of the patient there and those that did know about it (featured in this video) seemed largely confident in their own safety.. Protestors Sing in Solidarity with Hong Kong Outside White House

Oct 1, 2014

Gathering outside the White House Wednesday evening, several protestors chanted songs such as "Do You Hear the People Sing?" from Les Miserables in support of Democracy in Hong Kong. Participants carried umbrellas in solidarity with the citizens of Hong Kong who had had to hold them in order to shield themselves from pepper spray and tear gas. . Produced by Ford Fischer. . [Raw Footage] Peaceful Protestors Swarm Hong Kong

Oct 1, 2014

Submitted by James Arbogast, a student currently studying in Hong Kong, these videos show the recent scene there as protestors gathered in support of a new democratic system. The video shows protestors driving supplies into place and protestors peacefully cheering. In fact, James noted that during this particular setting, there were no police present. This comes as a huge contrast to other video reaching the media of Hong Kong police using forceful action such as tear gas and rubber bullets to deter the crowds.. . For more information, go to News2share.com. If you'd like to see your footage featured on News2share, please contact us or share it with submissions@news2share.com.

Anonymous Declares War Against Hong Kong Police

Oct 1, 2014

The "hacktivist" group Anonymous sent this video to News2share early Wednesday morning, apparently declaring a cyber-war against Hong Kong for the treatment of protestors there. The group has already defaced several Hong Kong-based websites, and promised that dozens more would be affected over the next few days. To see a list of the sites, screenshots of the defaced sites, a transcript of this video and updates go to http://news2share.com/start/2014/10/01/anonymous-declares-war-against-hong-kong/. . *If you are a member of the media and would like quotes or information from the producer who has been in contact with Anonymous, email fordfischer@news2share.com*. . ***If you have footage of the protests happening in Hong Kong send us a message and we will post it***. . This added tension comes amidst massive protests in Hong Kong, where citizens has amassed in the thousands to fight for democracy. While Anonymous's actions are pro-democracy, they may renew fears of cyberwar between the United States and China. This is the second video they've sent to News2share.com, following a video released nearly two weeks ago explaining their plan to wage cyber-war against ISIS.. . News2share received this video as a contribution, and in no way should be construed as endorsing or affiliating with Anonymous. . . See more at http://News2share.com

"The United States is Not Immune" To Ebola: Sierra Leone Ambassador

Sep 30, 2014

In this interview originally taken on August 29th, Sierra Leone ambassador Bockari Kortu Stevens warns that despite its health system, the United States is not immune to Ebola. This comment may be correct, as early reports claim that a confirmed case of Ebola has been reported in the United States today.. Ohio Citizen Sounds Off on Radioactive Frack Waste Processing

Sep 29, 2014

Submitted by an Ohio resident who wished to only be credited as "Joseph," this interview with Lynn Anderson shows her feelings on a controversial radioactive frack waste processing center. According to Joseph, it "is operating in Youngstown, Ohio, making the city the radioactive waste dump for the industry and exposing residents to health risks." Members of the Youngstown community feel that the center compromises their health and safety, and have created http://www.protectyoungstown.org/ to fight back.. . For more information go to http://News2share.com

Police Decend on Ferguson for Manhunt

Sep 27, 2014

Submitted by an activist going by the name "Haiku Unsung Hero" this video taken on a cell phone shows the police from several neighboring communities. A Ferguson, Missouri, police officer was shot a few hours ago, according to St. Louis County Police spokesman Brian Schellman. With the suspect "still at large" these police apparently are building the scope of the manhunt in searching for the suspect. This comes mere weeks after the conflict between police and protestors over the killing of unarmed teenager Michael Brown.. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Aftermath of Alleged Drunk Driving Accident at Ward Circle

Sep 27, 2014

This footage shows the aftermath of a crash that occurred around 1:35 a.m. in Ward Circle near American University. When asked about what happened, the Park Police told News2share, "let's just say, don't drink and drive." The university newspaper, the Eagle, is reporting that "A 22-year-old female was taken away in an ambulance. She is “awake and alert” as of 2:30 a.m., according to a emergency medical technician report from a police scanner.". . Filmed and edited by Trey Yingst. . See more at http://News2share.com

US and Russia Share a Common Interest in Defeating ISIL Says White House

Sep 26, 2014

When asked by News2share contributor and political commentator Jon-Christopher Bua about the role of Russia in the fight against ISIS, Press secretary Josh Earnest remarks that this is a mutual interest between them and the United States. Specifically, he remarks that there is significant evidence of Russians who have left Russia and could come back to commit acts of terror there. He uses the opportunity as well to observe that The United States and Russia still disagree over some issues such as Ukraine. However, he remarks that their mutual interest in stopping ISIS and their joint efforts at the international space station show the ability of the countries to work together when needed.. . Jon-Christopher Bua told News2share afterwards: "It has been reported that the Russians made an overture to the Iraqis that they would be supportive in defeating ISIL. Perhaps a good opportunity for President Obama to reach out to President Putin to join the Coalition in this effort. As the coalition grows internationally this might be a way to bridge the growing divide between the US, Europe and Russia- A win win for all. It is clear that both the US and Russia share this common interest. Josh Earnest did not rule out that possibility, and in fact noted that the US and Russia continue to have a good working relationship in regards to international security.". For more, go to http://News2share.com. . Note that this video was taken from the White House public access live feed. One of News2share's contributors appears in the video but News2share does not claim ownership of the video itself.

Kurdish Artist Reflects ISIS War Through Art

Sep 24, 2014

Kurdish artist and MFA candidate Ayad Almissouri discusses the terror group ISIS and his family’s position with in the conflict in this latest interview by News2share. Almissouri points out that many Yazidi women have been slaughtered raped and kidnapped. With these negative thoughts on his mind about the region he came from, Almissouri turns to art to release his stress and voice his opinions on the conflict.. . Although Almissouri’s family is currently safe, he does fear for their well-being. Almissouri believes that the US ‘aerial support’ is great but believes it will be difficult to stop ISIS. As the region continues to be in turmoil, Almissouri wants to use his art to highlight the feelings of the Kurdish people and their struggles with identity. . . Produced by Ford Fischer and Trey Yingst. Edited by Fischer. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

US Equally Ready To Fight Ebola, ISIS: Former Child Soldier

Sep 23, 2014

The Healey International Relief Foundation has been aiding relief efforts in Sierra Leone since 2005. Following the Ebola outbreak, their efforts have been used more than ever to combat this epidemic. On Tuesday, September 16th, 2 prominent members of the Sierra Leone community were invited by Senator Tom Harkins to testify on a joint senate hearing about the Ebola Crisis in West Africa. Peter Konteh, Executive director of Caritas in Freetown, and Ismael Charles, former child solider of the Blood Diamonds war and HIRF ground project manager, spoke to the Senate about worsening economic, security, and health concerns and conditions in their homeland, Sierra Leone.. . News2share's Taylor Kinzler had the opportunity to interview these gentlemen following their time on Capitol Hill this past week, and learn more about their efforts to increase awareness and relief efforts for the citizens of Sierra Leone.. . Produced by Taylor Kinzler, Ford Fischer and Trey Yingst . Filmed by Yingst and Fischer . Edited by Fischer. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

People's March Becomes Largest Climate March in History

Sep 21, 2014

Filmed and edited by Lauren Clemence, this video highlights some moments from Sunday's enormous march on New York City. Hundreds of thousands of people arrived to peacefully protest and advocate environmentalism. Some celebrities including Joseph Gordon-Levitt (seen in the video) attended as well, garnering a great deal of support and coverage for the event.

Joseph Gordon-Levitt Says Climate Change is "Greatest Threat"

Sep 21, 2014

In an exclusive interview with News2share's Lauren Clemence, Joseph Gordon-Levitt (Inception, The Dark Knight Rises, Looper) speaks about why he participated in the People's Climate March. He notes that he'd like his children and grandchildren to have "long and illustrious lives" but that climate change is the greatest threat to that occurring. Mr Gordon-Levitt was one of many notable people attending the march, including Leonardo DiCaprio, Mark Ruffalo and Al Gore.. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Anonymous Declares Cyber-War Against ISIS

Sep 20, 2014

The "hacktivist" group Anonymous sent this video to News2share late last night, apparently declaring a cyber-war against ISIS, also known as the "Islamic State." ISIS has been known for its sophisticated digital media campaign, and is estimates to have tens of thousands of social media accounts online. Some members of Anonymous, taking interest in News2share's reporting on the ISIS issue, reached out anonymously and explained that they intend to wage a cyber-war against ISIS by hacking into and sabotaging their social media accounts and other electronic resources. They then sent this video to us to serve as their press release. At the end, they promote #OPICE2014, apparently a hashtag trend they'd like to begin. They have also been using #OpIceISIS.. . The anonymous contributor originally titled the video "Flaming ISIS." The video itself sports several images seemingly ripped from online, as well as several scenes from ISIS's recent "Flames of War" trailer, which asserted that "flames of war [are] coming soon.". . News2share received this video as a contribution, and in no way should be construed as endorsing or affiliating with Anonymous. . . See more at http://News2share.com

Who will pay the cost of the campaign to defeat ISIL?

Sep 19, 2014

White House Commentator and News2share Contributor Jon-Christopher Bua asks Press Secretary Josh Earnest if the US will go it alone when it comes to the financial burden of the campaign to defeat ISIL or will the President seek contributions from other world leaders during his upcoming visit to the UN General Assembly.. . Note: This video is taken from the public White House feed, and it is not News2share's exclusive video. However, the commentator in it is a News2share contributor.. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Protestors Chained Together, Sawed Apart by DC Police

Sep 19, 2014

Today protestors gathered to speak out against mass deportation of undocumented immigrants. Gathering on Massachusetts Avenue, they chained together their legs and handcuffed their wrists together inside of hard piping, making it nearly impossible for them to be removed. When police arrived and established a parimeter, they began sawing into the piping and cutting all of the chains to make their arrest. Although unconfirmed, it was told to News2share's Trey Yingst that about half of the protestors were undocumented themselves.. Filmed by Trey Yinst, . Edited by Ford Fischer. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Women Chain Selves Together, Speak Out Against Deportation

Sep 19, 2014

As protestors assemble in Washington DC on Massachusetts Avenue to speak out against mass deportations, they begin to block traffic. When police arrive to push them aside, they find the protestors have chained themselves together with their arms inside of hard tubing, which forced police to use saws to get them out of the way. Over about two hours, protestors were forced out of the road and News2share's Trey Yingst managed to capture the scene on his phone. Following the protest, he spoke to two organizers of this event, who explained that next door an event including Hillary Clinton and Barrack Obama was taking place, who are both seen as enemies of undocumented immigrants.. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Full, Heated 2014 DC Mayoral Debate

Sep 19, 2014

Taking place at American University this Thursday, Democratic Nominee Muriel Bowser and two independent candidates, David Catania and Carol Schwartz. NBC reporter Tom Sherman moderated, while online columnist Clinton Yates and WAMU’s Patrick Madden and Kavitha Cardozo served as the media panel.. Major points of discussion included education and development. The debate got fired up primarily between nominee Bowser and candidate Catania, who at times found themselves yelling over each-other as they questioned eachother's records and intentions.. . Produced by Ford Fischer. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Red Bull Battle Grounds hosted an eSports panel today in Washington, DC. The panel discussed the job opportunities and industry secrets for gamers who are interested in an occupation related to eSports. Following the panel, News2share spoke to Rod Breslau, a prominent electronic sports reporter in the gaming world, as well as Matthew Fink, a disabled gamer who appreciates his inclusion into the gaming world.. She also reiterates her confidence in the support for her campaign. She also reiterates her position on the decriminalization of marijuana and intentions to vote yes on the upcoming marijuana initiative. . . For more, go to http://News2share.com. . Is Putin Key to Obama's War on ISIL?

Sep 15, 2014

As tensions mount in the Middle East, while simultaneously Russia's relationship with Western nations also declines, News2share contributor and political commentator Jon-Christopher Bua asks Josh Earnest about the role Russia can play. While The United States is allied with Iraq's new government in their war with ISIL, the Syrian government is much closer with Russia. After asking Josh Earnest what the Obama administration's take on the situation is, he gives his commentary on the current state of the relationships between the United States, Iraq, Russia, Syria, and ISIL.. . ISIS Killing of Brit, Americans "Ironic and Tragic" Says JC Bua

Sep 14, 2014

Following the ISIS killing of David Haines, so far the only Brit, both Barack Obama and David Cameron have reacted with a renewed drive to fight back with military force. He also discusses the motivations and the tragedy of these killings.. . For more, go to http:/News2share.com. . Produced by Ford Fischer

Obama Puts Foot Down, "We Are Going to War" Says JC Bua

Sep 12, 2014

White House commentator and political analyst Jon-Christopher Bua analyzes key points from Obama's speech, including his attempt to denigrate the public perception of the "Islamic State." He goes on to describe how the death of Steven Sotloff and James Foley have caused the public to support President Obama's war against ISIL. While President Obama and Secretary Kerry have repeatedly claimed that The United States is not at war with ISIL, Mr. Bua notes that "we are going forward into an era that involved war. However you cut it, we are going on some level to war.". . See more at http://news2share.com. . Produced by Ford Fischer and Trey Yingst. Edited by Ford Fischer

Students "Knit Bricks" to Protest Hobby Lobby Decision

Sep 9, 2014

The Secular Coalition for America is a nonprofit advocacy organization whose mission is to protect and strengthen the secular character of government. On Tuesday, September 9, they staged a march at the Supreme Court protesting the recent Hobby Lobby decision. This refers to the ruling that certain for-profit businesses can, on religious grounds, be exempted from the Obamacare requirement that health plans offered to workers include FDA-approved birth control with no co-pays.. . Members of the Secular Coalition for America, as well as students and DC residents, rallied for new legislation and social change. They created a knitted brick wall symbolizing their efforts to maintain separation between church and state. Protestors marched from the Supreme Court all the way to Capitol Hill, carrying their wall of knitted bricks. . . Produced and filmed by Taylor Kinzler and Andy Lalwani. Edited by Taylor Kinzler. . See more at http://News2share.com

"Dedicated Professionals Securing the Homeland" Says White House

Sep 9, 2014

When asked by Jon-Christopher Bua about the issue of 6000 immigrants who since having their documents expire have not been found, Press Secretary Josh Earnest had no details. Upon a followup, he tried to assure the press that DHS was working hard and that its task is "not a 9-5 job" but a 24/7 job. He then closed the meeting as reporters called for further followup.. . For more go to http://news2share.com. . Note, this video is from the White House's public live feed. News2share does not claim ownership to it, but is authorized to use it.

Thousands Rally at Penn State as Bowl Ban Lifted

Sep 8, 2014

Following the Jerry Sandusky scandal at Penn State in 2011, the university was given a number of different sanctions by the NCAA. Included in these sanctions was a fine of $60 million, a four-year postseason ban and vacating of all victories from 1998–2011.. . Today, the ban on postseason games was lifted. Students and players reacted positively to this news after years of controversy surrounding the ban. Many players and fans of Penn State felt the sanctions were unfair because they centered around one person, but affected the entire community.. . This video depicts the scene at Pennsylvania State College following the ban being lifted. Students gather in the streets to show their support for the team and the university. The rallies lasted for a number of hours and were attended by thousands of people.. . The videographer wished to remain anonymous.. . For more, go to http://News2share.com

Amidst Thunderstorms, Protestors Shut Down DC Streets

Sep 7, 2014

Thunder and rain would not be the only things you would hear if you were out last night on U Street in Washington DC. A diverse group of young protestors marched the streets of DC in solidarity with the Ferguson community and to demand long term change. They emphasized that "this is a movement, not a moment" and that Michael Brown's death, while important, was not the first or last of its kind. In total, the protestors managed to block U Street, Adams Morgan and Columbia Heights. Despite the disruption to local business, the protest remained peaceful and none of the demonstrators were arrested or detained.. Produced and Edited by Chelsea Smart

US, Russia "Could Start Building Up Arms Race Again" Says JC Bua

Sep 7, 2014

News2share contributor and political commentator Jon-Christopher Bua discusses the current situation in Ukraine, where varied reports have claimed that Russian troops and/or tanks have begun crossing the Eastern border. He discusses NATO and Europe's actions against Russia, primarily including economic sanctions, which have largely backfired economically. As the world's leaders try to appear strong for their countries, Bua analyzes Putin's possibilities on the world playing field and the possibility of a new arms race, or even a new Cold War.. See more at http://News2share.com. . Produced by Ford Fischer and Trey Yingst,. Edited by Fischer

Washington DC Students Hold Vigil for Gaza

Sep 4, 2014

American University Students for Justice in Palestine is a student-run organization that works in solidarity with the Palestinian people and supports what they see as their right to self-determination. On the night of Thursday, September 4, students gathered on the American University quad to participate in a peace vigil for Gaza. The event was to pay respect and mourn the over 2100 Gazan deaths from "Operation Protective Edge." Participants read the names of those who lost their lives as a way to memorialize them. . . Participants gathered in a circle as the names of those killed in Gaza were read off. Additionally, each participant held a photograph of a deceased person, which listed the date and the event in which they were killed.. . AU student and vigil participant Hannah Ross said, “This event, it wasn’t meant to be political or polarizing or anything, it’s really just to commemorate those lives that are lost.”. . Produced and Filmed by Lauren Clemence and Merdie Nicole. Edited by Lauren Clemence. . See more at https://News2share.com

New Mexico Ave. Fire Allegedly Started by American University Dept Head

Sep 4, 2014

Filmed by Trey Yingst, this video taken on his iPhone shows a fire allegedly set on New Mexico Avenue by David Pitts, the chair of the Department of Public Administration and Policy at American University. He was arrested tonight for the arson, and Fox says, "According to the incident report, Pitts set the fire and also pried open the back door of the building and burglarized it. The report says Pitts had a white cloth bag, newspaper, black liquid substance, rubber gloves, matches and lighters.". . See more at https://News2share.com

Ebola: Sierra Leone's New War

Sep 1, 2014

As Ebola in West Africa continues to infect and kill thousands of people, misinformation has many confused about the crisis. News2share sat down with Ambassador Bokari Stevens of Sierra Leone to find out exactly what is happening and what is being done to stop the spread of infection. Stevens compares this crisis to the civil war that was fought in Sierra Leone, calling it “very catastrophic and very devastating.”. . A survivor of that civil war, Salifu Kamara, also speaks out in this video about the Ebola crisis that has plagued his country. Kamara talks about the interpersonal connections between people in the region that has caused the disease to spread so quickly across West Africa. Both Kamara and the Ambassador plead for help as their country fights a new war.. . Produced by . Ford Fischer. Trey Yingst. . Cameras. Ford Fischer. Joanna Sobieski. Trey Yingst. . Featuring. Salifu Kamara. Bockari Kortu Stevens. . Edited by . Ford Fischer. . Additional Post-Production:. Evie Lacroix. Wallis Neff. Greg Perlman. . Footage Courtesy of:. AFP. CCTV. New York Times. He also notes that, on the other hand, he would like to encourage other European countries to participate in this fight, financially and militarily.. Code Pink Advocates "Hoops, Not Bombs" at White House.

Aug 22, 2014

Code Pink, an anti-war women's organization known for their protests against U.S. military interventionalism and violence, organized an upbeat rally on August 21st to advocate "hoops, not bombs." While with varying degrees of expertise, people assembled to hula hoop as a way to peacefully and creatively express their dissatisfaction with the United States' military campaigns abroad as well as police militarization at home. Such campaigns include military aid to Israel, airstrikes against targets in Iraq, and many more. Lauren Clemence filmed the event, and spoke to Alli McCracken, Code Pink's National organizer, who underscored the contrast between the somber tone of some of their events and the upbeat tone of this one, while their overall message remains consistent.. . Produced and Filmed by Lauren Clemence. Edited by Ford Fischer

Aug 19, 2014

Following a brief peaceful march, once again protestors in Ferguson were met by police who used tear gas to disperse them, saying that if they stood still together, then they would be "unlawfully assembled."

Peace Officer Points Shotgun at News2share Reporter

Aug 19, 2014

As protestors and police face off in an increasingly tense situation in Ferguson, News2share's Trey Yingst and other reporters who managed to escape the "designated reporting area" ended up filming from between the two sides of the conflict. (The reporting area is where police had journalists cover the riots without being anywhere near them.) During the tense standoff, one officer pointed a shotgun directly into the group of reporters and yelled for them to "get down."

Heavily Armed Police Arrest Ferguson Protestor, Retreat

Aug 19, 2014

In Ferguson, Trey Yingst captures a moment where police rush forward to make an arrest, but then quickly retreat as they're surrounded.

Reporter Gassed by Police, Recovers in Ferguson

Aug 19, 2014

One reporter during the chaos last night in Ferguson took a face full of tear gas last night. According to Trey Yingst who was wearing a mask and got to the scene quickly, the reporters were standing together in one area and police threw a canister directly into their group. One reporter, seen here, got it in his eyes and throat, and other reporters are quick to help him.

Sonic Weapon Used to Push Back Reporters, Protestors

Aug 19, 2014

Police make use of a "sonic weapon" which emits a painful, high-frequency ringing onto a crowd to push them back in Ferguson. While it may seem like a comparatively gentle attack, the technology has been known to cause permanent hearing damage.

Ferguson Police Threaten Arrest, Immediately Fire

Aug 18, 2014

Police in Ferguson attempt to push back crowds and force them to disperse, and in a moment just sent by News2share's Trey Yingst, immediately following telling them they'd be subject to arrest, the officers fire gas cartridges at them.

Police arrest protestors assembling outside the McDonalds in Ferguson, a site of looting last night. News2share's Trey Yingst caught it on video but was then pushed back by an officer. Trey tells us:. "The police did not want these arrests to be filmed. I was pushed multiple times by officers and was threatened with arrest. Police have no restraints now with National Guard coming in."

The protests have predominantly made headlines at night when the police fight back aggressively, but today there seems to be a large gathering, foreboding a chaotic night in Ferguson.

Aug 17, 2014

News2share's Trey Yingst interviews Martin Luther King III, son of civil rights icon Martin Luther King Jr. They discuss the death of Michael Brown, and how a more diverse police force and a shift to community policing could fix some of the problems in law enforcement today. Additionally, he notes that "It appears Michael Brown was executed."

The late Michael Brown's uncle speaks about the value that the community's efforts have brought, and expresses his dissatisfaction of police's handling of the events. This comes only one week after the death of his nephew, and amidst violent protests in Ferguson.

Aug 17, 2014

Saying that African Americans are given "first class jails and second class schools," Jesse Jackson sounds off to Trey Yingst of News2share about the problems of race and law enforcement in America. Jackson makes a point to emphasize the connections to other deaths such as those of Trayvon Martin and Eric Garner

Ferguson Protestors Sent Running From Tear Gas, Rubber Bullets

Aug 17, 2014

During the state-imposed curfew, protestors attempt to stay on the streets but are shot back by tear gas canisters and rubber bullets.

[Full Exchange] Ron Johnson Faces Off Against Masked Protestor

Aug 17, 2014

In a heated but ultimately civil exchange, one masked protestor in Ferguson dialogued with Captain Ron Johnson for nearly five minutes about the death of Michael Brown, and the community's dissatisfaction with its resolve. Johnson iterated the need for civility and conversation, while claiming that the investigation was underway. The protestor, who ultimately removed his mask, seemed unconvinced but willing to listen. Only minutes after this civil exchange, police were firing bullets and tear gas on protestors who refused to leave.

Smoke and Tear Gas Fired Non-Stop At Ferguson Protestors

Aug 17, 2014

Smoke and tear gas deployed as protestors break curfew in Ferguson. Over 100 protesters clashed with police, but many ran when smoke and gas was fired. Trey Yingst managed to get an exclusive angle from the middle of this exchange. This comes only hours after the police claimed to the public that tear gas would not be used to enforce the curfew. Trey wore a gas mask as he watched and recorded.

Breaking: Police Use Tear Gas, Rubber Bullets to Enforce Curfew in Ferguson

Aug 16, 2014

Despite promises earlier today from the Highway Police not to enforce their curfew using tear gas, moments ago tear gas canisters filled the streets.

50-100 Protestors Violate Curfew in Ferguson

Aug 16, 2014

Between 50-100 protestors violated the curfew in Ferguson on the night of August 18th despite threats by police of mass arrests. Unconfirmed reports claim that some of the protestors are armed.

Aug 16, 2014

A masked protester in Ferguson confronts Missouri Highway Patrol Captain Ron Johnson on August 17 about events in the town during the past week.

News2share Trailer - Your World, Your News

Aug 6, 2014

Founded by two American University Students, News2share.com allows anyone in the world with newsworthy video to send it to us and share it with the world. We've received video and reported from Ukraine, Uganda, Israel, The Gaza Strip, and all over the United States. If you have video to submit, or if you want to be a part of our team, email us at contact@news2share.com. Your World, Your News. News2share.. . Produced by Ford Fischer. Seen From Above, 10k+ March Through Washington for Gaza

Aug 3, 2014

Submitted by Sarah Soliman, this video taken from a high angle is able to demonstrate the sheer size of the crowd on yesterday's Palestinian march on Washington. Estimates had it that between 10,000 and 30,000 people participated, and this video certainly lends legitimacy to that claim.. . Sarah told me: "I attended this protest as a part of GMU Students Against Israeli Apartheid, and the collective DMV SJP, in order to condemn the egregious crimes and human rights violations committed by Israel towards the Palestinian people in alarming disproportionality. As a member of GMU SAIA, as an Egyptian-American, I choose to stand on the side of justice with the oppressed (Palestinians), and against the oppressors and implementors of apartheid (Israel). This is a matter of fact and morality, where there is a clear line between who is doing the oppressing and who is the oppressed. This rally serves to bring attention to this issue and to call for support and solidarity for Palestine, as well as an end to the atrocious apartheid policies and crimes of Israel. Also might I add that not only did I see Palestinian flags, but also a plethora of Free Syrian Flags, Iraqi Flags, Turkish Flags and Egyptian Flags. This shows the vast nuances of diverse solidarity for Palestine. Its important to remember that "in a genuine struggle for liberation, there is no room for double standards and selective indignation, you support"; when one country or people calls for help, you help, regardless of what country or circumstances you hail from."

Israelis Wave Flags, Chant Support for Israel

Aug 3, 2014

Submitted by Avraham Bloch in Sderot, a group of Israeli citizens come together to chant and waive glads to support Israel. Sderot is less than 2 km from the border into Gaza.

Rockets Brighten the Israel/Gaza Border's Night Sky

Aug 3, 2014

Submitted by Avraham Bloch in Sderot, Israel, these videos show the sights and sounds of rockets being fired back and forth over the Israel/Gaza border. Rocket-fire there is relatively common, with missiles traveling both directions.

Immigrant Rights Leader Speaks Against Violence in Gaza

Aug 2, 2014

Khalilah Sabra, executive director of the MAS Immigrant Justice and Legal Clinic, excites the crowd before they march on Washington by discussing the violence happening in Gaza, and how she sees it conflicting with American values.

10k+ Palestine Supporters March on Washington

Aug 2, 2014

Today, between 10,000 and 30,000 (estimations varied) protestors marched on Washington to express their concerns about U.S. support for Israel.. Filmed by Ford Fischer and Alejandro Alvarez, edited by Fischer. Special thanks to Sean Wheeler

Protestors Face off Against Police, Leader Calms Down Crowd

Aug 2, 2014

Following the arrest of one of their fellow protestors, the pro-Palestine crowd began pushing at the barricade screaming, "Let him go!" until one of their leaders managed to talk them down.

Protestors Throw Caskets Outside Washington Post Office

Aug 2, 2014

Apparently disappointed in how the Washington Post has been covering the Israel/Palestine conflict, protestors today chanted at their office and places fake caskets in front of their door with Palestinian flags attached.

Palestine Supporter "Dies In" at White House

Aug 2, 2014

Sitting in front of the White House, one girl who wishes to remain unknown flaunts a brutal injury which was intended to replicate what she sees as a typical would incurred by children in Gaza at the hands of IDF. This was part of the ceremonial "Die In" where protestors would lie down and act dead in solidarity with Palestinians.

Cornel West: "We won't stand for annihilation" in Palestine

Aug 2, 2014

For more, go to News2share.com! Subscribe above to get all of our coverage on the Palestine/Israel conflict!. Democratic Socialist philosopher Cornell West speaks at the pro-Palestinian march on Washington, where he juxtaposes issues facing Palestinians to issues facing African Americans in The United States today.. Filmed by Ford Fischer (@fordfischer on twitter)

D.C. Palestine Protest Turns Physical

Aug 2, 2014

When one protestor today at the pro-Palestine march on Washington began to climb up a light pole in an effort to put a Palestinian flag there, a police officer was waiting for him when he slid down. Upon him being arrested, protestors began screaming for his release and pushing against the barricade, where police used batons and horses to fight the crowd. . Filmed by Ford Fischer and Alejandro Alvarez, . Edited by Fischer

Protesters Burn Israeli Flag

Aug 2, 2014

While marching towards the White House, Palestinian supporters begin to burn a fla of Israel, but are soon stopped by one of their leaders who asserts that this is not the way for them to present their message.. Filmed by Alejandro Alvarez

Market Basket Employees Protest New CEO

Aug 2, 2014

Derek Zagami, aka "Derek Z" contributes a report to News2share from a Market Basket in Massachusetts, where employees of the grocery store chain are protesting the new CEO. The old CEO, Arthur T. Demoulas, had a reputation for successful business while simultaneously treating his workers well, paying them way above market rate. The new co-CEOS, Felicia Thornton and James Gooch, are percieved as being much more driven by profits and less altruistic towards workers. Produced by Derek Zagami

Parks Police Arrest 100+ in White House Anti-Deportation Rally

Jul 31, 2014

Filmed by Alejandro Alvarez, more than 100, including many clergy, were arrested in front of the White House on Thursday in a protest against Obama's response to the undocumented immigrant crisis on the border. A group of activists staged a sit-in along the White House's north fence. Hundreds of others looked from behind police barricades, chanting "Si se puede!" (Yes we can!) and "No estan solos!" (They are not alone!), as the others were arrested by National Park Service police for obstructing foot traffic.

Josh Earnest Asked About Russian Action to Remove Sanctions

Jul 31, 2014

White House commentator and News2share contributor Jon-Christopher Bua questions Josh Earnest as to the actual action that President Obama expects from Vladimir Putin in light of the recent sanctions against Russia. This comes after Russian separatists allegedly shot down a passenger airliner over Eastern Ukraine and the White House claims that Putin is personally responsible for fortifying the separatists.. Note: This video features a question asked by a News2share contributor but was not filmed by News2share. The video is publicly published by the White House.

Child Refugees Tour Through Gaza U.N. School

In the midst of shelling and rocket-fire in Gaza, children and families seek shelter at the Al-Ramal U.N. school. Trey Yingst is shown through the school by the young children there who are seeking refuge. However, schools like this aren't entirely safe. Reuters reports today that there was a deadly attack on Jabalya Girls Elementary today, leaving 15 dead and about 100 wounded.. Edited by Ford Fischer

Additionally, he takes an exclusive look at a room in Sderot Police Station where all of the rockets Hamas has fired on the town are collected.. Edited by Ford Fischer

Protesters in Bethlehem Pushed back by Gas, Rubber Bullets

Jul 26, 2014

Pro-Palestinian protestors attempted to march in Bethlehem to protest the Israeli State's treatment of Gaza, but with fewer numbers than their Jerusalem counterparts earlier this week, they are pushed back by gas and rubber bullets. Even the videographer, Trey Yingst, found it hard to breathe for hours after ingesting the Israeli Police's tear gas.

Press Secretary Josh Earnest addresses these concerns and makes it clear that he wouldn't be surprised if Speaker of the House John Boehner would support such action. . Produced by Ford Fischer

Josh Earnest, Jon-Christopher Bua Discuss Kerry's Israel Trip

Jul 25, 2014

With Jon Kerry currently in the Middle East attempting to negotiate a cease-fire between Hamas and Israeli forces, political commentator Jon-Christopher Bua asks Josh Earnest what Kerry is prepared to offer. Since his trip began, no such cease-fire has come about, and many people have died as the violence continues. Bua weighs in on the implications of the trip and another option which could yield a more peaceful outcome.. Produced by Ford Fischer
