Happening Now: Israel West Bank Protest

Jul 24, 2014

Sent from News2share reporter Trey Yingst, these images show simply what he could send us from his iPhone of the protest at West Bank, where so far (as of 8:20PM EST) 3 Palestinians have been killed. Though the Israeli army hasn't confirmed, Trey said they are using live rounds and that there were "snipers in all directions" before getting off the phone. These images show what he first saw there, particularly a Molotov cocktail thrown by Palestinians at Israeli police. HD video on the way later tonight.

Trey specifically focused on Al Shifa Hospital, where doctors hardly have the resources to handle the influx of patients coming in amidst the attack.. Filming and Reporting by Trey Yingst. "Red Line" Reports from NoMa's Summer Film Series

Jul 17, 2014

Submitted by the independent show "Red Line," produced by Danielle Green and Camila DeChalus.. Every summer, NoMa hosts a film screening series for 13 weeks. The weekly event boasts audiences up to 500+. An event for all ages.. Filmed by Danielle Green

Israeli Gas Station Burning Following Missile Strike

Jul 17, 2014

Submitted by Gabrielle Lamport, this footage shows a gas station in Ashdod, Israel which had just been struck by a Gazan missile. . Lamport told me: "I would say that this is definitely not the vacation I was anticipating. Everyone in Israel, especially in the south, is basically confined to their homes lately because there have been thousands of rockets falling as well as terrorists coming in through underground tunnels. Business has definitely gone down for most places that don't offer necessary services here because people try to stay near bomb shelters as often as possible. At first I was okay but after the failed ceasefires it's gotten more scary, like the other day I had to stop on the side the road and huddle next to my car and watch the rockets hit nearby. Despite all this I have to say I know I'm very lucky because Israel has made it the law that every building must have a bomb shelter and we also have the Iron Dome to protect us. The innocent people of Gaza aren't as lucky however, I try to remind myself every time I run to a bomb shelter that at least my government is working to protect me and not putting me in the line of fire like Hamas does to Palestinians. I know some people might not think it's true but most Israelis I speak to feel essentially the same way, we realize how lucky we are to be so protected and we worry about what is happening to the innocent people who are stuck living under Hamas. As you know we just initiated our ground operation tonight, the purpose of it is to eliminate the terror tunnels which we can't do from the air. The ground operation has worsened the morale here as everyone has at least a relative or friend or two who now has to go into Gaza, so the whole country is basically biting their nails and hoping it's all over quickly!"

Leading Anti-Zionist Rabbi Speaks Against Israeli State

Jul 17, 2014

Rabbi Yisroel Dovid Weiss, an anti-zionist Rabbi speaks to News2share at the 7/16 Palestinian demonstration at the White House. He explains how he sees the current actions of Israelites as inconsistent with that of Judaism and how he believes Jewish teachings do not support the current, or any, Israeli state.. . [Raw Footage] Israel Residents Run to Local Bomb Shelter

Jul 11, 2014

Contributed by Nicole Ross in Israel, this video, taken only hours ago, shows civilians running to the nearest bomb shelter due to the impending threat of an upcoming attack.. Nicole told me: "Today, right around the time of this attack was the start of the sabbath which is important for every Jewish family. I personally was preparing Shabbat dinner with my grandmother when the alarm went off. As you see many people ran from their homes to get to the bombshelter, which by the way they only have 40 seconds, but unfortunately my grandmother cannot walk far distances and so when the alarm goes off she stays in her home which is no real protection whatsoever and I refuse to leave my grandmother alone. The alarm has gone off countless times in the past four days and many people are stuck with the same situation as my grandmother and I. . Imagine having only 40 seconds to stay alive.". Filmed by Nicole Ross. Edited by Ford Fischer

Raw Footage: Israeli Rockets Intercept Gazan Attack

Jul 11, 2014

Contributed by Nicole Ross in Israel, this footage taken on an iPhone shows 8 Israeli rockets being fired to intercept a strike from Gaza. Nicole said, "This is the reality in Israel today. Over 400 rockets have been fired throughout Israel in the past four days and it needs to stop... Seven out of the eight iron domes launched in this video hit the rockets shot from Gaza but the 8th rocket had a direct hit on a civilians car. Thankfully no one was hurt.". Filmed by Nicole Ross. Edited By Ford Fischer

Scenes from 2014 D.C. Independence Day Parade

Contributed by Trey Yingst, Alejandro Alvarez, Danielle Green and Wallis Neff, this footage includes some of the highlights from the Washington D.C. Independence Day Parade. The parade featured multiple bands as well as military brigades.

"NJ Weedman" on Jury Nullification in Pound of Marijuana Case

Jul 4, 2014

While smoking a joint in front of the State Department building, Ed Forchion, aka "NJ Weedman" talks to Trey Yingst and Wallis Neff about a previous case in which he was caught with a pound of marijuana, and had a hung jury. When in a retrial, all 12 jurors believed the law was wrong as despite being caught with a pound of marijuana, the "Weedman" went free.

"New Jersey Weedman" on Jail, Cogressional Run

Jul 4, 2014

Outside the State Department building Ed Forchion, aka "The New Jersey Weedman" talks about his recent experience at the Burlington County Jail in New Jersey where he helped broke the story about an inmate who was allegedly neglected to death. He then talks about how this played into his recent run for Congress in New Jersey, where both Republicans and Democrats blocked him from the ballot.. Filmed by Trey Yingst. Production Assistant: Wallis Neff

Medical Marijuana User Detained for Possession in Washington D.C.

Jul 4, 2014

Ed Forchion, aka "The New Jersey Weedman" and his friend Daniel Price, who both have medical marijuana licenses, attempted to go to Washington D.C. where Forchion would be speaking at an event. While going through a security checkpoint, Price was detained for bringing his medical marijuana onto federal property where it is illegal to possess. Forchion gave us this statement afterwards:. "This is a example of The irrational war on drugs at its finest - here on the lawn of our capital citizens arrested and persecuted for a plant! This is the reason we now lead the world in the imprisoned we are not the bastion of a Freedom we once were - Return freedom to America / End the drug war.". Filmed by Trey Yingst. Production Assistant: Wallis Neff. Edited by Ford Fischer

Soccer Fans Assemble in D.C. for United States vs Belgium

Soccer fans assembled today all around Washington D.C. to watch the United States face Belgium in the 2014 World Cup. Alejandro Alvarez films the crowd cheering and remaining hopeful throughout the game, which eventually resulted in a 2-0 victory for Belgium.

Benghazi Attack Suspect Arrives in Washington D.C.

Jun 29, 2014

Ahmed Abu Khatallah, accused of involvement in the deadly attacks on a U.S. diplomatic facility in Benghazi in 2012, entered a not guilty plea at the E. Barrett Prettyman courthouse in Washington, D.C. He was charged with manslaughter and conspiracy to provide material support to terrorism resulting in death, with more charges likely on the way. Wallis Neff, in her first contribution to News2share, was able to speak to reporters who gave their first-hand account to what they saw in the courtroom. Ahmed Abu Khatallah was not able to be filmed or photographed and plead not guilty on all charges.. . Filmed and Edited by Wallis Neff. . As seen at http://jpupdates.com/2014/06/29/benghazi-terror-suspect-appears-court-pleads-guilty/

Though he was sentenced to probation, recently, he was charged with crimes related to drugs and guns. In this exclusive News2share interview segment, Kokesh speaks about the gun incident as well as the subsequent SWAT raid that led to these charges.

Ukrainian Deaths in the East Could've Been Prevented Says Ukrainian Presidential Candidate

Ukrainian Presidential Candidate, Dymtro Yarosh, gives an exclusive interview to News2share.com and says that deaths in Ukraine could have been prevented. The full interview can be found at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ApqeuDDk4Jg. . "That's a yes, For example yesterday the head of the military department said there were no guns where they were located," he said, "Then terrorists just came too close and shot right out near that place."

Ukrainian Presidential Candidate Warns of Third Revolution

Ukrainian Presidential Candidate, Dymtro Yarosh, gives an exclusive interview to news2share.com. In the interview, Yarosh warns that if election results are inflated, a third Maiden Revolution could occur. The full interview can be found at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ApqeuDDk4Jg. . He says: "I would suggest that it could begin a third stage of revolution because the one here is just coming to power could be taken out of power for their actions."

Ukrainian Presidential Candidate: "Putin, go away!"

Ukrainian Presidential Candidate Blames Government for not Doing Enough

May 24, 2014

Ukrainian Presidential Candidate, Dymtro Yarosh, gives an exclusive interview to News2share.com. The full interview can be found at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ApqeuDDk4Jg. He says that: "For now the fighting is still going on, but it's a beating in Kiev without the force of government. It doesn't help them, but they act a little bit squabbly and we don't give them enough support." "For example, there was a man asking for help for a long time, but help came too late and they lost people because of that."

News2share Goes to Ukraine: Day 4

May 23, 2014

Trey gives an update on his time in Ukraine, specifically focusing on his interview with Ukrainian Presidential Candidate. Dymtro Yarosh which can be found at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ApqeuDDk4Jg

[Full interview] Ukrainian Presidential Candidate Warns of Third Revolution

May 23, 2014

Ukrainian Presidential Candidate, Dymtro Yarosh, gives an exclusive interview to news2share.com. In the interview, Yarosh warns that if election results are inflated, a third Maiden Revolution could occur. Additionally, he blames the government for Ukrainian soldiers dying in the Eastern part of the country.. . Highlights:. At 3:20, he says how their government's lack of sufficient response is responsible for many of the casualties Ukraine has experienced.. At 7:10, he is asked what he'd say to Russian President Vladamir Putin if Putin were there right now, and his answer was "Putin, go away!" . At 11:15, he discusses the possibility of an outcome which could lead to a "third revolution.". At 15:40, he thanks the United States and Barrack Obama specifically for their support.

Ukrainian Protesters Recount Violence in Kiev

May 23, 2014

Trey Yingst of News2share.com reports from Kiev, Ukraine, where he speaks to two participants in the recent riots in Kiev. Both describe their protesting which led to an escalation of tension with police and ultimately bloodshed.. . Special Thanks to Wallis Neff. Edited by Ford Fischer. . Disclaimer: This video contains historical footage from a number of news organizations to better illustrate the experiences of the two people interviewed. They are not necessarily the exact moments described but are taken from the same events and aligned as well as reasonably possible. The other news organizations all have their logos remaining and citations added as needed and qualify as fair use for educational/news purposes.

'Operation American Spring' Protesters March on White House

May 16, 2014

Members of the Tea Party and other conservative groups assembled for Operation American Spring on March 16, marching from the National Mall to the Capitol and White House. Demonstrators called for the impeachment of President Obama and the removal of other government officials, including Vice President Joe Biden and House Speaker John Boehner.. . See photos of the event taken by Alejandro Alvarez at: http://news2share.com/start/2014/05/17/tea-party-protesters-march-on-white-house-video-and-photos/. . Filmed and Contributed by Alejandro Alvarez. Edited by Ford Fischer

President Obama Heads to Arkansas

May 7, 2014

President Barack Obama travels to Arkansas to view the devastation from the recent tornadoes and severe storms and meet with the families affected by this disaster, as well as first responders and recovery workers. Produced by Trey Yingst of News2share.com.

President Obama, Secretary Duncan Recognize the National Teacher of the Year

May 1, 2014

Today, May 1st, President Barack Obama and Secretary of Education Arne Duncan presented Sean McComb with the National Teacher of the Year award. McComb is an English teacher from Maryland. This package includes interviews with Secretary Duncan and Mr. McComb.. . Produced by Trey Yingst and Ford Fischer of News2share.com

Barack Obama Presents National Teacher of the Year Award

May 1, 2014

President Barack Obama along with Secretary of Education Arne Duncan, present the National Teacher of the Year Award to Sean McComb Baltimore's Patapsco High School and Center for the Arts. Obama begins with a speech about the state of education as a whole and the importance of passionate teachers, then hands it over to Mr. McComb who explains what inspired him to be so passionate about teaching.. . Filmed by Ford Fischer. Produced by Ford Fischer and Trey Yingst

Several Latino Protesters Arrested Outside the White House

May 1, 2014

Filmed by Trey Yingst and Ford Fischer, this raw footage details a protest and subsequent mass arrest in front of the White House lawn. Thousands of protestors collected in front of the White House to ask for immigration reform from President Barack Obama. After about ten minutes, park police announced that the sidewalk and street were "closed" and began using horses and wooden batons to force the crowd back. Several protestors sat and refused to exit the area, and at 20 minutes into the video, the park police back a truck up towards them and use zip-ties to arrest them one by one.. . We encourage other publications to embed this video, please credit News2share.com

Prospective Students Reconsidering American University Following Leaked E-mails

Apr 24, 2014

A number of prospective students are reconsidering coming to American University following a series of e-mails that were leaked last week. Additionally, current students marched in protest of the administrations lack of action. These e-mails detailed sexual assaults and drug sales by EI, a former fraternity on campus. Students want those responsible to be held accountable.. . As seen on. . http://www.theeagleonline.com/article/2014/04/administration-reacts-to-leaked-ei-emails. . http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/04/24/american-university-underground-frat-ei_n_5206728.html. . Produced by Trey Yingst and Ford Fischer. Edited by Ford Fischer. . We welcome other media outlets to embed our video; please credit "News2share.com"

Those Who Fight - A Call for Action

Apr 24, 2014

This short documentary briefly details the events surrounding the death of Robert Taylor, an elderly homeless man who died in December 2013 in the Burlington County Jail in New Jersey. The county has stated they did nothing wrong, but there are those who believe Mr. Taylor was neglected to death. In particular, Sean Turzanski, a former inmate who was in the cell next door to Taylor, speaks about what he saw and why he is now fighting for further investigation.. We will be releasing a feature version of this documentary later this summer. It will include further interviews including legal experts as well as Ed Forchion, aka "The New Jersey Weedman" who was instrumental in initially releasing this story to the public while Mr. Turzanski was still at the jail.. . Filmed and Produced by Ford Fischer and Trey Yingst. Edited by Ford Fischer. . We encourage members of the media to embed this video into their articles.. . Contact for quotes or more information:. Ford Fischer: Fordfischer@news2share.com. Trey Yingst: Treyyingst@news2share.com. . We have the rights to use all music included.. FreeMusicArchive.com

National Zoo Shooting Witnesses Describe Scene

Apr 21, 2014

Brianna Jenkins and Paris Thompson react to the shooting at the National Zoo. April 21st 2014.. See the full story at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UpSAQI6TIX8. Produced by Trey Yingst and Ford Fischer

Breaking - Shooting Outside National Zoo

Apr 21, 2014

Witnesses respond to a shooting that occurred just after 5:00 p.m. at the Smithsonian National Zoo. Additionally, the DC Metropolitan Police Department gives a statement about the victims. April 21st 2014.. . Produced by Trey Yingst and Ford Fischer

Exonerated Death Row Inmate Speaks Out

Apr 17, 2014

Kirk Bloodsworth, the first death row inmate ever to be exonerated by DNA evidence speaks at American University. He discusses new measures to prevent innocent people from being executed, as well as his book: Bloodsworth: the True Story of the First Death Row Inmate Exonerated by DNA. He is also currently working on a film about his life: Bloodsworth: An Innocent Man.. Filmed by Ford Fischer of News2share.com. in association with theeagleonline.com.. http://www.theeagleonline.com/article/2014/04/53508bb09ac20

Interview with First Death Row Inmate Exonerated by DNA Evidence

Apr 17, 2014

Kirk Bloodworth, the first person ever to be exonerated from death row based on DNA evidence, speaks to Sean Meehan about his experience and what he hopes society can learn from his story. Specifically, he promotes abolishing the death penalty and raising awareness for causes like the Innocence Project as well as the upcoming film about his life: Bloodsworth: An Innocent Man.. This interview filmed in collaboration with the Eagle:. http://www.theeagleonline.com/article/2014/04/53508bb09ac20

Tanzanian Ambassador Reflects on Rwandan Genocide Anniversary

Apr 17, 2014

In an interview with News2share.com Tanzanian Ambassador to the United States, Her Excellency Liberata Mulamula, discusses the 20th anniversary of the Rwandan genocide.. . Produced by Trey Yingst and Ford Fischer

Aaron Carter Discusses Brother's Wedding, Hints at New Album

Apr 12, 2014

News2share interviews Aaron Carter and shows him performing his hit song "I Want Candy." He also discusses his recent tours, hints at a new album, and comments on his brother's wedding. Featured on travelpulse.com at: http://www.travelpulse.com/news/entertainment/aaron-carter-misses-brother-nick-carters-wedding-due-to-travel-delays.html. Produced by Trey Yingst and Ford Fischer

Man Stabbed Blocks From DC Parade Transported to Hospital [Video]

Apr 12, 2014

(AP) - An ambulance transports an injured man through the 2014 Cherry Blossom Parade area.. . Police say the man was stabbed near the National Mall a few blocks from the National Cherry Blossom Festival Parade route.. . The incident was reported just after 11 a.m. Saturday near 2nd Street and Constitution Avenue. The parade was underway at the time on Constitution Avenue.. . Police say the man was taken to a hospital with non-life-threatening injuries. No information was released on the suspect.

Former NSA Director Debates Journalist Involved in Snowden Leaks

Apr 5, 2014

Featuring General Michael Hayden (former director of CIA and NSA) and Barton Gellman (participant in the Edward Snowden surveillance leaks) debate at American University about the balance between security and liberty, government and free press.. Filmed by Ford Fischer

Following an introduction from Michelle Obama, President Barrack Obama took the stage to congratulate olympians as well as remarking on the bravery of the men and women in the military and speaking about the recent Fort Hood shooting.

Miss America 2003 Speaks at CPAC

Mar 10, 2014

Erika Harold, aka Miss America 2003 speaks at CPAC about conservatism, faith and the Constitution. She goes on to describe her ambition, and an overcoming of her own party's intolerance of her ideas.

"FREEDOM!" Author Adam Kokesh Speaks at CPAC

Mar 9, 2014

Adam Kokesh, a Libertarian activist who was arrested last year for loading a shotgun in freedom plaza, discusses why he is at CPAC and his future, including his new book "FREEDOM!" which can be found at http://adamvstheman.com/freedom. This is a followup from News2share's previous interview with Adam, which was featured on the homepage of CNN. http://ireport.cnn.com/docs/DOC-1075537. . Filmed and Produced by Ford Fischer. Author JD Ludwig Speaks about "Overreach: Blood of Patriots"

Mar 9, 2014

Reporting from CPAC, JD Ludwig, author of "Overreach: Blood of Patriots" discusses the book, and how despite being fiction, it has something to say about the real world and its possible future. We discuss the possibility of an overbearing government, a second American Civil War, and anonymous. . . Filmed by Sarah Harvard. Produced by and Featuring Ford Fischer. jdludwig.com. . The book can be found at http://www.amazon.com/dp/1494387646/

Sarah Palin's Version of Green Eggs and Ham

Mar 8, 2014

Filmed by Ford Fischer @fordfischer . In light of Ted Cruz's reading of Dr. Suess during the Obamacare filibuster, Tea Party Republican and former Vice Presidential Nominee Sarah Palin recites her slightly adopted take of the story at the 2014 Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC).. . For her full speech go to: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cUbe31YiG7Q. . It reads:. I do not like this Uncle Sam, I do not like his health care scam;. I do not like these dirty crooks or how they lie and cook the books;. I do not like when Congress steals, I do not like their crony deals;. I do not like this buy-in man, I do not like 'oh yes we can';. I do not like this spending spree, we're smart, we know there's nothing free;. I do not like reporters' smug replies when I complain about their lies;. I do not like this kind of hope and we won't take it 'nope, nope, nope'

Full "Beyond Religion: Ethics for the Whole World" Dalai Lama Speech

Mar 7, 2014

Filmed and edited by @fordfischer, this video shows the entire March 7th speech given by Tenzin Gyatso, the 14th Dalai Lama. In it, he discusses the importance of global tolerance and rejection of violence, as well as the need for morality to be included in education.. . Produced by Ford Fischer and Trey Yingst

Full "Imperial Overreach and the National Security State" Panel

Feb 16, 2014

@fordfischer of http://news2share.com filmed this panel featuring Academy Award Winning Director Oliver Stone and currently up for an Academy Award documentarian Jeremy Scahill take the spotlight in this full panel on the overbearing use of force in the United States Government. Peter Kuznick, an American University Professor who co-produces "Untold History of the Unites States" with Oliver Stone weighed in as well, offering a historic and academic opinion. "There are not two parties [Republican and Democrats]... there is only the war party, and those who oppose it," they agreed.

D.C. Mayoral Candidates Face Off At American University

Feb 13, 2014

On February 12 The Kennedy Political Union hosted the 2014 D.C. Democratic Primary Mayoral Debate at American University. . . CANDIDATES:. . Tommy Wells, Ward 6 District Councilman. Vincent Orange, At-Large District Councilman. Reta Jo Lewis, former State Department official. Jack Evans, Ward 2 District Councilman. Carlos Allen, musician and promoter. Andy Shallal, artist, activist and proprietor of Busboys and Poets. . DEBATE MODERATOR: . Tom Sherwood (NBC4 -- WRC). . MEDIA PANEL: . Matt Ackland (FOX5 -- WTTG). Sam Ford (ABC7 -- WJLA). . Filmed by: Trey Yingst and Ford Fischer. Edited by: Ford Fischer. News2Share.com

Decriminalization Bill Sponsor Admits to Marijuana Use

Feb 12, 2014

Tommy Wells, a candidate for D.C. Mayor, who also sponsors the bill to decriminalize marijuana in The District, proudly admits to having smoked pot in his youth.. Watch the full interview here:. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RW0zMhzdKrw. . A special thanks to the Kennedy Political Union.

Terrorist Expert Discusses Terrorist Threats Towards Sochi Olympics

Feb 7, 2014

American University Professor Joseph Young from the Department of Justice, Law and Society discusses the challenges faced by Russia at the olympics including recent attacks and threats by the terrorist group known as "Black Widow.". . Produced and Filmed by Trey Yingst. Filmed and Edited by Ford Fischer. Featuring Joseph Young, Ph.D.
